original: dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: and the arhat.

original: de la rgyun du @258b zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rgyun du @258b zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The stream enterer is of two types:

original: 'di ltar re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa dang / rigs nas rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa dang / rigs nas rigs so //
translated: the one who takes rebirth in cyclic existence for a maximum of seven existences and the one who transmigrates among gods and humans for seven rebirths.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni gcig ste /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni gcig ste /
translated: The once returner is of one type:

original: 'di ltar bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: the one who has one separation.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /🔽'di ltar bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni rnam pa lnga ste / 'di ltar bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: The nonreturner is of five types:

original: gong du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'o //
translated: the one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state, the one who attains nirvana as soon as birth, the one who attains nirvana with preparation, the one who attains nirvana without preparation and the one who migrates to a higher state.

original: dgra bcom pa ni rnam pa drug ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni rnam pa drug ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The arhat is of six types:🔽the one who regresses, the one intent on resolve, the one protected by his resolve, the one who is steadfast, the one who is capable of penetrating insight and the one who is immovable.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang / mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang / mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: One who is subject to complete degeneration, one who is subject to death, one who guards the path, one who is unshakable, one who is capable of penetrating insight, and one who is perfected.

original: de la gang 'bras bu dus su dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag de ni dad pas lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang 'bras bu dus su dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag de ni dad pas lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: One who is a faith-follower at the time of the result is a person resolute in faith.

original: gang 'bras bu dus su chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba de ni mthong bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu dus su chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba de ni mthong bas thob pa'o //
translated: One who is a Dharma-follower at the time of the result is one who obtains results by insight.

original: gang slob pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi bsam gtan pa'i gang zag phyir mi 'ong ba de ni lus kyis mngon du byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang slob pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi bsam gtan pa'i gang zag phyir mi 'ong ba de ni lus kyis mngon du byed pa ste /
translated: One who is a learner and a nonreturner who is absorbed in the eight liberations is one who manifests with the body.

original: rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon du byas shing snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon du byas shing snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who manifests the liberations with the body enters meditative attainment, one is called one who manifests with the body.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni bshad zin dang bshad par bya'o ;
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni bshad zin dang bshad par bya'o ;
translated: The eight liberations have been explained and will be explained.

original: / gang zhig zag pa zad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi bsam gtan pa ma yin pa de ni shes rab rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: / gang zhig zag pa zad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi bsam gtan pa ma yin pa de ni shes rab rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: One who has exhausted the contaminants but is not absorbed in the eight liberations is liberated by wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa tsam lhag ma med par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa tsam lhag ma med par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has completely abandoned the obscurations that are the opponents of wisdom.

original: gang zhig zag pa zad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi bsam gtan pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dag las rnam par grol ba'i phyir gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig zag pa zad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi bsam gtan pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad dag las rnam par grol ba'i phyir gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: One who has exhausted the contaminants and is absorbed in the eight liberations is liberated from both, because he is liberated from all the obscurations of the afflictions and meditative attainment.

original: gang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bco lnga rnams kyi gang zag de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bco lnga rnams kyi gang zag de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The person who is in the fifteen moments of the path of seeing and the factors conducive to penetration is one who has entered for the result of stream-enterer.

original: stan gcig pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa nas brtsams te 'bras bu dang po thob kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: stan gcig pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa nas brtsams te 'bras bu dang po thob kyi bar du'o //
translated: The one-sessioner is from the factors conducive to penetration up to the attainment of the first result.

original: mthong lam de ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par rnam par gnon pa dang / chos mngon par rtogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mthong lam de ni yang dag pa nyid du nges par rnam par gnon pa dang / chos mngon par rtogs pa yang ngo //
translated: This path of insight is also called the penetrating realization of the real, and the direct realization of the Dharma.

original: yang mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug tu 'bras bu dang po thob pa'i gang zag gang zhe na /🔽gang mthar gyis @259a * //🔽pa 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug tu 'bras bu dang po thob pa'i gang zag gang zhe na / gang mthar gyis @259a * // pa 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa /
translated: What is the person who has attained the first fruition immediately after the path of insight?

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs pa na rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs pa na rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is not yet free from the realm of desire, but who enters into certainty of perfection by the gradual method.🔽He becomes a stream-enterer.

original: chags pa dang bral ba'i phyogs gcig gis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba'i phyogs gcig gis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not yet free from the realm of desire, but is free from one part of the attachments.

original: gang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa rnam pa dang po drug spangs pa ni slar yang 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa rnam pa dang po drug spangs pa ni slar yang 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: He is the one who, by the mundane path, has abandoned the first six of the nine categories of passions to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the realm of desire.

original: yang dag pa nyid nges pa la zhugs pa na lan cig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid nges pa la zhugs pa na lan cig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a once-returner when he enters into certainty of perfection.

original: yang sngon du 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa rnam pa dang po drug dag spangs te /
analyzed: yang sngon du 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa rnam pa dang po drug dag spangs te /
translated: Again, one previously abandons the first six types of affliction that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm through the mundane path.

original: gang las slar yang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang las slar yang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa na /
translated: When one again becomes free of attachment to the desire realm,

original: phyis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs pa de sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs pa de sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: one enters the correct ascertainment of the truth and becomes a once returner on the sixteenth moment of mind.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: One who is free of attachment to the desire realm

original: yang dag pa nyid nges pa la zhugs pa na phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs te 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa na nges pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid nges pa la zhugs pa na phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro // gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs te 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa na nges pa la zhugs pa /
translated: becomes a nonreturner when one enters the correct ascertainment of the truth.

original: de phyir mi 'ong pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir mi 'ong pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: One who abandons the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm through the mundane path and becomes free of attachment to the desire realm enters the correct ascertainment of the truth and becomes a nonreturner.

original: gang gi tshe mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs bas rgyun du zhugs pa yin grang na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs bas rgyun du zhugs pa yin grang na /
translated: When one is a stream enterer by abandoning the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: de rgyu gang gis kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang gis kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: why is it said that one is a stream enterer by abandoning the three fetters?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said that

original: thar pa thob pa'i gegs kyi gtso bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa thob pa'i gegs kyi gtso bo'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the primary obstructions to attaining liberation.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dang po lnga rnams spangs pa'i lam gyis gang zag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dang po lnga rnams spangs pa'i lam gyis gang zag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who is on the path abandoning the first five of the nine aspects of afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm is entering the result of once returning.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug pa spangs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gang zag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //🔽gang bsgom pa'i lam la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i steng du /
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug pa spangs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gang zag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //🔽gang bsgom pa'i lam la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i steng du /
translated: One who has completed the abandonment of the sixth aspect of afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm is a once returner.🔽One who is on the path abandoning the seventh and eighth aspects of afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm is entering the result of nonreturn.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dag spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun pa dang brgyad pa dag spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The person on the path of abandoning the seventh and eighth types of affliction of the desire realm is entering the result of nonreturn.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The person on the path of abandoning the ninth type of affliction of the desire realm is a nonreturner.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang tshe @259b 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gang tshe @259b 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: If one becomes a nonreturner by abandoning all afflictions of the desire realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: de rgyu gang gis 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga rnams spangs pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang gis 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga rnams spangs pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: why is it said that one is a nonreturner by abandoning the five fetters associated with lower realms?

original: brjod de / gtso bor bsdus pa nye bar bzung ba'o //
analyzed: brjod de / gtso bor bsdus pa nye bar bzung ba'o //
translated: It is said that they are called fetters because they are the principal ones.

original: smras pa gtso bo nye bar bzung ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa gtso bo nye bar bzung ba ci zhe na /
translated: What are the principal ones?

original: brjod de / 'gro ba dman pa'i rgyu dang khams dman pa'i rgyu dang nye bar bzung pa'o //
analyzed: brjod de / 'gro ba dman pa'i rgyu dang khams dman pa'i rgyu dang nye bar bzung pa'o //
translated: The cause of a low realm and the cause of a low element and the cause of being taken up.

original: de la 'gro ba dman pa ni dmyal ba yi dgas dud 'gro rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba dman pa ni dmyal ba yi dgas dud 'gro rnams so //
translated: Among them, a low realm is the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: khams dman pa ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams dman pa ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: A low element is the desire realm.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba tshul khrims dang btul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa the tshom rnams kyis 'gro ba dman pa las mi 'da' bas /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba tshul khrims dang btul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa the tshom rnams kyis 'gro ba dman pa las mi 'da' bas /
translated: There, by the views of the transitory collection, the holding of ethics and spiritual disciplines as paramount, and doubt, one does not transcend a low realm.

original: 'jig tshogs la ta ba la sogs pa de rnams ni 'gro ba dman pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la ta ba la sogs pa de rnams ni 'gro ba dman pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Therefore, those views of the transitory collection and so on are the cause of a low realm.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag gis khams dman pa las yang dag par 'da' ba ma yin pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems de dag ni khams dman pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag gis khams dman pa las yang dag par 'da' ba ma yin pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems de dag ni khams dman pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: By sensual desire and malice, one does not transcend the low element. Therefore, sensual desire and malice are the cause of a low element.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de ma thag tu gang bsgom pa'i lam la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de ma thag tu gang bsgom pa'i lam la /
translated: Immediately after the result of nonreturn, on the path of meditation,

original: bsam gtan dang po'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning with the first aspect of affliction of the first absorption,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad pa'i bar du spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad pa'i bar du spangs pa'i lam gyi gang zag de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The person who has abandoned up to the eighth affliction of the peak of cyclic existence is one who has entered for the result of an arhat.

original: gang srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gang zag de ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gang srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gang zag de ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The person who has completely abandoned the ninth affliction of the peak of cyclic existence is an arhat.

original: 'dis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gang gi tshe khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa yin grang na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa yin grang na /
translated: If one is an arhat through abandoning all afflictions that are active in the three realms,

original: rgyu gang gis de gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga rnams spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga rnams spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bshad ce na /
translated: why is it explained that one becomes an arhat through abandoning the five higher fetters?

original: brjod de / gtso bo bsdus pa nye bar bzung ba'o //
analyzed: brjod de / gtso bo bsdus pa nye bar bzung ba'o //
translated: We say that the principal ones are included.

original: smras pa / gtso bo nye bar bzung ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / gtso bo nye bar bzung ba ci zhe na /
translated: What are the principal ones?

original: brjod de / gong mnye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid dang / gong ma yongs su mi spong ba'i rgyu dag nye bar bzung ba'o //🔽de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag las 'dod pa'i khams kyi gong ma nye bar len pa ste gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nye bar skye ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brjod de / gong mnye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid dang / gong ma yongs su mi spong ba'i rgyu dag nye bar bzung ba'o // de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag las 'dod pa'i khams kyi gong ma nye bar len pa ste gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nye bar skye ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The cause of not abandoning the higher realms is the cause of not abandoning the higher realms.

original: pa dang / nga rgyal dang the tshom rnams kyis gong ma yongs su mi spong ba ste the tshom mchog gi bsam gtan pas kyis de ru kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dang / nga rgyal dang the tshom rnams kyis gong ma yongs su mi spong ba ste the tshom mchog gi bsam gtan pas kyis de ru kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of not abandoning the higher realms is the cause of not abandoning the higher realms.

analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa nyid 'dres pa dang nye bar 'dres pas lha ru bdun dang mi'i bdun gyi srid pa la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su phyin pa'i gang zag de ni srid pa tha ma lan bdun pa'o //
translated: The person who, having become a Stream-Winner, by means of a mixture of the two types of births, i.e., divine and human, in seven divine and human births, reaches the end of suffering, is a “seven-at-the-most.”

original: gang lha ru'am mi rigs rim du song ste mi'i nang du sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su son pa de ni rigs nas rigs so //

translated: The person who, having become a Stream-Winner, in the order of the families, in the human destiny, reaches the end of suffering, is a “family-to-family.”

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa nyid lha ru'am mi ru srid pa gnyis la brten te yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa'o //

translated: The person who, having become a Stream-Winner, in the divine or human destiny, in two births, obtains Nirvāṇa, is a “candidate for the fruit of Once-Returner.”

original: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa lha'i nang nyid du srid pa gcig la brten te yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa lha'i nang nyid du srid pa gcig la brten te yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: The person who, having become a Once-Returner, in the divine destiny, in one birth, obtains Nirvāṇa, is a “single-interventer.”

original: bar chad gcig ni skye ba gzhan gang gi go skabs de ni bar chad gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad gcig ni skye ba gzhan gang gi go skabs de ni bar chad gcig ces bya'o //

analyzed: 'di lta ste / skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni spangs la /
translated: 1.🔽One who has abandoned the fetter of birth but not the fetter of actualization, who actualizes the path of former practice in the intermediate state itself, and who reaches the end of suffering is the first.🔽One who actualizes the path in the intermediate state itself, and who reaches the end of suffering is the second.🔽One who actualizes the path in the intermediate state itself, and who reaches the end of suffering is the third.

original: skye ba'i srid bar 'gro ba'i phyir sems pa nyid na lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su phyin pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid bar 'gro ba'i phyir sems pa nyid na lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su phyin pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: One who has the intention to take birth in the intermediate state, who actualizes the path in the intermediate state itself, and who reaches the end of suffering is the thirteenth.

original: gang yang skye ba'i srid pa kun du bsams te mngon du gnas pa nyid de /🔽skye ba'i srid pa thob pa ni ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang yang skye ba'i srid pa kun du bsams te mngon du gnas pa nyid de /🔽skye ba'i srid pa thob pa ni ma yin pa /
translated: One who has the intention to take birth in the intermediate state, who actualizes the path in the intermediate state itself, and who reaches the end

original: lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa thob pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa thob pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the one who, having realized the path, attains the end of suffering.

original: gang skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba ma spangs shing mngon par grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ma spangs pas gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa tsam nyid na lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su phyin pa de ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan🔽las 'da' ba'o //🔽gang skyes nas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ste 'bad pa med par lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su son pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o /
analyzed: gang skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba ma spangs shing mngon par grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ma spangs pas gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa tsam nyid na lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su phyin pa de ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o // gang skyes nas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ste 'bad pa med par lam mngon du byas te sdug bsngal gyi mthar rjes su son pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o /
translated: The one who, without abandoning the fetters of birth and without abandoning the fetters of full becoming, merely takes birth in the form realm, realizes the path and attains the end of suffering, is one who attains nirvana after birth.🔽The one who, after birth, without effort, without exertion, realizes the path and attains the end of suffering, is one who attains nirvana without exertion.

translated: The one who, after birth, with effort, with exertion, realizes the path and attains the end of suffering, is one who attains nirvana with exertion.

original: gong du 'pho ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of upward movement:

original: 'di ltar / 'og min du 'gro ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'og min du 'gro ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba'o //
translated: one goes to the Highest Pure Land and one goes to the summit of existence.

original: de la gang ro myang ba mang du skye ba grub pas bsam gtan dang po'i ro myang ba chung ngu tshangs ris su'o //
analyzed: de la gang ro myang ba mang du skye ba grub pas bsam gtan dang po'i ro myang ba chung ngu tshangs ris su'o //
translated: Those who are born many times while relishing the first absorption go to Brahmakayika through relishing the lesser first absorption.

original: 'bring gis tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don du'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don du'o //
translated: They go to Brahmapurohita through relishing the medium first absorption.

original: chen pos tshangs pa chen po ru'o //
analyzed: chen pos tshangs pa chen po ru'o //
translated: They go to Mahabrahma through relishing the greater first absorption.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i ro myang ba chung ngus 'od chung ngu'o //🔽'bring gis tshad med 'od du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i ro myang ba chung ngus 'od chung ngu'o // 'bring gis tshad med 'od du'o //
translated: Similarly, those who relish the lesser second absorption go to Parittabha.🔽Those who relish the medium second absorption go to Apramanabha.

original: rab kyis 'od gsal du'o //
analyzed: rab kyis 'od gsal du'o //
translated: Those who relish the greater second absorption go to Abhasvara.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ro chung ngu myangs pas dge chung ngu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ro chung ngu myangs pas dge chung ngu'o //
translated: Those who relish the lesser third absorption go to Parittasubha.

original: 'bring gis tshad med dge'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis tshad med dge'o //
translated: Those who relish the medium third absorption go to Apramāṇasubha.

original: rab kyis dge rgyas su'o //
analyzed: rab kyis dge rgyas su'o //
translated: Those who relish the greater third absorption go to Subhakṛtsna.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ro myang ba chung dus sprin med du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ro myang ba chung dus sprin med du'o //
translated: Those who relish the lesser fourth absorption go to Anabhraka.

original: 'bring gis bsod nams 'phel du'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis bsod nams 'phel du'o //
translated: Those who relish the medium fourth absorption go to Punyaprasava.

original: rab kyis 'bras bu che ba ru'o //
analyzed: rab kyis 'bras bu che ba ru'o //
translated: Those who relish the greater fourth absorption go to Brhatphala.

original: rnam par bkram pa bsgoms pas bsam gtan bzhi pa yongs su goms pa chung dus mi che bar ro //
analyzed: rnam par bkram pa bsgoms pas bsam gtan bzhi pa yongs su goms pa chung dus mi che bar ro //
translated: By cultivating the unvaried fourth absorption, one is reborn in the small degree of the fourth absorption, in the heaven of No Hardship.

original: yongs su goms pa 'bring gis mi gdung bar ro //🔽rab yongs su goms pas shin tu mthong du'o //
analyzed: yongs su goms pa 'bring gis mi gdung bar ro // rab yongs su goms pas shin tu mthong du'o //
translated: By cultivating the medium degree, one is reborn in the heaven of No Heat.🔽By cultivating the great degree, one is reborn in the heaven of Good Vision.

original: ches rab tu goms pas gya nom snang du'o //
analyzed: ches rab tu goms pas gya nom snang du'o //
translated: By cultivating the very great degree, one is reborn in the heaven of Excellent Vision.

original: 'di rnams su bar med par lan re re skye'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams su bar med par lan re re skye'o //
translated: In these heavens, one is reborn once without returning.

original: shin tu ches rab tu goms pas 'og min du zhugs te lam mngon du byas shing yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa de ni 'go min mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu ches rab tu goms pas 'og min du zhugs te lam mngon du byas shing yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa de ni 'go min mthar thug pa'o //
translated: By cultivating the extremely great degree, one enters the Akaniṣṭha heaven, manifests the path, and attains nirvāṇa. This is the final limit of Akaniṣṭha.

original: gang yang tshangs ris la sogs pa nas 'bras bu che ba'i mthar thug par lan re re skyes nas /
analyzed: gang yang tshangs ris la sogs pa nas 'bras bu che ba'i mthar thug par lan re re skyes nas /
translated: Those who are reborn once in each of the heavens of Brahmakāyika and so on up to Bṛhatphala🔽and then, by cultivating the unvaried fourth absorption, completely abandon the pure abodes

original: rnam par bkram pa ma yin pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgoms pas gnas gtsang ma 'ba' zhig yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: rnam par bkram pa ma yin pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgoms pas gnas gtsang ma 'ba' zhig yongs su spangs te /
translated: and are reborn in the formless realm.

analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa rnams su lan re re skyes nas srid pa'i rtse mor song ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one who is born in the sphere of infinite space and so on, and then goes to the peak of existence and attains final nirvāṇa, is one who ends in the peak of existence.

original: gang dbang po rtul po bag med pa'am bag yod pa'am sems pa'am mi sems pa mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan las yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba can de ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //

translated: One who is of dull faculty, whether heedful or heedless, whether intent or not intent, who is capable of abiding happily in this life and regressing from mundane meditative attainment, is one who regresses.

original: bag med pa'am bag yod pa /
analyzed: bag med pa'am bag yod pa /
translated: One who is of dull faculty, whether heedful or heedless,🔽who is not capable of abiding happily in this life and regressing from mundane meditative attainment, is one who does not regress.

original: gang gzugs med pa'i 'grib pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa bsam gtan bde bas gnas pa dag 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs med pa'i 'grib pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa bsam gtan bde bas gnas pa dag 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Those who experience the realm of desire and are endowed with the meditative concentration of the formless realm, who abide in the bliss of meditative concentration and are born in the realm of desire, are bodhisattvas who experience the realm of desire.

original: gang gzugs med pa'i 'grib pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa bsam gtan bde bas gnas pa dag gzugs kyi khams su skye ba de ni gzugs na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs med pa'i 'grib pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa bsam gtan bde bas gnas pa dag gzugs kyi khams su skye ba de ni gzugs na spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is born in the form realm is one who, by means of the meditative concentration of the decrease of the formless realm, abides in the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone asks,

original: gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' med pa rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' med pa rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: “Why is there no bodhisattva who practices in the formless realm?”

original: brjod de / nus pa khyad par can thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni skye mched nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: brjod de / nus pa khyad par can thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni skye mched nye bar bzung ste /
translated: It is said that bodhisattvas who have attained special abilities do not take birth in the formless realm,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they bring sentient beings to maturity by means of the sense bases.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'grib pa'i bsam gtan zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'grib pa'i bsam gtan zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the meditative concentration of the decrease of the formless realm”

original: bsam gtan gang gis gzugs med par skye ba bkag pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gang gis gzugs med par skye ba bkag pa'i don to //
translated: means that by means of meditative concentration one prevents birth in the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan bde bas gnas pa zhes pa ni bsam gtan las yongs su mi nyams pa nyid dang bsam gtan ldog pa la mkhas pa nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin pa'i don du byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar rig par bya'o //🔽gang sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa'i 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar gyur nas rang rgyal ba'i byang chub mngon du byed pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bde bas gnas pa zhes pa ni bsam gtan las yongs su mi nyams pa nyid dang bsam gtan ldog pa la mkhas pa nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin pa'i don du byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar rig par bya'o // gang sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa'i 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar gyur nas rang rgyal ba'i byang chub mngon du byed pa de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: Abiding in the bliss of meditation refers to the bodhisattva's birth in the world of desire for the sake of developing living beings, by means of not falling away from meditation and by means of skill in reversing meditation.🔽The pratyekabuddha who lives in the world of desire when there is no buddha in the world and who realizes the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha is the pratyekabuddha who lives in the world of desire.

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar gyur pa dga' ldan gnas su gnas bcas pa nas bzung ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du dang / sngon du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad ston pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i @262a * //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar gyur pa dga' ldan gnas su gnas bcas pa nas bzung ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du dang / sngon du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad ston pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i @262a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who is born in the world of desire, who lives in the Tusita heaven, who manifests the whole career of a bodhisattva and the whole career of a pratyekabuddha up to complete Nirvana, is the inconceivable bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so // de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: He is the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: dga' ldan gnas su gnas pa nas bzung ste bdud pham par byas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gnas su gnas pa nas bzung ste bdud pham par byas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva's career is the period from the moment when he is in the Tuṣita heaven up to the moment when, having come to the Vajra seat, he conquers the hosts of Mara.

original: sangs rgyas spyod pa zhes pa ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa nas bzung ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po'i bar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod pa zhes pa ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa nas bzung ste yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po'i bar ro //
translated: The career of the Buddha is the period from the moment when he attains perfect enlightenment up to the moment when he enters into the great Nirvana.

original: spyod pa'i yongs su dbye bas byang chub sems dpa' lnga ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i yongs su dbye bas byang chub sems dpa' lnga ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva is of five kinds according to the division of the careers:

original: lhag par mos pa spyod pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa spyod pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa dang ; mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa spyod pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa spyod pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa dang ; mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa'o //
translated: the one who has faith for his vehicle, the one who has morality for his vehicle, the one who has a generous nature, the one who has wisdom for his vehicle, and the one who has meditation for his vehicle.

original: de la gang mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa chung ngu 'bring chen po dang ldan zhing rigs la gnas pa dang po nyid du byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa nas bzung ste ci srid du rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ma zhugs pa ste
analyzed: de la gang mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa chung ngu 'bring chen po dang ldan zhing rigs la gnas pa dang po nyid du byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa nas bzung ste ci srid du rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ma zhugs pa ste
translated: The one who practices with devoted interest is on the stage of action out of devoted interest. He has small, middling, and great patient acceptance. He is established in the spiritual gene. He has made the vow for great enlightenment. He has not yet entered the stage of joy.

original: / so so bdag nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pa med pas de ni lhag par mos pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: / so so bdag nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pa med pas de ni lhag par mos pa spyod pa'o //
translated: He is called one who practices with devoted interest because he has no supramundane realization of his own.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i gang zag de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pas bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i gang zag de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The one who practices with pure superior attitude is the person on the ten bodhisattva stages. He has pure intention because he has supramundane realization.

original: gang rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang / snang bar byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyi gang zag de ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang / snang bar byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyi gang zag de ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: The one who practices with signs is the person on the bodhisattva stages of the Joyous, the Immaculate, the Shining, the Brighter, the Hardto-Conquer, and the Manifest.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone objects:

original: de ci ltar mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod ce na /
translated: How can one practice with signs?

original: brjod de / sa drug la mi 'dod kyang mtshan ma tha snyad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod de / sa drug la mi 'dod kyang mtshan ma tha snyad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that, although one does not desire the six stages, one engages in conventional signs.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa ring du song ba la gang zag 'bad pa byed pa na mtshan ma mngon du na rgyu ba med pas de ni mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa ring du song ba la gang zag 'bad pa byed pa na mtshan ma mngon du na rgyu ba med pas de ni mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: When the bodhisattva who is on the seventh stage, Gone Afar, is making an effort, he does not move in the direction of signs. Therefore, he practices without signs.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba dang legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin rnams la gang zag de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba dang legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin rnams la gang zag de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: When the bodhisattva who is on the three stages, Immovable, Good Intelligence, and Cloud of Dharma, is making an effort, he practices without deliberate effort.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rab tu brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rab tu brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained the nonconceptual wisdom of maturation.

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that the person who is a stream-enterer

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: is a stream-enterer of two kinds:

original: 'di ltar mthar gyis pa dang / lan cig gis nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthar gyis pa dang / lan cig gis nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: one who is a gradualist and one who is a one-sitting quitter.

original: de la @262b mthar gyis pa ni ci ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la @262b mthar gyis pa ni ci ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: The gradual type is as taught.🔽The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the supramundane path in one sitting.🔽He is classified as having two results:🔽the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.🔽The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the mundane path in one sitting.

original: gang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa mi lcogs pa la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams lan cig gis spang ba de ni lan cig gis nges par 'byin pa dang stabs gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa mi lcogs pa la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams lan cig gis spang ba de ni lan cig gis nges par 'byin pa dang stabs gcig pa'o //
translated: He is classified as having two results:🔽the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.🔽The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the mundane path in one sitting.🔽He is classified as having two results:

original: de dang 'bras bu gnyis su rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: de dang 'bras bu gnyis su rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.🔽The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the mundane path in one sitting.🔽He is classified as having two results:

original: 'di ltar / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.🔽The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the mundane path in one sitting.

original: stabs gcig pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: stabs gcig pa zhes pa ni /
translated: He is classified as having two results:🔽the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spangs bar bya ba chen po nas chung ngu'i bar du mthong bas spang bya ltar spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spangs bar bya ba chen po nas chung ngu'i bar du mthong bas spang bya ltar spong ba'o //
translated: The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the mundane path in one sitting.🔽He is classified as having two results:🔽the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam bzhin du sa'i rab tu dbye bas tha dad du ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam bzhin du sa'i rab tu dbye bas tha dad du ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The once-returner who is a non-returner by the mundane path is the one who, having attained the realization of the truths, eliminates the afflictions of the three realms by the mundane path in one sitting.🔽He is classified as having two results:🔽the result of stream-enterer and the result of arhat.

original: sor mo rtse mo'i mdo las 'di skad du gsungs te /
analyzed: sor mo rtse mo'i mdo las 'di skad du gsungs te /
translated: The once-returner who is a non-return

original: gang ci snyed gzugs dang ci srid du rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ci srid du ring ba'am nye ba'am de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing cha gcig tu byas te gcig tu
analyzed: gang ci snyed gzugs dang ci srid du rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ci srid du ring ba'am nye ba'am de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing cha gcig tu byas te gcig tu
translated: Whatever there is, in terms of form and however much there is, in terms of consciousness, past, future, present, and so on, in brief, whatever is distant or near, all of that is gathered into one, made into one part,🔽and combined into one,

original: bzlums nas gcig tu bsdoms shing gcig tu sdom ste /🔽cha gcig bzlums pa gcig phung po gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: bzlums nas gcig tu bsdoms shing gcig tu sdom ste / cha gcig bzlums pa gcig phung po gcig tu byas nas /
translated: made into one heap,

original: 'di dag thams cad mi rtag cing thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par so sor legs par bslab po //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad mi rtag cing thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par so sor legs par bslab po //
translated: and one should train well in all of that, in detail, as impermanent, suffering, and so on.

original: lan gcig gis nges par 'byin pa ni thog ma dang tha ma'i 'bras bu gnyis su btags pa byas te /
analyzed: lan gcig gis nges par 'byin pa ni thog ma dang tha ma'i 'bras bu gnyis su btags pa byas te /
translated: The once-returner is designated as having two results:

original: 'bras bu de gnyis grangs bzhin du khams gsum thams cad kyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pa rab tu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de gnyis grangs bzhin du khams gsum thams cad kyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pa rab tu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two results generate the abandonment of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation of all three realms, respectively.

original: de lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i tha snyad med de /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de dag ni bden pa mthong ba /
analyzed: de lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i tha snyad med de / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de dag ni bden pa mthong ba /
translated: But they are not called once-returners or non-returners.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa spangs pa rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa spangs pa rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the results of once-returner and non-returner are established by abandoning all or some objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm.

original: lan cig gis nges par 'byin pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: lan cig gis nges par 'byin pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: From the perspective of definite deliverance in one life,

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las /
translated: the Prajñaptiśāstra states:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i de ma thag tu dgra bcom pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i de ma thag tu dgra bcom pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya'o //
translated: The state of an arhat should be known to be immediately after that of a stream enterer.🔽One who obtains the state of knowing all through insight into the present

original: de gang mthong ba'i chos la kun shes pa brnyes pa lan mang du byed do //
analyzed: de gang mthong ba'i chos la kun shes pa brnyes pa lan mang du byed do //
translated: does so many times.

original: brgya lam na brnyes par mi byed na /
analyzed: brgya lam na brnyes par mi byed na /
translated: If one does not obtain it even once in a hundred years,

original: thams cad las ma lus par 'dod chags @263a * //🔽dang bral ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad las ma lus par 'dod chags @263a * //🔽dang bral ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: one is not completely free from all attachment.

original: myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su nye bar skye'o //🔽de la gang mthong ba'i chos la kun shes pa brnyes pa lan mang du byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su nye bar skye'o // de la gang mthong ba'i chos la kun shes pa brnyes pa lan mang du byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: By the power of his vow to quickly attain nirvana, he is born in the desire realm.🔽Among them, he who attains the realization of the dharma to be known many times in this very life

original: mthong ba'i chos la dgra bcom pa mngon du byed de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la dgra bcom pa mngon du byed de /
translated: means he actualizes arhatship in this very life.

original: tha na 'chi ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: tha na 'chi ba'i dus su'o //
translated: Even at the time of death.

original: brgya lam brnyes par mi byed na /
analyzed: brgya lam brnyes par mi byed na /
translated: If he does not attain it even a hundred times,

original: myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir de smon lam stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir de smon lam stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will have the power of vow for quickly attaining nirvana.

original: smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'dod pa'i khams nyid du skye ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'dod pa'i khams nyid du skye ste /
translated: By the power of vow, he is born in the desire realm itself.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa'i zhing du rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa'i zhing du rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: In a buddha-less realm, he becomes a pratyekabuddha.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa las zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa las zhes pa ni /
translated: From the presentation of realization, it is said:

original: mngon par rtogs pa bcu ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten realizations.

original: 'di ltar / chos mngon par rtogs pa dang / don mngon par rtogs pa dang / de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa dang / rjes kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa dang / kun du spyod pa ma yin pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos mngon par rtogs pa dang / don mngon par rtogs pa dang / de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa dang / rjes kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa dang / kun du spyod pa ma yin pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang /
translated: Thus, there is the clear realization of the Dharma, the clear realization of the meaning, the clear realization of thatness, the subsequent clear realization, the clear realization of the jewels, the clear realization of the unshared qualities,

original: mthar thug mngon par rtogs pa dang / nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug mngon par rtogs pa dang / nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: the ultimate clear realization, the clear realization of the sravakas, the clear realization of the buddhas and the clear realization of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la gang dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i mdo'i sde la sogs pa rnams su chos bden pa bzhi dbang du bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gang dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i mdo'i sde la sogs pa rnams su chos bden pa bzhi dbang du bya ba la /
translated: The clear realization of the Dharma is when one who is a follower through faith, in the sutra collection and so on, gains the end of the collection that is subsumed by the factor conducive to liberation, having mastered the four truths that are the domain of the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa dbang du gyur pa lhag par mos pa rab tu dang ba rab nyid /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa dbang du gyur pa lhag par mos pa rab tu dang ba rab nyid /
translated: One who has mastered the teachings of others, who has the highest interest and the highest faith,

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa'i mtha' brnyes pa de ni chos mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa'i mtha' brnyes pa de ni chos mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: has attained the clear realization of the Dharma.

original: gang mdo sde'i la sogs pa'i chos bden pa dbang du bya ba la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bdag po'i dbang las sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa rab nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus
analyzed: gang mdo sde'i la sogs pa'i chos bden pa dbang du bya ba la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bdag po'i dbang las sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa rab nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus
translated: The patience of Dharma knowledge subsuming the four truths of suffering and so on is definitely subsumed by the factor conducive to penetrative insight that is the correct contemplation of the four truths of the sutra collection and so on.🔽

original: pa'i mtha' brnyes pa de ni don mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtha' brnyes pa de ni don mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the meaning is the attainment of the peak of the acceptance of the doctrine with regard to the truths of suffering and so on, which is subsumed by the factor conducive to penetrative insight, due to the power of the dominant condition of proper mental attention to the Dharma of the sutra and so on, which is the truth of the basis.

original: de yang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rab kyi chung dus rab tu bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de yang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rab kyi chung dus rab tu bsgrubs te /
translated: This is also accomplished by the medium degree of proper mental attention.

original: dus dang skye ba de la drod thob pa la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rab kyi 'bring gis rab tu bsgrubs te rtse mo dang bzod pa dag la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang skye ba de la drod thob pa la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o // tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rab kyi 'bring gis rab tu bsgrubs te rtse mo dang bzod pa dag la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of the doctrine that ascertains the doctrine with regard to the truths of suffering and so on is obtained in the heat stage of the same time and life.🔽The acceptance of the doctrine that ascertains the doctrine with regard to the peak and acceptance stages is accomplished by the medium degree of the medium degree of proper mental attention.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rab kyi rab kyis bskrun pa'i 'jig rten chos mchog la @263b chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rab kyi rab kyis bskrun pa'i 'jig rten chos mchog la @263b chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of the doctrine that ascertains the doctrine with regard to the supreme mundane state that is generated by the great degree of the medium degree of proper mental attention.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam sems skad cig ma bcu drug rnams brnyes pa de ni kho na'i nyid mngon par rtogs pa ste mthong lam kho na'o //
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam sems skad cig ma bcu drug rnams brnyes pa de ni kho na'i nyid mngon par rtogs pa ste mthong lam kho na'o //
translated: The clear realization of the path of seeing is the clear realization of the path of seeing alone.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam las gong du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ma lus pa de ni rjes kyi mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam las gong du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ma lus pa de ni rjes kyi mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The clear realization of the subsequent state is the entire path of meditation that is mundane and supramundane that is higher than the path of seeing.

original: dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di ltar / sangs rgyas la mi phyed pa'i dang ba dang / chos la mi phyed pa'i dang ba dang / dge 'dun la mi phyed pa'i dang ba'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum ste / 'di ltar / sangs rgyas la mi phyed pa'i dang ba dang / chos la mi phyed pa'i dang ba dang / dge 'dun la mi phyed pa'i dang ba'o //
translated: There are three clear realizations of the three jewels:🔽Thus, the clear realization of the Buddha is the faith of nondeprivation in the Buddha, the clear realization of the Dharma is the faith of nondeprivation in the Dharma and the clear realization of the Saṅgha is the faith of nondeprivation in the Saṅgha.

original: de la kye ma yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'o zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi dge 'dun ni legs par rab tu zhugs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la kye ma yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'o zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi dge 'dun ni legs par rab tu zhugs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The clear realization of the Buddha is the thought, “Oh, the Bhagavān is a perfect buddha,” the clear realization of the Dharma is the thought, “This vinaya of the Bhagavān is well spoken,” and the clear realization of the Saṅgha is the thought, “The Saṅgha of the Bhagavān is well cultivated.”

original: de ltar mi phyed pa ni nges pa ste 'phags pa nyan thos kyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi phyed pa ni nges pa ste 'phags pa nyan thos kyi'o //
translated: Such non-division is certainty, that of the noble disciple.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la rab tu dang ba de ni dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la rab tu dang ba de ni dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha is the realization of the Jewels.

original: gang 'phags pa bzhed pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa slan chad mi byed pa'i sdom pa rab tu brnyes nas slob pa'i bdag gi dmyal ba zad do dud 'gro zad do yi dvags zad do //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa bzhed pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa slan chad mi byed pa'i sdom pa rab tu brnyes nas slob pa'i bdag gi dmyal ba zad do dud 'gro zad do yi dvags zad do //
translated: Having attained the restraint of not committing again that is included in the noble one's moral discipline, the noble disciple thinks: My hell is exhausted, my animal realm is exhausted, my ghost realm is exhausted.

original: ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba zad do //
analyzed: ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba zad do //
translated: My bad migrations, bad destinies, and wrong fallings are exhausted.

original: bdag ni ngan song gi las byas te ngan song du rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i snod ma yin par nges so zhes pa de ni kun du spyod pa ma yin pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni ngan song gi las byas te ngan song du rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i snod ma yin par nges so zhes pa de ni kun du spyod pa ma yin pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: I am certain that I am not a vessel for creating the karma of bad migrations and actualizing the ripening of bad migrations. This is the realization of non-practice.

original: ci ltar lam gyi bden pa la mthar thug pa'i lam bstan pa de ni mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar lam gyi bden pa la mthar thug pa'i lam bstan pa de ni mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: As for the truth of the path, the teaching of the path of culmination is the realization of culmination.

original: gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun chad pa dang / mi ldan pa thams cad thob pa rab tu brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun chad pa dang / mi ldan pa thams cad thob pa rab tu brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have attained the cessation of all unwholesome tendencies and the acquisition of all that is wholesome.

original: mngon par rtogs pa bdun pa sdoms pa de nyid ni nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bdun pa sdoms pa de nyid ni nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The same seven realizations are the realization of the sravakas,

original: nyan thos kyis gzhan las thos pa rtogs nas brnyes pa'i phyir ro //🔽mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de nyid gzhan las thos pa rtogs pa ma yin pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis gzhan las thos pa rtogs nas brnyes pa'i phyir ro // mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de nyid gzhan las thos pa rtogs pa ma yin pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir /
translated: because they attain realization after hearing from another.🔽The same seven realizations are the realization of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: because they attain realization without hearing from another.

original: mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de nyid la gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzod pa yang dag par thob pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de nyid la gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzod pa yang dag par thob pa ni /
translated: The same seven realizations are the realization of the bodhisattvas,🔽because they attain the acceptance that dharmas do not arise.🔽The bodhisattvas do not manifest these seven realizations

original: nyan thos rang sangs rgyas dag rnam par drang ba'i @264a * //
analyzed: nyan thos rang sangs rgyas dag rnam par drang ba'i @264a * //
translated: for the sake of skill in means in order to lead the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i don du yin gyi mngon du bya ba'i don du ni min te theg pa dman pas nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i don du yin gyi mngon du bya ba'i don du ni min te theg pa dman pas nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not for the sake of manifesting them, because they do not attain emancipation through the Lesser Vehicle.

original: 'on kyang rab tu dga' ba'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' nges pa la zhugs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rab tu dga' ba'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' nges pa la zhugs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: However, the bodhisattva who has entered certainty on the ground of Supreme Joy is a bodhisattva realization.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa las byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa las byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the śrāvaka realization and the bodhisattva realization?

original: brjod de / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa las khyad par bcu gcig gis khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: brjod de / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa las khyad par bcu gcig gis khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The bodhisattva realization is superior to the śrāvaka realization by eleven differences.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / nye bar ston pa'i khyad par dang / mngon du byed pa'i khyad par dang / khas blangs pa'i khyad par dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par dang / gnas kyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / nye bar ston pa'i khyad par dang / mngon du byed pa'i khyad par dang / khas blangs pa'i khyad par dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par dang / gnas kyi khyad par dang /
translated: The difference of object, the difference of teaching, the difference of realization, the difference of vow, the difference of liberation, the difference of possession, the difference of abode,

original: 'khor gyi khyad par dang / rigs rgyun gyi khyad par dang / skye ba'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyi khyad par dang / rigs rgyun gyi khyad par dang / skye ba'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par ro //
translated: the distinctive features of the retinue, the distinctive feature of the continuity of the spiritual family, the distinctive feature of birth, and the distinctive feature of the result.

original: de la dmigs pa rnam par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa rnam par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the object is due to the complete abandonment of the object.

original: bskal pa grangs med chen po yongs su rdzogs par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med chen po yongs su rdzogs par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the teaching is due to the completion of the accumulations of merit and wisdom in a great incalculable eon.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa mngon du byed pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa mngon du byed pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the realization is due to the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena by supramundane wisdom.

original: rang bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du sems can thams cad khas blangs pas khas blangs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du sems can thams cad khas blangs pas khas blangs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the vow is due to the vow to make all sentient beings equal to oneself.

original: sa bcus nges par 'byung bas nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sa bcus nges par 'byung bas nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the deliverance is due to deliverance by the ten grounds.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba yongs su 'dzin pas yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba yongs su 'dzin pas yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the retention is due to the retention of nonabiding nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pas gnas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pas gnas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in abode is that they purify the buddhaverse.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo nye bar 'dzin pas 'khor gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo nye bar 'dzin pas 'khor gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in retinue is that they take on a group of disciples.

original: pha bzhin du rang gi rgyud yang dag par 'dzin par byed cing thugs las skyes pa'i sras kyi mtshan nyid ldan pas rigs rgyud kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: pha bzhin du rang gi rgyud yang dag par 'dzin par byed cing thugs las skyes pa'i sras kyi mtshan nyid ldan pas rigs rgyud kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in family line is that they are like fathers, taking on a spiritual lineage, and they have the characteristics of being the heart-sons of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nye bar skye bas skye ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nye bar skye bas skye ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in birth is that they are born in the circle of the retinue of bodhisattvas.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni khyad par gcig gis khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni khyad par gcig gis khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The difference in result is that they are superior by one difference.

original: @264b 'di ltar /
analyzed: @264b 'di ltar /
translated: Thus,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par dang / rnam pa lnga'i khyad par dang / sku gsum gyi khyad par dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i khyad par dang / ye shes sre ba nye bar sre ba'i nus pa thob pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par dang / rnam pa lnga'i khyad par dang / sku gsum gyi khyad par dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i khyad par dang / ye shes sre ba nye bar sre ba'i nus pa thob pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: the difference in complete transformation, the difference in the perfection of good qualities, the difference in five aspects, the difference in the three bodies, the difference in nirvana, and the difference in attaining the ability to burn up the fuel of wisdom.

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / sre ba dang nye bar sre ba'i las dang bya ba'i khyad par dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mya ngan las 'da' ba kun du ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par dang / yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / sre ba dang nye bar sre ba'i las dang bya ba'i khyad par dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mya ngan las 'da' ba kun du ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par dang / yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in the purification of obscurations, the difference in the function and activity of burning and being set on fire, the difference in the method of demonstrating complete enlightenment and nirvana, and the difference in the five kinds of protection.

original: de gnas ngan len nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang bla na med pa'i yon tan gyi rten yin pas rten yongs su 'gyur bas de ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de gnas ngan len nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang bla na med pa'i yon tan gyi rten yin pas rten yongs su 'gyur bas de ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in transformation is that it is the transformation of the basis, because it abandons all aspects of afflicted and unafflicted negative tendencies and is the basis of unsurpassed qualities.

original: stobs mi 'jigs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs dpag tu med pa'i yon tan rdzogs pas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: stobs mi 'jigs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs dpag tu med pa'i yon tan rdzogs pas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in the perfection of qualities is that it perfects immeasurable qualities such as the powers, fearlessnesses, and unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ni lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ni lnga ste /
translated: The difference in the five aspects is fivefold.

original: 'di ltar / nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Thus, there is the special purity due to the abandonment of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bas yongs su dag pa'i khyad par dang / chos kyi sku nges par rdzogs pa'i phyir sku'i khyad par dang / rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du chos sna tshogs la longs spyod pas longs spyod pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bas yongs su dag pa'i khyad par dang / chos kyi sku nges par rdzogs pa'i phyir sku'i khyad par dang / rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du chos sna tshogs la longs spyod pas longs spyod pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: There is the special purity due to the purification of the Buddha land, the special body due to the definite perfection of the Dharma body, the special enjoyment due to the enjoyment of the various teachings in the circle of the assembly together with the bodhisattvas,

original: mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'khor yug tu ci ltar 'os pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bya ba rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir las kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'khor yug tu ci ltar 'os pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bya ba rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir las kyi khyad par ro //
translated: and the special activity due to the performance of the deeds of a Buddha by means of the appropriate emanations in the infinite world systems.

original: ngo bo nyid longs spyod pa sprul pa'i sku yongs su rdzogs pa brnyes pa'i phyir sku gsum gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs spyod pa sprul pa'i sku yongs su rdzogs pa brnyes pa'i phyir sku gsum gyi khyad par ro //
translated: There is the special trikāya due to the attainment of the perfection of the svābhāvikakāya, sāmbhogikakāya, and nairmāṇikakāya.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbyings su sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir yon tan thams cad rgyun mi 'chad pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbyings su sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir yon tan thams cad rgyun mi 'chad pas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The special transcendence of sorrow is that, in the expanse of transcendence of sorrow without remainder of the aggregates, for the sake of all sentient beings, all good qualities are uninterrupted.

original: chos kyi dmigs shin du rnam par dag pa khyad par du gyur pa de la brten pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa na so sor sangs rgyas rnams nus pa ldan pas sre ba dang nye ba'i sre ba ye shes nus pa thob pa'i khyad par ro //🔽nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs @265a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dmigs shin du rnam par dag pa khyad par du gyur pa de la brten pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa na so sor sangs rgyas rnams nus pa ldan pas sre ba dang nye ba'i sre ba ye shes nus pa thob pa'i khyad par ro // nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs @265a * //
translated: The special attainment of the power of knowledge is that, based on that special, extremely pure objective support of the Dharma, the knowledge of all aspects is individually attained by the Buddhas.

original: pas sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: pas sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The special purity of obscurations is that all afflictive obscurations and knowledge obscurations are abandoned.

original: gdul bya'i sems can re re'i ched du sangs rgyas kyi bdag po las sre ba dang nye bar sre ba'i las bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems can re re'i ched du sangs rgyas kyi bdag po las sre ba dang nye bar sre ba'i las bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The special activity of engaging and disengaging is that, for the sake of each sentient being to be trained, the activity of engaging and disengaging is performed by the Lord Buddha.

original: phyogs bcu 'jig rten khams thams cad du ci rigs su ci srid du mthar thug par yang dang yang du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa ston pas gdul bya'i skye bo yongs su smin pa dang grol bar byed pas mngon par byang chub pa mya ngan las
analyzed: phyogs bcu 'jig rten khams thams cad du ci rigs su ci srid du mthar thug par yang dang yang du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa ston pas gdul bya'i skye bo yongs su smin pa dang grol bar byed pas mngon par byang chub pa mya ngan las
translated: They are the fully enlightened buddhas who, by displaying the appearance of buddhas and so forth in all the worlds of the ten directions, in whatever way is appropriate, for as long as it takes and until the end of time, bring beings to full maturity and liberation.🔽

original: 'da' ba ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'da' ba ston pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The special method of manifesting enlightenment and nirvana is the repeated manifestation of the appearance of buddhas in all worlds in the ten directions, in whatever way is necessary, for as long as there is existence, in order to ripen and liberate beings to be trained.

original: yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ni yongs su skyob pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yongs su skyob pa rnam pa lnga'i khyad par ni yongs su skyob pa lnga ste /
translated: The special quality of complete protection is the five kinds of complete protection.

original: 'di ltar / grong khyer du 'jug pa la sogs pas long ba la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa brnyes pas nye bar 'tshe ba yongs su skyob pa'o //
