analyzed: 'di ltar / grong khyer du 'jug pa la sogs pas long ba la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa brnyes pas nye bar 'tshe ba yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: Thus, by entering the city and so on, the blind and so on obtain their eyes and so on and are completely protected from harm.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i las rab tu bsgrubs pas lta ba ngan pa thams cad rnam par sel bas thabs med pa yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i las rab tu bsgrubs pas lta ba ngan pa thams cad rnam par sel bas thabs med pa yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: By accomplishing the correct worldly activities, they are completely protected from the absence of means, since all bad views are eliminated.

original: mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas ngan 'gro las yang dag par 'das pas ngan song las yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas ngan 'gro las yang dag par 'das pas ngan song las yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: Since the path of seeing is generated, one is completely beyond the miserable realms, so one is completely protected from the miserable realms.

original: dgra bcom pa mngon du byed pas khams gsum las rnam par gral bas lus ngan pa las yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa mngon du byed pas khams gsum las rnam par gral bas lus ngan pa las yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: Since one actualizes the state of an arhat, one is completely free from the three realms, so one is completely protected from the lower realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa dman pa 'dun pa ldog pa'i phyir theg pa yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa dman pa 'dun pa ldog pa'i phyir theg pa yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: For bodhisattvas, the vehicle is completely protected so that one can turn away from the inclination toward the Hīnayāna.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs las gang zag rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs las gang zag rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-fourth chapter, on the definitive classification of individuals, in this Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, a commentary on the intention of the Mahayana scriptures.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics of the path of the bodhisattvas are twofold:

original: 'di ltar / bya ba'i dbang du byas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bya ba'i dbang du byas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: those that are based on action and those that are based on classification.

original: de la bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ni lam gyi bya ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ni lam gyi bya ba bzhi ste /
translated: 1. From the point of view of function, the path has four functions:

original: 'di ltar / lam gyi sdug bsngal rab tu shes so //🔽kun 'byung rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lam gyi sdug bsngal rab tu shes so // kun 'byung rab tu spong ngo //
translated: One understands fully the truth of suffering.🔽One abandons fully the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byed de //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byed de //
translated: One actualizes fully the truth of cessation.

original: lam sgom par byed do //
analyzed: lam sgom par byed do //
translated: One cultivates fully the truth of the path.

original: rab tu dbye bas lam rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas lam rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: 2. From the point of view of classification, the path is fivefold:

original: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar thug pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar thug pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of conclusion.

original: de la so so skye bos drod la sogs pa mthar chags kyis bden pa mthong ba'i phyir tshogs sogs par byed @265b pas tshogs so //
analyzed: de la so so skye bos drod la sogs pa mthar chags kyis bden pa mthong ba'i phyir tshogs sogs par byed @265b pas tshogs so //
translated: The path of accumulation is so called because ordinary beings accumulate the prerequisites for seeing the truths in order, beginning with heat.

original: 'dis bden pa mthong ba tshol bar byed pas lam ste /
analyzed: 'dis bden pa mthong ba tshol bar byed pas lam ste /
translated: The path is so called because it seeks to see the truths.

original: de dag ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de dag ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
translated: These are the path of accumulation.

original: de ni chos lnga ste /
analyzed: de ni chos lnga ste /
translated: It has five factors:

original: 'di ltar / tshul khrims dang dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa dang / kha zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / mtshan gyi cha stod smad la rnal 'byor rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshul khrims dang dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa dang / kha zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / mtshan gyi cha stod smad la rnal 'byor rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin la gnas pa'o //
translated: morality, restraint of the sense faculties, knowledge of the proper mea­sure in eating, striving in yoga during the first and last parts of the night, and living mindfully.

original: yang na yid phyir phyogs pa med pa la sogs pa thob pa'i rang bzhin dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes te /🔽de rnams legs par goms pas mngon par rtogs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i snod nyid rab tu brnyes pa de ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
analyzed: yang na yid phyir phyogs pa med pa la sogs pa thob pa'i rang bzhin dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes te / de rnams legs par goms pas mngon par rtogs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i snod nyid rab tu brnyes pa de ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
translated: Or else, it is known by the nature of attainment, the nature of aspiration, and the nature of cultivation, as the absence of mental distraction, etc.🔽The path of accumulation is the stage at which one has attained the ability to realize the four noble truths and to become a fit vessel for the path of preparation.

original: de bzhin du tshogs kyi lam gyis tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi ni sbyor ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs kyi lam gyis tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi ni sbyor ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of preparation is the stage at which the bodhisattva, having accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, generates the four roots of merit that are conducive to the penetrations.

original: 'di ltar / drod dang / rtse mo dang / bden pa rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos mchog go ;
analyzed: 'di ltar / drod dang / rtse mo dang / bden pa rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos mchog go ;
translated: patience conforming to the truth, and the supreme mundane state.

original: / mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: / mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: With regard to the truth of the Dharma of the sutra class and so on,

original: mnyam par bzhag pas yid kyi brjod pa'i sgo nas don gang kun du brjod pa /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pas yid kyi brjod pa'i sgo nas don gang kun du brjod pa /
translated: through equipoise, the meaning that is expressed verbally by mental expression

original: de ru zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni drod thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ru zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni drod thob pa'o //
translated: is heat, which is the attainment of calm abiding and insight.

original: de yang snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ste /🔽de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ste / de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That is concentration and wisdom that obtains appearance.

original: bdag rang ni bden pa la snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa da dag 'phal bas rtse mo'o //
analyzed: bdag rang ni bden pa la snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa da dag 'phal bas rtse mo'o //
translated: One who possesses that is peak, which is the increase of the concentration and wisdom that is concomitant with the spreading appearance of the truth.

original: bdag rang ni bden pa la phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i rjes su brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa /
analyzed: bdag rang ni bden pa la phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i rjes su brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa /
translated: One who is concomitant with the concentration and wisdom that is engaged in one part of the truth

original: mtha' gcig tu gzung bya med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phyogs gcig la rab tu zhugs pa 'dzin pa med pa mngon du sad pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i gnas skabs yin pas bzod pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu gzung bya med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phyogs gcig la rab tu zhugs pa 'dzin pa med pa mngon du sad pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i gnas skabs yin pas bzod pa'o //
translated: Since it is the characteristic of the absence of any object to be grasped, it is the state of the absence of grasping, which is the state that is in accord with the awakening that is the entry into one extreme.

original: rang bden pa la bar med pa'i sems ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa 'jig rten chos mchog ste /
analyzed: rang bden pa la bar med pa'i sems ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa 'jig rten chos mchog ste /
translated: The supreme mundane state is the mind that is uninterrupted with regard to the truth of reality, and it is accompanied by meditative concentration and wisdom.

original: gang de ma thag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang po nyid skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang de ma thag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang po nyid skye ba'o //
translated: It is the state that is immediately followed by the arising of the first supramundane path.

original: mdor bsdu na 'jig rten chos mchog gi de ma thag tu mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na 'jig rten chos mchog gi de ma thag tu mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa /
translated: In brief, the supreme mundane state is immediately followed by the meditative absorption and wisdom that are accompanied by the nonapprehension of all things.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid mthong bas spang bya gzung bya dang 'dzin byed kyi ngo bo de bzhin @266a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid mthong bas spang bya gzung bya dang 'dzin byed kyi ngo bo de bzhin @266a * //
translated: The path of seeing is the state that is characterized by the pacification of conceptual thoughts and the insight that is accompanied by the nonapprehension of the essential nature of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, which are to be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: nyid mngon du med pas dmigs bya dang dmigs byed zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: nyid mngon du med pas dmigs bya dang dmigs byed zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of seeing is the knowledge that the equality of the object to be focused on and the focus is pacified because the nature of things is not directly perceived.

original: rang rgyud bdag gi mtshan mar mi rtog pas bdag sems can gyi brda dmigs pa gsal ba chos shes pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: rang rgyud bdag gi mtshan mar mi rtog pas bdag sems can gyi brda dmigs pa gsal ba chos shes pa de yang ngo //
translated: The path of seeing is also the knowledge that the object of observation of the clear manifestation of the term of self and sentient being is eliminated because one does not conceive of the signs of a self of one's continuum.

original: rang rgyud nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan mar mi rtog pa'i phyir bdag chos kyi brda dmigs pa bsal ba shes pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: rang rgyud nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan mar mi rtog pa'i phyir bdag chos kyi brda dmigs pa bsal ba shes pa de yang ngo //
translated: The path of seeing is also the knowledge that the object of observation of the clear manifestation of the term of phenomena and self is eliminated because one does not conceive of the signs of phenomena such as form of one's continuum.

original: thams cad du khyad par med pas bdag dang chos kyi mtshan mar mi rtog pas thams cad du gnyis ka'i brda dmigs pa bsal ba chos shes pa de yang mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: thams cad du khyad par med pas bdag dang chos kyi mtshan mar mi rtog pas thams cad du gnyis ka'i brda dmigs pa bsal ba chos shes pa de yang mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of seeing is also the knowledge that the object of observation of the clear manifestation of the term of both is eliminated because one does not conceive of the signs of self and phenomena without differentiation.

original: rab tu dbye na yang mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye na yang mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
translated: When divided, the path of seeing is the sixteen moments.

original: 'di ltar / 'jig rten chos mchog gi de ma thag tu sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jig rten chos mchog gi de ma thag tu sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang /
translated: Thus, immediately after the supreme mundane state, there is: the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering,

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang /
translated: the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to origin, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to origin, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to origin, the subsequent knowledge with regard to origin, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation,

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation, the subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the path, and the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: With regard to this, suffering is the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te chos ston pa ni chos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te chos ston pa ni chos so //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma in terms of the truth of suffering is the Dharma.

original: sbyor ba'i lam du bden pa'i dbang du bya ba'i chos rnam par spyod pa ni shes pa'o //🔽sngon gyi rnam par dpyod pas bdag por byas pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam du bden pa'i dbang du bya ba'i chos rnam par spyod pa ni shes pa'o // sngon gyi rnam par dpyod pas bdag por byas pa /
translated: The discernment of the dharmas that are the objects of the truth in the path of application is understanding.🔽The discernment of the truth of suffering in the path of application is investigation.

original: rang so sor sdug bsngal bden pa la mngon sum du nyams su myong ba zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rang so sor sdug bsngal bden pa la mngon sum du nyams su myong ba zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The direct experience of the truth of suffering in one's own stream of consciousness, through the nondiscriminating knowledge that is the result of the previous investigation, is patience.

original: 'di skad du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:🔽In the path of application, the knowledge that discerns the dharmas of the sutras, etc. that are the objects of the truth of suffering, is included in the proper mental attention.

original: sbyor ba'i lam du mdo sde'i la sogs pa'i chos sdug bsngal bden pa'i dbang du bya ba rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa bdag por byas nas /🔽rang rgyud kyi sdug bsngal bden pa la /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam du mdo sde'i la sogs pa'i chos sdug bsngal bden pa'i dbang du bya ba rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa bdag por byas nas / rang rgyud kyi sdug bsngal bden pa la /
translated: Having made that the dominant condition,

original: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid mngon sum du nyams su myong ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @266b shes rab yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rang bzhin skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid mngon sum du nyams su myong ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @266b shes rab yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rang bzhin skye'o //
translated: the direct experience of the suchness of suffering in the truth of suffering in one's own stream of consciousness, is the supramundane nondiscriminating knowledge that is the nature of correct view.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa nyer brgyad rab tu yod pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa nyer brgyad rab tu yod pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The perseverance for the cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering is the perseverance for the abandonment of the twenty-eight afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by seeing suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i de ma thag tu shes pa gang gis rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i de ma thag tu shes pa gang gis rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering is the cognition by which one actualizes liberation immediately after the perseverance for the cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /🔽sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas rten yongs su 'gyur ba la de ma thag tu shes pa gang gis yongs su 'gyur ba'i rten de so sor nyams su myong ba de ni sdug
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs pa yin te / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas rten yongs su 'gyur ba la de ma thag tu shes pa gang gis yongs su 'gyur ba'i rten de so sor nyams su myong ba de ni sdug
translated: This is stated as follows:

original: bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: The perseverance for the cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering is the perseverance for the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing suffering. The cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering is the cognition by which one experiences the transformation of the basis that is the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing suffering immediately after the transformation of the basis.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i de ma thag tu sdug bsngal chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dag gi rjes su 'gro ba ste /🔽'di ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyi chos so zhes rang so sor mngon sum du nyams su myong ba zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa de la shes pa gang
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i de ma thag tu sdug bsngal chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dag gi rjes su 'gro ba ste / 'di ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyi chos so zhes rang so sor mngon sum du nyams su myong ba zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa de la shes pa gang
translated: Immediately after the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering, there is the receptivity of the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering and the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering.🔽The receptivity of the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering is the pure wisdom that experiences individually and directly that this is the doctrine of the noble ones, whether they are in training or beyond training.

original: gis so sor nyams su myong ba de ni rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gis so sor nyams su myong ba de ni rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering is the cognition by means of which one experiences that receptivity.

original: de bzhin du bden pa lhag ma rnams la ci rigs par bzod pa rnams dang shes pa rnams la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bden pa lhag ma rnams la ci rigs par bzod pa rnams dang shes pa rnams la rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand the receptivities and cognitions with regard to the remaining truths in accordance with the system.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of the supramundane path is twofold:

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: reality and correct wisdom.

original: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The object of the path that is the side of the cognition of the doctrine is reality.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs lam gyi yul ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs lam gyi yul ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The object of the subsequent cognition is the path of right knowledge.

original: de'i phyir chos la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis de bzhin nyid nges par rtogs pas bzung ba nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis de bzhin nyid nges par rtogs pas bzung ba nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by means of the acceptances and knowledges of the truth of Dharma, one realizes the truth of ultimate reality, and so one realizes the grasped.

original: rjes su bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su shes pas bzung ba nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa yongs su shes pas bzung ba nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: By means of the subsequent acceptances and knowledges, one realizes the truth of right knowledge, and so one realizes the grasped.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad la rnal 'byor pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad la rnal 'byor pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the yogi/nis who have the acceptances and knowledges abide in the signless.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag drug pa ni gang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag drug pa ni gang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord has said, “The sixth person abides in the signless.”

original: de ni bzod pa dang shes pa la 'jug bzhin pa rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bzod pa dang shes pa la 'jug bzhin pa rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this refers to those who are engaged in the acceptances and knowledges,

original: mtshan ma thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not apprehend any signs.

original: de la @267a * //
analyzed: de la @267a * //
translated: Therein,

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: the one who abides in the signless

original: mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
translated: is on the path of seeing, in the sixteen thought-moments.

original: sngon ma mthong ba'i 'phags pa rnams kyis bden pa re re la rnam pa bzhis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba'i 'phags pa rnams kyis bden pa re re la rnam pa bzhis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the noble ones who have not seen the truths see each truth in four aspects.

original: skad cig ma yang /
analyzed: skad cig ma yang /
translated: The moment is also

original: shes bya la shes pa skye ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya la shes pa skye ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: to be understood as the complete arising of the knowledge of the object.

original: dngos po ma byung ba rnams byung ba tsam gyi skad cig ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po ma byung ba rnams byung ba tsam gyi skad cig ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is not the moment of the mere arising of the non-arisen thing.

original: lam gyi bden pa thams cad rnam pa bzhis rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa thams cad rnam pa bzhis rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: All the truths of the path are to be realized in four ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nyams su mong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nyams su mong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the established, the conceptualized, the experienced, and the perfected.

original: de la rnam par bzhag pa las ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par bzhag pa las ni /
translated: Among them, from the established,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnam pa rang gi rtogs pa mthar thug pa ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnam pa rang gi rtogs pa mthar thug pa ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa /
translated: the śrāvakas and so forth attain the ultimate realization of their own vehicle.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas thob pa'i mtshan ma rnams ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs kyi lam gyi bden pa rnam par bzhag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas thob pa'i mtshan ma rnams ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs kyi lam gyi bden pa rnam par bzhag par byed pa'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition establishes the truth of the path as the aggregate of names, the aggregate of phrases, and the aggregate of syllables, in regard to the signs obtained by the former.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni gang mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten pa'i shes pas rnam par bzhag pa ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed cing goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni gang mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten pa'i shes pas rnam par bzhag pa ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed cing goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Discrimination is the understanding and practice of the truth as it is established by the mundane cognition that is associated with realization.

original: nyams su myong ba ni de bzhin du goms pas gang dang po nyid du gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthong ba'i lam zhes pa spros pa med pa'i gnas skabs bdag so sor nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni de bzhin du goms pas gang dang po nyid du gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthong ba'i lam zhes pa spros pa med pa'i gnas skabs bdag so sor nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Experience is the experience of the self-realization of the truth of the path of vision that is transcendent, which was previously mentioned, in the state of non-discursiveness, through the practice of that.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
translated: Fulfillment is

original: de'i gong du gang rten yongs su 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa ci srid du rtogs pa mthar thug pa rab tu thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gong du gang rten yongs su 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa ci srid du rtogs pa mthar thug pa rab tu thob pa'o //
translated: the attainment of the ultimate realization of the transformation of the basis, which is beyond that.

original: yang rtogs pa mthar thug pa thob pa de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas lam gyi bden pa rnam par bzhag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang rtogs pa mthar thug pa thob pa de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas lam gyi bden pa rnam par bzhag par byed pa'o //
translated: Also, the knowledge that is attained subsequent to the attainment of ultimate realization establishes the truth of the path.

original: gang du chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang du chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said, “where the eye of truth with regard to phenomena arises, free from dust and free from contaminants.”

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the path of seeing.

original: de yang chos la bzod pa ni rdul dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de yang chos la bzod pa ni rdul dang bral ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the acceptance of phenomena is free from dust,

original: des nyon mongs pa'i rdul rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa'i rdul rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abandons the dust of the afflictions.

original: chos shes pas dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos shes pas dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of phenomena is free from contaminants,

original: chos shes pa de rnams kyi sgrib pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i rten skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa de rnams kyi sgrib pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i rten skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the arising of the knowledge of phenomena that is free from the contaminants that obscure it.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Above the path of seeing, the path of cultivation has nine aspects.

original: 'di ltar / 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / lam chung du dang / lam 'bring dang / lam @267b rab dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / lam chung du dang / lam 'bring dang / lam @267b rab dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dang /
translated: Thus, there is the mundane path, the supramundane path, the lesser path, the middling path, the greater path, the path of application, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation,

original: khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: and the special path.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi bden pa mngon par rtogs par byed pa na /🔽bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i gong du kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir ldan pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi bden pa mngon par rtogs par byed pa na / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i gong du kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir ldan pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes brjod do //
translated: When the noble disciples are causing the realization of the truths,🔽prior to the realization of the truths, in order to abandon the remaining fetters, this is called the mundane path, etc.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar du nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bzhag pa sngon du gsungs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar du nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bzhag pa sngon du gsungs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam mo //
translated: The mundane path is the previously mentioned presentation of the first concentration up to the neither-discrimination-nor-non-discrimination, with afflictions, etc.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam shes pa ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i phyogs brgyad de dag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam shes pa ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i phyogs brgyad de dag dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of cultivation is transcendent, from the first meditative stabilization up to the base of nothingness, which is included in unrestricted access concentration, and is endowed with the eight aspects of knowing the origin of suffering, its cessation, and the path, which are the side of subsequent knowing.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min na'ang 'jig rten pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min na'ang 'jig rten pa kho na ste /
translated: The base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is only mundane.

original: 'du shes kyi rgyu ba mi gsal zhing 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu ba mi gsal la rten pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rgyu ba mi gsal zhing 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu ba mi gsal la rten pa ma yin pas /
translated: Because the movement of perception is unclear and the movement of the ārya path is unclear and not a support.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'jig rten pa kho na min par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'jig rten pa kho na min par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not exclusively mundane.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci srid nyid du 'du shes snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa mngon du byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci srid nyid du 'du shes snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa mngon du byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Whatever is meditative absorption with regard to perception is the actualization of complete knowledge.”

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The meditative absorption of cessation is also transcendent.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obtained subsequent to the path of the noble ones.

original: dang po mi nyid du skye ste /
analyzed: dang po mi nyid du skye ste /
translated: One is born first as a human being.

original: mi 'am gzugs kyi khams su mngon du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'am gzugs kyi khams su mngon du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It manifests in the realm of desire or the realm of form.

original: sngon bskyed pa nyid phyis mngon du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sngon bskyed pa nyid phyis mngon du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It manifests later, after having been produced previously.

original: mi'i skye ba de nyid la'am gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas so //
analyzed: mi'i skye ba de nyid la'am gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas so //
translated: Either in the very same human birth or after having been reborn in the realm of form.

original: lam chung ngu rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lam chung ngu rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The small path is threefold:

original: 'di ltar / chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i rab bo //
translated: small of the small, small of the medium, and small of the great.

original: gang gis khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa sa nas sa ru grangs bzhin du rab kyi rab dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi tha ma'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa sa nas sa ru grangs bzhin du rab kyi rab dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi tha ma'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'o //
translated: By means of it, one abandons the great of the great, the great of the medium, and the great of the small defilements of the three realms, respectively.

original: lam 'bring yang rnam pa gsum ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: lam 'bring yang rnam pa gsum ni 'di ltar /
translated: The medium path is also threefold:

original: 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi rab bo //
analyzed: 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi rab bo //
translated: medium of the small, medium of the medium, and medium of the great.

original: lam gang gis khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams sa nas sa ru 'bring gi rab @268a * //
analyzed: lam gang gis khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams sa nas sa ru 'bring gi rab @268a * //
translated: By what path are the afflictions that occur in the three realms abandoned?🔽The small of the small, the medium of the small, and the great of the small abandon the great, medium, and small aspects of the afflictions of the first absorption.

original: dang 'bring gi 'bring dang 'bring gi chung ngu'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa rnams rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: dang 'bring gi 'bring dang 'bring gi chung ngu'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa rnams rab tu spong ngo //
translated: The medium of the medium and the great of the medium abandon the great, medium, and small aspects of the afflictions of the second absorption.🔽The small of the great and the medium of the great abandon the great, medium, and small aspects of the afflictions of the third absorption.🔽The great of the great abandons the great, medium, and small aspects of the afflictions of the fourth absorption and the peak of existence.

original: lam rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lam rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The path of small of the small abandons the great of the great afflictions.🔽The path of medium of the small abandons the medium of the great afflictions.🔽The path of great of the small abandons the small of the great afflictions.🔽The path of small of the medium abandons the great of the medium afflictions.🔽The path of medium of the medium abandons the medium of the medium afflictions.

original: 'di ltar / rab kyi chung ngu dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rab kyi chung ngu dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi rab bo //
translated: The path of great of the medium abandons the small of the medium afflictions.🔽The path of small of the great abandons the great of the small afflictions.🔽The path of medium of the great abandons the medium of the small afflictions.🔽The path of great of the great abandons the small of the small afflictions.🔽The path of small of the small abandons the great of the great afflictions.🔽The path of medium of the small abandons the medium of the great afflictions.🔽The path of great of the small abandons the small of the great afflictions.🔽The path of small of the medium abandons the great of the medium afflictions.🔽The path of medium of the medium abandons the medium of the medium afflictions.🔽The path of great of the medium abandons the small of the medium afflictions.🔽The path of small of the great abandons the great of the small afflictions.🔽The path of medium of the great abandons the medium of the small afflictions.🔽The path of great of the great abandons the small of the small afflictions.🔽The path of small of the small abandons the great of the great afflictions.

original: gang gis khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pas dang sa ru chung ngu'i chen po dang chung ngu'i 'bring dang chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'o //🔽smras pa / yang chung ngu'i chung ngu'i lam gyis chen po'i nyon mongs pa spong ba rgyu ci zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: gang gis khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pas dang sa ru chung ngu'i chen po dang chung ngu'i 'bring dang chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'o //🔽smras pa / yang chung ngu'i chung ngu'i lam gyis chen po'i nyon mongs pa spong ba rgyu ci zhe na brjod de /
translated: The path of medium of the small abandons the medium of the great afflictions.🔽The path of great of the small abandons

original: nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po de yang ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa'i don shin tu rnam par nyams pa ngo tsha med pa'i rgyud la kun du spyod pa mtshon sla ba dang 'di ni yongs su spyad pa bslab pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po de yang ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa'i don shin tu rnam par nyams pa ngo tsha med pa'i rgyud la kun du spyod pa mtshon sla ba dang 'di ni yongs su spyad pa bslab pa'o //
translated: The great of the great afflictions are easy to point out as being the conduct in the mindstream of one who is utterly lacking in shame and embarrassment, which is the cause of shamelessness. This is the training in complete purity.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni dri ma rags pa bzhin du gnyen po chung dus kyang rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni dri ma rags pa bzhin du gnyen po chung dus kyang rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, this is like a coarse stain that is removed by a small amount of the antidote.

original: gang yang yongs su bcad par dka' ba'i kun du spyod pa phra ba rgyud la thim pa nyon mongs pa chung ngu ni dri ma phra mo thim pa bzhin du ches che ba'i gnyen po'i stobs kyis sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gang yang yongs su bcad par dka' ba'i kun du spyod pa phra ba rgyud la thim pa nyon mongs pa chung ngu ni dri ma phra mo thim pa bzhin du ches che ba'i gnyen po'i stobs kyis sel bar byed do //
translated: The small afflictions, which are subtle conduct that is difficult to discern and is absorbed into the mindstream, are removed by the power of a great antidote, like a subtle stain that is removed.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bzlog pas gnyen po'i rnam pa rnam par bzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bzlog pas gnyen po'i rnam pa rnam par bzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this, the aspects of the antidote should be understood as being presented through the reversal of the aspects of the opposing factors.

original: lam gang gis sgom par byed pas chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa'i rigs kyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi cha shas bsal bas rim gyis rten yongs su 'gyur ba de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i lam mo //🔽lam gang gis de ma thag tu de'i rnam pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rigs kyi gnas ngan len lhag ma med par spong bas gnas ngan len des gnas ngan len med par gyur pa'i rten yongs su 'gyur ba de ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam gang gis sgom par byed pas chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa'i rigs kyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi cha shas bsal bas rim gyis rten yongs su 'gyur ba de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i lam mo // lam gang gis de ma thag tu de'i rnam pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rigs kyi gnas ngan len lhag ma med par spong bas gnas ngan len des gnas ngan len med par gyur pa'i rten yongs su 'gyur ba de ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path by which one meditates is the path of preparation of the path of meditation, since it gradually transforms the basis by eliminating the part of the negative tendencies that are the types of the aspects of the great of the great afflictions and so on.🔽The path by which one immediately abandons without remainder the remaining negative tendencies of the type of affliction of that level is the uninterrupted path, since it transforms the basis into one that is free of those negative tendencies.

original: lam gang gis nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i rnam par grol ba rten yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mngon du byed pa de ni rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam gang gis nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i rnam par grol ba rten yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mngon du byed pa de ni rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path by which one manifests the liberation that is the abandonment of affliction is the path of liberation, since it is characterized by the transformation of the basis.

original: de'i gong du nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong bar byed pa gang sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: de'i gong du nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong bar byed pa gang sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The path of distinction is the path of application, the uninterrupted path, and the path of liberation that abandons the remaining afflictions above that.

original: gang yang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba btang snyoms su byas te /
analyzed: gang yang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba btang snyoms su byas te /
translated: The path of distinction is also the path of one who has abandoned the application that abandons afflictions and

original: mdo la sogs pa'i chos bsam pa sngon bsam pa'i rtogs pa'i chos so sor rtog pa'i gnas pas gnas @268b pa'am ;
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i chos bsam pa sngon bsam pa'i rtogs pa'i chos so sor rtog pa'i gnas pas gnas @268b pa'am ;
translated: who abides in the meditative stabilization of discernment of the doctrine that is the doctrine of the sūtras and so on that was previously contemplated.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug bzhin pa'i lam de yang khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug bzhin pa'i lam de yang khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The path of distinction is also the path of one who is abiding in meditative equipoise on another meditative absorption.

original: gang yang khyad par can gyi yon tan mngon shes la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa'am bskyed zin pa'i mngon shes la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rnam par gnas pa'i lam de yang khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: gang yang khyad par can gyi yon tan mngon shes la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa'am bskyed zin pa'i mngon shes la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rnam par gnas pa'i lam de yang khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The path of distinction is also the path of one who is abiding in the special qualities that are the superknowledges and so on that are being newly achieved or that have already been generated.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having extensively explained the path of meditation,

original: gzhan yang lam bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lam bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: there are four other types of meditation on the path.

original: 'di ltar / rtsom pa sgom pa dang / nges par rten pa sgom pa dang / nges par dag pa sgom pa dang / gnyen po sgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rtsom pa sgom pa dang / nges par rten pa sgom pa dang / nges par dag pa sgom pa dang / gnyen po sgom pa'o //
translated: and cultivation of the antidote.

original: de la gang la skyes pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams bskyed pa'i phyir sgom pa de ni rab tu rtsom pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang la skyes pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams bskyed pa'i phyir sgom pa de ni rab tu rtsom pa sgom pa'o //
translated: Among them, cultivation for the sake of generating virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen is cultivation of undertaking.

original: gang skyes pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams gnas pa'i phyir dang kun du mi brjod pa'i phyir dang yang yang 'byung ba'i phyir dang 'jug pa rgyas pa'i phyir sgom pa de ni nges par rten pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang skyes pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams gnas pa'i phyir dang kun du mi brjod pa'i phyir dang yang yang 'byung ba'i phyir dang 'jug pa rgyas pa'i phyir sgom pa de ni nges par rten pa sgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of maintaining virtuous dharmas that have arisen, for the sake of not forgetting them, for the sake of repeatedly arising, and for the sake of increasing engagement is cultivation of definite support.

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir sgom pa de ni nges par dag pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir sgom pa de ni nges par dag pa sgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of abandoning arisen evil nonvirtuous dharmas is cultivation of definite purification.

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir sgom pa de ni gnyen po sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir sgom pa de ni gnyen po sgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation for the sake of not producing evil nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen is cultivation of the antidote.

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs ni /
translated: Moreover, there is another enumeration:

original: de yang / lam gang skye bzhin pa na rang gi bag chags rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni rab tu rtsom pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: de yang / lam gang skye bzhin pa na rang gi bag chags rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni rab tu rtsom pa sgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of undertaking is that by which one establishes one's propensities while any path is being generated.

original: lam de nyid mngon du gyur pa na sgom par 'gro ba de ni nges par rten pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: lam de nyid mngon du gyur pa na sgom par 'gro ba de ni nges par rten pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of going is that by which one goes to the cultivation of the path itself.

original: lam de nyid mngon du gyur pas rang gi sgrib pa sel ba de ni nges par mkhyud pa sgom pa ste /
analyzed: lam de nyid mngon du gyur pas rang gi sgrib pa sel ba de ni nges par mkhyud pa sgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of binding is that by which one eliminates one's obscurations through the actualization of the path itself.

original: rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len mkhyud pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid sgrib pa spangs pas mi skye ba'i chos nyid la rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni gnyen po sgom pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len mkhyud pa'i phyir ro // de nyid sgrib pa spangs pas mi skye ba'i chos nyid la rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni gnyen po sgom pa ste /
translated: Because it binds the negative tendencies that are adverse to it.🔽The cultivation of the antidote is that by which one establishes the nature of non-production through the elimination of obscurations.

original: rten yongs su 'gyur bas phyis mi skye ba'i chos nyid la rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rten yongs su 'gyur bas phyis mi skye ba'i chos nyid la rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Because it establishes the nature of non-production later through the transformation of the basis.

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs ni /
translated: Moreover, there is another enumeration.

original: de yang / gnyen po sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang / gnyen po sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The cultivation of the antidote is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang / spong ba'i gnyen po dang / rten gyi gnyen po dang / ring du byed pa'i gnyen po'o //🔽de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams la nyes skyon du mthong nas nad dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa ni rnam par @269a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang / spong ba'i gnyen po dang / rten gyi gnyen po dang / ring du byed pa'i gnyen po'o // de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams la nyes skyon du mthong nas nad dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa ni rnam par @269a * //
translated: the antidote of thorough understanding, the antidote of abandonment, the antidote of support, and the antidote of distance.🔽The antidote of thorough understanding is the thorough understanding of the five appropriated aggregates as a disease, a boil, an arrow, etc.,

original: sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: after seeing the faults and problems of contaminated compositional activity.

original: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam ni spong ba'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam ni spong ba'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote of abandonment is the path of application and the uninterrupted path,

original: nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abandon the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni rten gyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni rten gyi gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote of support is the liberated path,

original: spangs pa thob pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa thob pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it correctly holds the attainment of abandonment.

original: de'i steng du lam gang zhig na ring du byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du lam gang zhig na ring du byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote of distance is the path that is beyond that,

original: spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it distances itself from all abandoned afflictions.

original: yang lam rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: yang lam rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: There are also eleven kinds of paths.

original: 'di ltar / dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam dang / 'bad rtsol gyi lam dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su spyod ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam dang / 'bad rtsol gyi lam dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su spyod ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam dang /
translated: They are: the path of thorough understanding of things, the path of effort, the path of thorough cultivation of samadhi, the path of application to realization, the path connected with realization,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / rnam par dag pa nges par 'byung ba'i lam dang / bslab pa gsum yongs su dag par byed pa'i lam dang / yon tan thams cad mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam dang / lam bsdus pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / rnam par dag pa nges par 'byung ba'i lam dang / bslab pa gsum yongs su dag par byed pa'i lam dang / yon tan thams cad mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam dang / lam bsdus pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of realization, the path of definite emergence of purification, the path of purification of the three educations, the path of accomplishment of all virtues, and the path of the summary of the paths.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are the path of thorough understanding of things.

original: dang po nyid du mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas lus tshor ba sems chos yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid du mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas lus tshor ba sems chos yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, from the very beginning, one thoroughly understands the body, feelings, thought, and dharmas through the aspects of impurity, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba ni 'bad rtsol gyi lam mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba ni 'bad rtsol gyi lam mo //
translated: The right efforts are the path of effort.

original: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad yongs su brtag ste lam gyi sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad yongs su brtag ste lam gyi sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, he should examine all things and apply himself to the practice of the path in order to eliminate the obscurations.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The bases of psychic power are the path of the purification of concentration.

original: de ltar sgrib pa yongs su sbyangs pas lam 'dis 'dun pa brtson 'grus sems dpyod pa'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin las su rung ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa yongs su sbyangs pas lam 'dis 'dun pa brtson 'grus sems dpyod pa'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin las su rung ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, by the purification of obscurations, he generates the serviceability of concentration by means of will, effort, thought, and examination, by means of this path.

original: dbang po lnga ni mngon par rtogs pa las byung ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni mngon par rtogs pa las byung ba'i lam ste /
translated: The five faculties are the path of the origination of clear realization.

original: de ltar lam 'dis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pas 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par thob pa'i phyir drod dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba las bdag por gyur pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar lam 'dis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pas 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par thob pa'i phyir drod dang rtse mo'i sbyor ba las bdag por gyur pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, by the purification of concentration by means of this path, he attains the noble path, because he attains mastery over the applications of heat and summit.

original: stobs lnga ni mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: stobs lnga ni mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam ste /
translated: The five powers are the path connected with clear realization.

original: de bzhin du lam 'dis bdag por gyur pa thob pas de ma thag tu bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir bzod pa dang chos mchog gi sbyor bas ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam 'dis bdag por gyur pa thob pas de ma thag tu bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir bzod pa dang chos mchog gi sbyor bas ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, since one obtains mastery by this path, immediately after that, in order to manifest the truths, one suppresses the discordant class of non-faith and so on by the preparation of the supreme mundane state and acceptance.🔽

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ste /
translated: Likewise, since one obtains mastery by this path, immediately after that, in order to manifest the truths, one should know that the factors of enlightenment are the path of clear realization,

original: bden pa'i bdag nyid so sor @269b yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i bdag nyid so sor @269b yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one individually realizes the nature of the truths.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam ste /
translated: The eightfold noble path is the path of definite emergence that purifies

original: de'i gong du lam des bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang dag par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de'i gong du lam des bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang dag par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bas so //
translated: because one definitely emerges by abandoning afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation through cultivating that path above that.

original: de rnams nyid ni byang chub phyogs kyi chos rnams de ltar mthar gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni byang chub phyogs kyi chos rnams de ltar mthar gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that those are the factors of enlightenment and the factors of the path in that order.

original: khyad par med pa byang chub phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa mngon pa kun las btus ba las gsungs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams bdag gis 'dir rgyas par ma bris te mngas pas 'jigs pas
analyzed: khyad par med pa byang chub phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa mngon pa kun las btus ba las gsungs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams bdag gis 'dir rgyas par ma bris te mngas pas 'jigs pas
translated: I have not written about these in detail here, fearing prolixity.

original: so // de las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: so // de las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood from that text.

original: rten gyi dbang po tha dad pa'i lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽dbang po rtul po bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi ma thob pa ni mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam mo //🔽dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi bsam gtan ma thob pa ni mngon par shes ba myur la dka' ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rten gyi dbang po tha dad pa'i lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste / dbang po rtul po bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi ma thob pa ni mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam mo // dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi bsam gtan ma thob pa ni mngon par shes ba myur la dka' ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of different faculties is of four kinds.🔽The path of slow and difficult superknowledge is for those of dull faculty who have not attained the actual basis of meditative stabilization.🔽The path of quick and difficult superknowledge is for those of sharp faculty who have not attained the actual basis of meditative stabilization.

original: dbang po rtul po dngos gzhi bsam gtan thob pa ni mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po dngos gzhi bsam gtan thob pa ni mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of slow and easy superknowledge is for those of dull faculty who have attained the actual basis of meditative stabilization.🔽The path of quick and easy superknowledge is for those of sharp faculty who have attained the actual basis of meditative stabilization.

original: dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi bsam gtan thob pa ni mngon par shes ba myur la sla ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dngos gzhi bsam gtan thob pa ni mngon par shes ba myur la sla ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of quick direct intuition and ease is for one of sharp faculty who has attained the basic meditative concentration.

original: bslab pa gsum yongs su dag par byed pa'i lam ni dngos po chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum yongs su dag par byed pa'i lam ni dngos po chos bzhi ste /
translated: The path that purifies the three educations is the four things:

original: 'di ltar brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: noncovetousness, nonmalice, right mindfulness, and right meditative concentration.

original: de la brnab sems med pa dang gnod sems med pa dag ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la brnab sems med pa dang gnod sems med pa dag ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag par byed pa ste /
translated: Among these, noncovetousness and nonmalice purify the education of superior morality,

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro'i sgo nas bslab pa'i gzhi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro'i sgo nas bslab pa'i gzhi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not violate the bases of training through attachment and hostility.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dag par byed de 'dis kun du ma rmongs par gyur nas sems ting nge 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dag par byed de 'dis kun du ma rmongs par gyur nas sems ting nge 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Right mindfulness purifies the education of superior mind, because, through it, one does not become confused and the mind becomes concentrated.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dag par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dag par byed do //
translated: Right concentration purifies the training in wisdom.

original: 'dis mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, by means of it, one understands the mind in meditative equipoise just as it is.

original: yon tan thams cad mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam ni gnyis te /
translated: The path that accomplishes all virtues is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
translated: tranquility and insight.

original: de la zhi gnas ni sems kyi gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas ni sems kyi gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Tranquility is the nine mental states.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: de ni ci ltar yang nang du sems 'jog @270a * //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar yang nang du sems 'jog @270a * //
translated: One places the mind internally,

original: par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa dang / rnam par 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog par byed pa dang / rnam par 'jog par byed pa dang / nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: one places it well, one places it properly, one holds it, one controls it, one calms it, one thoroughly pacifies it,

original: gcig nyid du byed pa dang / mnyam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid du byed pa dang / mnyam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: one makes it single-pointed, and one meditates.

original: de la phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la sa  so sor bsdus te nang du sems mngon par bsdus nas nye bar 'ching ba ni 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la sa  so sor bsdus te nang du sems mngon par bsdus nas nye bar 'ching ba ni 'jog pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the settling of the mind is the binding of the mind internally by collecting it into the various stages of the external objective supports.

original: de ltar dang po nyid du nye bar bcings pa'i sems de ni g-yo ba rags pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar dang po nyid du nye bar bcings pa'i sems de ni g-yo ba rags pa ste /
translated: The mind that is bound in this way at the beginning is coarse, because it is unsteady.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la brten pa'i sbyor bas phra bar byed pa'i mngon par sdud pa ni yang dag par 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la brten pa'i sbyor bas phra bar byed pa'i mngon par sdud pa ni yang dag par 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The mind is collected by means of the application that is based on that very objective support, and it is made subtle. This is the correct settling of the mind.

original: de ltar bzhag pa'i sems de ni dran pa kun du rmongs pas phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba na /
analyzed: de ltar bzhag pa'i sems de ni dran pa kun du rmongs pas phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba na /
translated: When the mind that is settled in this way is distracted externally by the confusion of forgetfulness,

original: yang so sor sdud pa ni rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: yang so sor sdud pa ni rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: it is again collected. This is the resetting of the mind.

original: dang po nyid du sems de dag phyi rol du rnam par mi 'byam pa'i phyir dran pas nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid du sems de dag phyi rol du rnam par mi 'byam pa'i phyir dran pas nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: The mind is placed by means of mindfulness so that it does not stray externally at the beginning. This is the close placement of the mind.

original: sngon gyi mtshan ma nyid la rnam par g-yeng ba nas gzugs la sogs pa'i nyes skyon gyis 'du shes gtso bor byas te sems g-yeng bar mi bya ba ni dul ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshan ma nyid la rnam par g-yeng ba nas gzugs la sogs pa'i nyes skyon gyis 'du shes gtso bor byas te sems g-yeng bar mi bya ba ni dul ba'o //
translated: Taming is the avoidance of distraction by the notional attachment to the signs of former times, and by the notional attachment to the faults of form etc.

original: sems kun du 'khrugs par byed pa sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la nyes skyon du bltas nas rab tu mi g-yeng ba ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sems kun du 'khrugs par byed pa sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la nyes skyon du bltas nas rab tu mi g-yeng ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Calm is the non-distraction of mind by the faults of the secondary defilements of discursive thought, after one has seen them as faults.

original: dran pa kun du rmongs pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa kun du spyod pa na /
analyzed: dran pa kun du rmongs pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa kun du spyod pa na /
translated: When one is confused by forgetfulness and discursive thought etc. are active, one should pacify them.

original: de dag lhag par zhi bar byed pa ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de dag lhag par zhi bar byed pa ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Pacification is the further calming of those.

original: mngon par 'du byed pas ma nyams shing bar med par ting nge 'dzin rgyun du rnam par gnas pa ni gcig nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas ma nyams shing bar med par ting nge 'dzin rgyun du rnam par gnas pa ni gcig nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: Unification is the continuous abiding in samādhi without loss and without interruption through application.

original: shin tu goms pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med cing rtsol ba med pas sems ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa dang gis rnam par g-yeng ba med pas rab tu 'jug pa ni mnyam par 'dzin par byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med cing rtsol ba med pas sems ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa dang gis rnam par g-yeng ba med pas rab tu 'jug pa ni mnyam par 'dzin par byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: Because of thorough familiarity, the mind enters concentration spontaneously, without any deliberate effort or exertion, and it is not distracted.

original: rnal 'byor pa shes rab gang gis brtson pas chos la dmigs pa na shes par bya ba ci rnyed par gzhig pa dang / shes par bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / shes rab dang lhan cig pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pas rgyu mtshan du byed pa dang yongs su rnam par rtog par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa shes rab gang gis brtson pas chos la dmigs pa na shes par bya ba ci rnyed par gzhig pa dang / shes par bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / shes rab dang lhan cig pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pas rgyu mtshan du byed pa dang yongs su rnam par rtog par byed pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is diligent in the wisdom of yoga, when he observes phenomena, finds what is to be known, discriminates what is to be known as it really is, and with the nondiscriminative attention that accompanies wisdom, he makes it a sign, he fully discriminates it, and he generates the practice of right thought.

original: yang dag par sems pa yongs su spyod pa kun du skye ba de ni shes rab lhag mthong yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par sems pa yongs su spyod pa kun du skye ba de ni shes rab lhag mthong yin no //
translated: This is the insight of wisdom.

original: lam rnams @270b bsdus pa'i lam ni dbang po gsum ste /
analyzed: lam rnams @270b bsdus pa'i lam ni dbang po gsum ste /
translated: The path that includes all paths is the three faculties.

original: 'di ltar / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa la dang mthong ba'i lam sems skad cig ma bco lnga la ni sngon ma shes pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pas mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa la dang mthong ba'i lam sems skad cig ma bco lnga la ni sngon ma shes pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pas mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: Thus, the faculty producing complete knowledge is possessed by one who has entered the path of seeing, since it is the faculty that knows the reality of thatness not previously known, it is subsumed by the fifteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam sems skad cig ma bcu drug ma nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du slob pa'i lam de rnams la sngon ma yin pa'i shes par bya ba med pas kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni dgra bcom pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /🔽de ni mi slob pa'i lam la ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam sems skad cig ma bcu drug ma nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du slob pa'i lam de rnams la sngon ma yin pa'i shes par bya ba med pas kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni dgra bcom pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste / de ni mi slob pa'i lam la ni /
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge and the faculty possessing complete knowledge are called the faculty of an arhat.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge is possessed on the path of no learning.

original: 'di yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas te bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas te bstan par bya ste /
translated: This should be explained from the perspective of the path of meditation.

original: sa gong ma'i lam ni sngon du gyur pa'i ngo bos sgom par byed bzhin pa na /🔽sngon du ma gyur pas 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang sgom par 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i lam ni sngon du gyur pa'i ngo bos sgom par byed bzhin pa na / sngon du ma gyur pas 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang sgom par 'gro ba yin te /
translated: When one meditates on the essence of the path of higher levels, one also meditates on the roots of virtue of lower levels, since these are not yet present.🔽

original: khyab bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab bdag nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one cultivates the path of a higher stage, one cultivates the roots of virtue of a lower stage, since one has already obtained the essence of the higher stage.

original: khyab bdag ni shin tu ches gsal ba mngon du gyur pa ste dbang du gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni shin tu ches gsal ba mngon du gyur pa ste dbang du gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the master of the universal is extremely clear, manifest, and powerful.

original: kun du ldan pa thos pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa'i phyir dang / bral ba thob pa thams cad brnyes pa dang / gang gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun chad pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de'i de ma thag tu rten yongs su 'gyur ba zad pa shes pa mi skye ba shes pa mi slob pa'i chos bcu ste /
analyzed: kun du ldan pa thos pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa'i phyir dang / bral ba thob pa thams cad brnyes pa dang / gang gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun chad pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de'i de ma thag tu rten yongs su 'gyur ba zad pa shes pa mi skye ba shes pa mi slob pa'i chos bcu ste /
translated: The vajra like samadhi is the realization of the cessation of all negative tendencies. Immediately after that vajra like samadhi, the transformation of the basis is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising, which are the ten qualities of no learning.

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nas ci srid du mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes ni mthar phyin pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nas ci srid du mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes ni mthar phyin pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of culmination is the correct view, etc. of the adept, up to the correct meditative stabilization of the adept, the correct liberation of the adept, and the correct knowledge of the adept.

original: de la gnas ngan len thams cad ni nyi shu bzhi ste /🔽'di ltar / gang thog ma med pa'i du ma nas mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun du gnas shing rjes su brten pa gang yin pa de spros pa ni bag chags zhes brjod de
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len thams cad ni nyi shu bzhi ste / 'di ltar / gang thog ma med pa'i du ma nas mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun du gnas shing rjes su brten pa gang yin pa de spros pa ni bag chags zhes brjod de
translated: Therein, the negative tendencies are twenty-four.🔽Thus, the tendency of verbal proliferation is the habitual tendency to adhere to the expressions of phenomena such as the eyes, etc. that has been present since beginningless time, and which resides in and supports the foundation consciousness.

original: / gang las mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming dang bcas pa'i mngon par zhen pa yang yang du 'jug pa zhes pa de ni thams cad du 'gro ba mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len no //
