analyzed: / gang las mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming dang bcas pa'i mngon par zhen pa yang yang du 'jug pa zhes pa de ni thams cad du 'gro ba mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The negative tendency of verbal expression that pervades all is that which causes the repeated engagement in the adherence to the names of phenomena such as the eyes, etc.

original: gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i rig pa rnams kyi bag chags de ni rig pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i rig pa rnams kyi bag chags de ni rig pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The latent impressions of the consciousnesses that have impurities are the negative reflex actions of consciousness.

original: @271a * // gang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal ni nyon mongs pa gnas ngan len no //🔽gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams kyi bag chags de ni las gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: @271a * // gang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal ni nyon mongs pa gnas ngan len no // gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams kyi bag chags de ni las gnas ngan len no //
translated: The dormant tendencies of the afflictions are the negative reflex actions of the afflictions.🔽The latent impressions of the actions that have impurities are the negative reflex actions of action.

original: gang rnam par smin pa las su rung ba ma yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang rnam par smin pa las su rung ba ma yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa gnas ngan len no //
translated: The unserviceability that is the ripening of karma is the negative reflex action of ripening.

original: gang nyon mongs pa drag la che ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa drag la che ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
translated: The strong and great afflictions are the negative reflex actions of the afflictions that are obscurations.

original: gang lam gyi bar chad mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi sgrib pa de ni las kyi sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang lam gyi bar chad mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi sgrib pa de ni las kyi sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscurations of the path, such as the uninterrupted paths of the āryas, are the negative reflex actions of the obscurations of action.

original: gang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa bral ba nyid dmyal ba la sogs pa bdag ngo bo thob pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa bral ba nyid dmyal ba la sogs pa bdag ngo bo thob pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
translated: The attainment of the nature of a hell being, and so on, that is the separation from the realization of the truths is the negative reflex action of the obscurations of ripening.

original: gang dge ba'i phyogs sbyor ba'i bar chad 'dod pa 'dun pa la sogs pa sgrib pa lngas zil gyis mnan pa'i sgrib pa de ni las kyi sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang dge ba'i phyogs sbyor ba'i bar chad 'dod pa 'dun pa la sogs pa sgrib pa lngas zil gyis mnan pa'i sgrib pa de ni las kyi sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscuration that is the obscuration of the five hindrances such as sensual desire, which is the hindrance to the application of virtue, is the negative reflex action of karma.

original: gang rab tu byung ba'i gegs kyi ngo bo 'dod rtog la sogs pas zil gyis mnan pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang rab tu byung ba'i gegs kyi ngo bo 'dod rtog la sogs pas zil gyis mnan pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscuration that is the obscuration of the nature of the hindrance to going forth, which is overwhelmed by sensual thoughts, etc., is the negative reflex action of discursive thought.

original: gang zas shin tu nyung ba dang mang du sbyor bar rung ba de ni zas gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang zas shin tu nyung ba dang mang du sbyor bar rung ba de ni zas gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscuration that is the negative reflex action of food is the food that is suitable for those who are very thin and those who are fat.

original: gang gnyis gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa byas nas lus sems ngal ba de ni log g-yem gyi gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang gnyis gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa byas nas lus sems ngal ba de ni log g-yem gyi gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscuration that is the negative reflex action of sexual misconduct is the fatigue of body and mind that results from sexual union.

original: gang rten gzhan du byas te bskyed pa de ni rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang rten gzhan du byas te bskyed pa de ni rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscuration that is the negative reflex action of dreams is the dream that is produced by the transformation of the basis.

original: gang khams mi mnyam par byas pas legs par rang bzhin du mi gnas pa de ni nad gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang khams mi mnyam par byas pas legs par rang bzhin du mi gnas pa de ni nad gnas ngan len no //
translated: The obscuration that is the negative reflex action of disease is the disease that results from the imbalance of the elements and the absence of natural ease.

original: khams mi mnyam par byas pas sgrub par mi nus pa de ni rga ba'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: khams mi mnyam par byas pas sgrub par mi nus pa de ni rga ba'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The depravity of old age is that which makes the elements of the body uneven and thus incapable of practice.

original: gang 'chi bzhin pa na dbang po thams cad 'khrugs pa de ni 'chi ba gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang 'chi bzhin pa na dbang po thams cad 'khrugs pa de ni 'chi ba gnas ngan len no //
translated: The depravity of death is that which disturbs all the faculties at the time of death.

original: gang mngon par bgrod pa la sogs pa byas pas lus nyes pa de ni yongs su ngal ba gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang mngon par bgrod pa la sogs pa byas pas lus nyes pa de ni yongs su ngal ba gnas ngan len no //
translated: The depravity of complete fatigue is that which makes the body defective through the performance of going and so on.

original: mngon par brjod pa gnas ngan len la sogs pa ci ltar srid pa de rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i chos can rnams kyi ni de ni brtan po gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa gnas ngan len la sogs pa ci ltar srid pa de rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i chos can rnams kyi ni de ni brtan po gnas ngan len no //
translated: The depravity of firm abiding is that which is not conducive to the attainment of nirvana, such as the depravity of verbal expression and so on, as long as it exists.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni rags pa gnas ngan len to //🔽gzugs na spyod pa ni 'bring po gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni rags pa gnas ngan len to // gzugs na spyod pa ni 'bring po gnas ngan len no //
translated: The depravity of the gross is that of the realm of desire.🔽The depravity of the middling is that of the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni 'bring bo gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni 'bring bo gnas ngan len no //
translated: The depravity of the subtle is that of the formless realm.

original: gang nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len to //
translated: The depravity of the obscuration of afflictions is that which is unfavorable to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang mthar gyis @271b gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de sgom par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gang mthar gyis @271b gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de sgom par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa gnas ngan len no //
translated: The negative tendencies that are the counteragents to the serial absorptions are the obscurations to the entry to meditative development.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa gnas ngan lan no //
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa gnas ngan lan no //
translated: The negative tendencies that are the counteragents to omniscience are the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de ltar de snyed gnas ngan len de rnams thams cad kyi ci rigs par rgyun chad pa de ni mthar thug pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de ltar de snyed gnas ngan len de rnams thams cad kyi ci rigs par rgyun chad pa de ni mthar thug pa'i lam mo //
translated: The termination of all those negative tendencies, in whatever way appropriate, is the path of conclusion.

original: gnas ngan len 'phel ba la ldan pa thob pa zhes btags so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len 'phel ba la ldan pa thob pa zhes btags so //
translated: The acquisition of the increase of negative tendencies is designated as non-acquisition.

original: gnas ngan len 'grib pa la thob pa zhes btags so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len 'grib pa la thob pa zhes btags so //
translated: The acquisition of the decrease of negative tendencies is designated as acquisition.

original: gang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha' spong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtha' spong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The state of the path of abandonment at the end of the path of meditative development is the vajra-like concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di bsdu na gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di bsdu na gnyis te /
translated: This concentration is summarized as twofold:

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: thus, it is included in the path of preparation and it is included in the uninterrupted path.

original: de la sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni /🔽gang nas bzung ste sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi shigs shing /🔽sgrib pa thams cad 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni / gang nas bzung ste sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi shigs shing / sgrib pa thams cad 'jig pa'o //
translated: The path of insight is that by which he penetrates the reality realm.🔽The path of cultivation is that by which he abandons the obstructions.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni gang gis de ma thag tu zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni gang gis de ma thag tu zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag skyes pa'o //
translated: The path of no training is that by which he attains the result.🔽That concentration is also the vajra-like concentration, which is the antidote to the obstructions to the attainment of omniscience.

original: ting nge 'dzin de 'ang byang chub chen po la bar chad med pa ches brtan pa dang ro gcig khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de 'ang byang chub chen po la bar chad med pa ches brtan pa dang ro gcig khyab pa'o //
translated: It is the vajra-like concentration because it is like a vajra in that it is unshakable by any opposition, it is firm, it is of one taste, and it is pervasive.🔽It is unshakable by any opposition because it is not destroyed by the path of the mundane world.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis de'i rgyun mi nyams pas bar chad med pas dang sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi chod pa'i dang sgrib pa thams cad 'joms pas snying po yin pa'i phyir ches brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis de'i rgyun mi nyams pas bar chad med pas dang sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi chod pa'i dang sgrib pa thams cad 'joms pas snying po yin pa'i phyir ches brtan pa'o //
translated: It is firm because it is the basis of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du ro gcig pas ro gcig go //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du ro gcig pas ro gcig go //
translated: It is of one taste because it is non-conceptual.

original: shes bya thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs pa'i phyir khyab pa ste /🔽rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs pa'i phyir khyab pa ste /🔽rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: It is pervasive because it is the object of the suchness of all objects of knowledge.

original: don 'di dag gzhan la gsal bar bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: don 'di dag gzhan la gsal bar bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord has spoken of these matters in order to make them clear to others.

original: dper na brag ri chen po mi chod pa mi shigs pa srubs med pa gcig tu mkhregs pa shin tu zlum pa shar phyogs kyi rlung 'jug pas mi g-yo ba mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na brag ri chen po mi chod pa mi shigs pa srubs med pa gcig tu mkhregs pa shin tu zlum pa shar phyogs kyi rlung 'jug pas mi g-yo ba mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like a great mountain of rock which is uncuttable, indestructible, without cracks, solid, very round, and immovable and unshakable by the winds which blow from the east.

original: ci ltar shar gyi de bzhin du phyogs thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: ci ltar shar gyi de bzhin du phyogs thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Just as it is in the east, so it is in all directions.

original: de ma thag tu rten yongs su 'gyur bzhes pa ni /
analyzed: de ma thag tu rten yongs su 'gyur bzhes pa ni /
translated: The transformation of the basis is instantaneous.

original: 'dir rten yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir rten yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the transformation of the basis is of three kinds:

original: 'di ltar / me slob pa'i lam thob pas sems kyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba dang / lam gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar / me slob pa'i lam thob pas sems kyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba dang / lam gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: namely, the transformation of the basis of the mind, the transformation of the basis of the path, and the transformation of the basis of negative reflex actions.

original: sngon du 'jig rten pa'i lam ni mngon @272a * //
analyzed: sngon du 'jig rten pa'i lam ni mngon @272a * //
translated: The mundane path is first.

original: par rtogs pa'i dus su 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba ni slob pa zhes brjod de bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par rtogs pa'i dus su 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba ni slob pa zhes brjod de bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is realized, it is called “learner” since it is transformed into the supramundane and has a remainder of action.

original: gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa rnam pa med par 'gyur zhing khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba de'i tshe lam 'di'i rang bzhin gyi rten yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par gzhag par byas te de ni lam gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba'o
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa rnam pa med par 'gyur zhing khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba de'i tshe lam 'di'i rang bzhin gyi rten yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par gzhag par byas te de ni lam gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba'o
translated: When all the resistant tendencies are eliminated without exception and one is free from attachment to the three realms, then the transformation of the basis of this path is established. This is the transformation of the basis of the path.

original: // gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal spangs pas yongs su 'gyur ba de ni gnas ngan len gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: // gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal spangs pas yongs su 'gyur ba de ni gnas ngan len gyi rten yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The transformation of the basis of negative reflex actions is the transformation of the basis of the alaya consciousness through the elimination of the latent impulses of the afflictions.

original: gang kun 'byung lhag ma med par spangs pa'i ye shes sam /
analyzed: gang kun 'byung lhag ma med par spangs pa'i ye shes sam /
translated: The knowledge that is the remainderless elimination of the origin is the knowledge of elimination.

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes de ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes de ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that is the elimination of the cause of that state or the knowledge that focuses on the cessation of that state is the knowledge of elimination.

original: 'bras bu mi skye ba la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skye ba la dmigs pa'am /
translated: The knowledge that focuses on the nonarising of the effect or

original: de bzhin du skye ba med par gyur nas shes pa de la'ang de ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba med par gyur nas shes pa de la'ang de ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, when it becomes non-arisen, that knowledge is the knowledge of non-arising.

original: phyis sdug bsngal thams cad shin tu skye ba med pa'i chos nyid kyi bden pa la gang shes pa ste /
analyzed: phyis sdug bsngal thams cad shin tu skye ba med pa'i chos nyid kyi bden pa la gang shes pa ste /
translated: Later, it is the knowledge of the truth of the ultimate non-arising of all suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal la bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal la bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the knowledge that takes the truth of suffering as its object.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu ni /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu ni /
translated: The ten dharmas of no-more-learning

original: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'i dbang du byas te gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'i dbang du byas te gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: are to be understood as taught in terms of the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the vision and knowledge of liberation of no-more-learning.

original: de la mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de la mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
translated: Among them, the aggregate of morality of no-more-learning is the right speech, right action, and right livelihood of no-more-learning.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o ;
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are the concentration aggregate.

original: / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
translated: Right view, right thought, and right effort are the wisdom aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Right liberation is the liberation aggregate.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Right knowledge is the knowledge and vision of liberation aggregate.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa mtshan ma nyid bzhi ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa mtshan ma nyid bzhi ste /
translated: The aspects of the truth of the path are the four characteristics.

original: 'di ltar / de kho na nyid kyi don 'dis goms par byed pas las kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de kho na nyid kyi don 'dis goms par byed pas las kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of function is that one becomes familiar with the meaning of reality through this path.🔽The characteristic of reason is that it is the antidote to the afflictions that have become unreasonable.

original: mi rigs par gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pas rigs pa mtshan nyid dang / de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i skyon gyis brtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log gis phyin @272b ci log pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: mi rigs par gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pas rigs pa mtshan nyid dang / de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i skyon gyis brtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log gis phyin @272b ci log pa'i sems ni /
translated: The characteristic of non-deficiency is that the mind that is mistaken due to the faults of not understanding reality and the errors of misconception and so on is purified.

original: phyin ci log pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa mtshan nyid dang / rtag tu shin tu mchog tu nges par 'byung ba'i go 'phang du 'gro ba'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa mtshan nyid dang / rtag tu shin tu mchog tu nges par 'byung ba'i go 'phang du 'gro ba'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of practice is the practice of realizing the reality of non-error. The definition of definite release is the constant, certain, and supreme attainment of the state of definite release.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi zhes rnam pa bcu drug ni 'jig rten par yang 'gyur zhing 'jig rten las 'das par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi zhes rnam pa bcu drug ni 'jig rten par yang 'gyur zhing 'jig rten las 'das par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, there are sixteen aspects of the others, four by four, which are mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnams kyi khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnams kyi khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the mundane and supramundane paths?

original: brjod de / de la bden pa'i rnam par 'jig rten pa ni de bzhin nyid mngon du rtogs pa med pas shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pas dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ba can yin pas sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: brjod de / de la bden pa'i rnam par 'jig rten pa ni de bzhin nyid mngon du rtogs pa med pas shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pas dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ba can yin pas sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The mundane path is not well-entered into the knowable because it does not directly realize suchness, and it is obscured because it possesses the latent afflictions.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i sgo nas spros par bya ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i sgo nas spros par bya ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is discursive because it is discursive through verbal expression.

original: de la bzlog pas bden pa'i rnam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni legs par rab tu zhugs pas sgrib pa med pa dang / rnam pas rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzlog pas bden pa'i rnam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni legs par rab tu zhugs pas sgrib pa med pa dang / rnam pas rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The supramundane, which is the opposite of that, is well-engaged, non-obstructed, and non-discursive.

original: yang 'di rnam par mi rtog na ci ltar shes bya la legs par zhugs pa yin zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: yang 'di rnam par mi rtog na ci ltar shes bya la legs par zhugs pa yin zhe na brjod de /
translated: If it is non-discursive, how is it well-engaged with respect to the object of knowledge?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa la 'jug bzhin pa mi rtag pa'i don mthong ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa la 'jug bzhin pa mi rtag pa'i don mthong ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: It is said that while engaged in the supramundane aspect, one sees the meaning of impermanence and experiences it.

original: mngon par brjod pa spros pa'i sgo nas mi rtag go zhes mthong ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa spros pa'i sgo nas mi rtag go zhes mthong ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: One does not see it as impermanent through verbal expression and discursiveness.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs kyi lam rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs kyi lam rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-fifth chapter, on the ascertainment of the path of the bodhisattva’s way of life, in the Treatise on the Definitive Explanation of the Knowable, a commentary on the Summary of the Great Vehicle.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub sems nyid thog ma nas brtsams te byang chub snying po'i mthar thug par goms pa rab la spangs pa dang /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub sems nyid thog ma nas brtsams te byang chub snying po'i mthar thug par goms pa rab la spangs pa dang /
translated: The essence of the cause and result of those who belong to the Bodhisattva Vehicle, and the mundane and supramundane bodhicitta itself, beginning with the first stage and ending with the ultimate stage of the essence of enlightenment, become the perfection of abandonment and realization through the highest degree of familiarity.

original: rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes de ni byang chub sems spros pa dang bcas pa brjod par byas te /
analyzed: rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes de ni byang chub sems spros pa dang bcas pa brjod par byas te /
translated: This is the explanation of the elaborate bodhicitta.

original: 'di ltar ; bdag ci ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang gzhan don bsgrub par bya zhes rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; bdag ci ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang gzhan don bsgrub par bya zhes rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las byung ba'o //
translated: In this way, the aspiration to virtuous dharmas, which has the characteristic of striving for perfect enlightenment, thinking, “How can I become fully enlightened in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment and accomplish the welfare of others?” is a mental factor.

original: de yod pa la byang chub sems skye'o //
analyzed: de yod pa la byang chub sems skye'o //
translated: When that exists, bodhicitta arises.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: In this way,

original: bstan @273a * //
analyzed: bstan @273a * //
translated: in the treatise,

original: bcos las / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: bcos las / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: it is said, “Bodhicitta is generated for the sake of others.

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: He desires perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: ces so // 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: ces so // 'di'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod de sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa'i ngo bo dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las 'byung ba'o //🔽de yod pa la byang chub sems skye'o zhes shes nas byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu la /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod de sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa'i ngo bo dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las 'byung ba'o // de yod pa la byang chub sems skye'o zhes shes nas byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu la /
translated: The essence of the desire for perfect, complete enlightenment, the desire for Buddhahood, is the aspiration for virtuous dharmas, a mental factor.🔽When that exists, the thought of enlightenment arises.

original: 'bras bu byang chub sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ming gis btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu byang chub sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ming gis btags pa'o //
translated: Having understood this, the cause, which has the characteristic of striving for enlightenment, is designated by the name, which has the characteristic of generating the thought of enlightenment, the result.

original: de ltar don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'am /
analyzed: de ltar don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'am /
translated: Thus, in order to understand that all the virtuous dharmas of the bodhisattva who strives in this way will increase,

original: byang chub don du gnyer pa dang lhan cig tu spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa /
analyzed: byang chub don du gnyer pa dang lhan cig tu spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa /
translated: the generation of the thought which accompanies the striving for enlightenment

original: yang dge par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod kyi sgras brtags pa ste /
analyzed: yang dge par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod kyi sgras brtags pa ste /
translated: is designated by the term “desire for perfect, complete enlightenment.”

original: sems bskyed pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ldan pa'o zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ldan pa'o zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The generation of the thought is the possession of complete enlightenment.

original: yang na / sems ni mngon par 'dod pa ste //🔽'di ltar / bdag gis 'gro par sems so //
analyzed: yang na / sems ni mngon par 'dod pa ste // 'di ltar / bdag gis 'gro par sems so //
translated: Or else, the thought is the desire.🔽Thus, one says, “I think of going,”

original: zhes 'gro bar 'dod pa smra'o //
analyzed: zhes 'gro bar 'dod pa smra'o //
translated: when one desires to go.

original: mngon par 'dod pa de'i skye ba ni sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa de'i skye ba ni sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: The generation of that desire is the generation of the thought.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i skye ba ni mi 'khrul pa'i phyir skyed pa bzung ba ni khyad par gzung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i skye ba ni mi 'khrul pa'i phyir skyed pa bzung ba ni khyad par gzung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The generation of the desire is taken as the generation of the thought, in order to indicate the special nature of the desire.

original: gang rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: gang rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: The one who desires complete enlightenment, who desires it, is just that.

original: de'i ngo bo ni yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is the desire for complete enlightenment.

original: gzhan don ched du rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i sems skye ba ni sems bskyed pa'o zhes pa 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan don ched du rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i sems skye ba ni sems bskyed pa'o zhes pa 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The generation of the thought is the arising of the thought which has as its object complete enlightenment for the sake of others. This is the definition.

original: de skad du yang gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs te /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: bdag dang phung sogs btags pa yi //
analyzed: bdag dang phung sogs btags pa yi //
translated: The thought is the desire for the complete enlightenment of the Buddhas, which is the attainment of the knowledge of all things as they are and all things in their manifold variety.

original: rtog pa rnams kyis ma bsgribs pa //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams kyis ma bsgribs pa //
translated: It is not obscured by thoughts.

original: stong nyid mtshan nyid byang chub sems //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan nyid byang chub sems //
translated: Emptiness is the characteristic of bodhicitta.

original: rtag tu sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dod //
analyzed: rtag tu sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dod //
translated: It is always desired by the buddhas.

original: ces so // de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: kun rdzogs nyon mongs las kyis bslang //
analyzed: kun rdzogs nyon mongs las kyis bslang //
translated: it is aroused by the perfection of all, afflictions, and karma.

original: las ni sems las kun du byung //
analyzed: las ni sems las kun du byung //
translated: Karma arises from the mind.

original: sems ni bag chags rnams kyis zos //
analyzed: sems ni bag chags rnams kyis zos //
translated: The mind is consumed by traces.

original: bag chags spangs las bde ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags spangs las bde ba'o //
translated: Happiness is from the abandonment of traces.

original: bde ba zhi ba'i sems nyid de ;
analyzed: bde ba zhi ba'i sems nyid de ;
translated: Happiness is the nature of the mind of peace.

original: / zhi ba'i sems ni mi rmongs so //
analyzed: / zhi ba'i sems ni mi rmongs so //
translated: The mind of peace is not deluded.🔽The absence of delusion is the definite knowledge of reality.

original: rmongs med nges par de nyid rig / de nyid rig pas grol ba thob //
analyzed: rmongs med nges par de nyid rig / de nyid rig pas grol ba thob //
translated: The knowledge of reality is the attainment of liberation.

original: byang chub sems ni de nyid mchog / stong pa nyid ces kyang bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni de nyid mchog / stong pa nyid ces kyang bshad do //
translated: Bodhicitta is the supreme reality and is also explained as emptiness.

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
translated: It is suchness and the perfect end.

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal bdag med sogs //
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal bdag med sogs //
translated: Likewise, it is the selflessness of suffering and so forth.

original: gzhan don ro gcig byang chub ni //
analyzed: gzhan don ro gcig byang chub ni //
translated: Enlightenment is the single taste of the benefit of others.

original: @273b snying rjes brten pa'i rtsa ba dang // byang sems myu gu las byung ba //
analyzed: @273b snying rjes brten pa'i rtsa ba dang // byang sems myu gu las byung ba //
translated: It is the root supported by compassion and arises from the sprout of bodhicitta.

original: de ni rgyal sras rnams kyis bsgom //
analyzed: de ni rgyal sras rnams kyis bsgom //
translated: It is cultivated by the heirs of the victors.

original: gang zhig bsgoms pas mkhas pa rnams //
analyzed: gang zhig bsgoms pas mkhas pa rnams //
translated: What wise person would meditate on that?

original: bsam gtan bde ba yongs spangs te //
analyzed: bsam gtan bde ba yongs spangs te //
translated: Abandoning the bliss of meditative concentration,

original: mnar med dmyal bar zhugs nas ni //
analyzed: mnar med dmyal bar zhugs nas ni //
translated: they enter the Avīci hell

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal kun sel ba //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal kun sel ba //
translated: and dispel the suffering of others.

original: 'di ni rmad byung 'di legs pa //
analyzed: 'di ni rmad byung 'di legs pa //
translated: This is the marvel, this is the excellence,🔽this is the supreme holy practice.

original: 'di ni 'jug pa dam pa mchog / rang gi lus dang don ston pa //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jug pa dam pa mchog / rang gi lus dang don ston pa //
translated: To show their own bodies and purposes,

original: de ni ngo mtshar ma yin nyid //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar ma yin nyid //
translated: this is not at all amazing.

original: ces so // de bzhin /
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin /
translated: And similarly:

original: de ltar snying rje des brlan pa'i //
analyzed: de ltar snying rje des brlan pa'i //
translated: Thus, those who are moistened by that compassion,

original: gang yang bzang sogs rgyal sras rnams //
analyzed: gang yang bzang sogs rgyal sras rnams //
translated: the bodhisattvas, the good and so forth,

original: tshangs dbang nye dbang drag bo sogs //
analyzed: tshangs dbang nye dbang drag bo sogs //
translated: with the power of emanations of Brahmā, Indra, Rudra, and so forth,

original: gzugs brnyan sbrul ba'i mthu rnams kyis //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan sbrul ba'i mthu rnams kyis //
translated: with the power of emanations of images and snakes,

original: 'gro ba 'dren pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dren pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: through the practice of leading transmigrating beings,

original: snying rje'i bsam pas gar byed do //
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pas gar byed do //
translated: dance with the intention of compassion.

original: zhes so // byang chub sems kyi sbyor bas zhes pa ni nang du bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // byang chub sems kyi sbyor bas zhes pa ni nang du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Through the practice of bodhicitta” should be included here.

original: de nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrub pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems kyang 'khor bar 'bras bu chen po zhes nye bar bsngags te ;
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrub pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems kyang 'khor bar 'bras bu chen po zhes nye bar bsngags te ;
translated: Thus the Bhagavān praised the great fruit of even the bodhicitta that is not accompanied by practice in saṃsāra.

original: ci ltar 'phags pa rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar 'phags pa rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in the Instruction to the King Sūtra:🔽Therefore, great king, that very aspiration, faith, and prayer for perfect complete enlightenment should be remembered,

original: de'i phyir rgyal po chen po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dun pa dang dad pa dang smon pa de nyid ni 'gro yang bzhengs kyang 'dug kyang nyal yang sad kyang za yang 'thung yang rgyun du bar chad med par rjes su dran pa dang yid
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal po chen po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dun pa dang dad pa dang smon pa de nyid ni 'gro yang bzhengs kyang 'dug kyang nyal yang sad kyang za yang 'thung yang rgyun du bar chad med par rjes su dran pa dang yid
translated: thought about, and cultivated continuously, without interruption, whether walking, standing, sitting, lying down, awake, eating, or drinking.

original: la byed pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: la byed pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having said that, he said,

original: de yang rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pas lan mang du lha ru skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pas lan mang du lha ru skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Great king, you will be born many times as a god because the roots of virtue of the mind of perfect complete enlightenment have ripened.”

original: lan mang du mi ru skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan mang du mi ru skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Many times he will be reborn as a human.

original: lha dang mi'i skye ba thams cad du lhag pa'i rgyal po byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye ba thams cad du lhag pa'i rgyal po byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: In all his rebirths as a god or human, he will be a king of kings.

original: gang las yang sgrub pa snying por byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems de ni nges par legs pa dang mngon par 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas shin tu ches 'bras bu che ba nyid do zhes sgrub bo //
analyzed: gang las yang sgrub pa snying por byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems de ni nges par legs pa dang mngon par 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas shin tu ches 'bras bu che ba nyid do zhes sgrub bo //
translated: The bodhisattva spirit that makes practice its essence is the cause of definite goodness and of the Great Way’s departure. Therefore, it is established that it has a very great result.

original: des na dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: des na dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa las gsungs te /
translated: Thus it says in the Questions of Susthitamati Scripture:🔽If the merit of the bodhisattva spirit

original: gang tshe byang chub sems gang gi / bsod nams de ni gzugs can 'gyur //
analyzed: gang tshe byang chub sems gang gi / bsod nams de ni gzugs can 'gyur //
translated: Were to take on visible form,

original: nam mkha'i khams ni kun gang ste //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni kun gang ste //
translated: It would fill all of space

original: de'i yang gong du lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i yang gong du lhag par 'gyur //
translated: And extend beyond it.

original: gang g'a'i bye ma'i grangs rnyed kyi //
analyzed: gang g'a'i bye ma'i grangs rnyed kyi //
translated: If someone were to fill with precious jewels

original: sangs rgyas zhing rnams mi gang gis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing rnams mi gang gis //
translated: As many buddha-fields as there are

original: rin chen dam pas yongs bkang ste //
analyzed: rin chen dam pas yongs bkang ste //
translated: Sand grains in the Ganges river

original: 'jig rten mgon la phul ba bas //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon la phul ba bas //
translated: And offer them to the lords of the world,

original: @274a * // gang gis lan cig thal sbyar te //
analyzed: @274a * // gang gis lan cig thal sbyar te //
translated: And if someone else were to join his palms

original: byang chub ched du sems btud na //
analyzed: byang chub ched du sems btud na //
translated: If one bows the mind to enlightenment,

original: gang gi mtha' yang yod min pas //
analyzed: gang gi mtha' yang yod min pas //
translated: since it has no end,

original: mchod pa 'di ni khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: mchod pa 'di ni khyad par 'phags //
translated: this worship is superior.

original: zhes so // 'phags pa sdod bo bkod pa'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: zhes so // 'phags pa sdod bo bkod pa'i mdo las kyang //
translated: And in the noble Gadgdya-vyiiha-sutra,

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa'o zhes rgyas par ro //🔽de yang byang chub sems dpa' dper na long bas sgron ma 'dzin pas gzhan rnams la phan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du don mngon par mi shes pa thob pa 'dzin pa zhes shes nas don nges par bzung nas sdom pa len pa sngon du 'gro bas byang🔽chub tu sems bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon du gyur pa'o zhes rgyas par ro // de yang byang chub sems dpa' dper na long bas sgron ma 'dzin pas gzhan rnams la phan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du don mngon par mi shes pa thob pa 'dzin pa zhes shes nas don nges par bzung nas sdom pa len pa sngon du 'gro bas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin no //
translated: “Son of noble family, the thought of enlightenment is the seed of all the qualities of a Buddha.”🔽And that thought of enlightenment is like a blind man’s staff for the bodhisattva, since it is the means of getting to the goal without error.

original: des na byang chub tu sems yang dag par bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: des na byang chub tu sems yang dag par bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Having thus ascertained the meaning, one should generate the thought of enlightenment, preceded by the vow, as follows:🔽“I will become a Buddha for the benefit of all beings.

original: dper na so sor rtogs par mi byed pa'i mel cog  sgra sgrogs par byed pa nyid sang bzhin du rkun pos 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: dper na so sor rtogs par mi byed pa'i mel cog  sgra sgrogs par byed pa nyid sang bzhin du rkun pos 'joms pa ste /
translated: For example, a watchman who does not discriminate is destroyed by thieves, just as a fire that does not roar is destroyed.🔽In the same way, the one who is learned, but does not discriminate, is destroyed by the thieves of the defilements.

original: de bzhin du so sor rtogs par mi byed pa sgra tsam dang ldan pa'i mang du thos pa nyon mongs pa'i rkun pos 'joms pas sgrub pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor rtogs par mi byed pa sgra tsam dang ldan pa'i mang du thos pa nyon mongs pa'i rkun pos 'joms pas sgrub pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive for practice.

original: gzhon nu sgrub pa snying bor byed pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob dka' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu sgrub pa snying bor byed pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob dka' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Samadhiraja-sutra says, Prince, for one who makes practice his essence, it is not difficult to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa yang mdor bsdus na byang chub sems bsgoms pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa yang mdor bsdus na byang chub sems bsgoms pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyams su len pa'o //
translated: And practice, in brief, is the cultivation of the Thought of Enlightenment and the practice of the six perfections, such as generosity.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: That Thought of Enlightenment is of twenty-two kinds.

original: 'di ltar de la byang chub sems dang po ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa gzhan don ched du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid can sa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la byang chub sems dang po ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa gzhan don ched du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid can sa lta bu ste /
translated: Thus, the first of these is the bodhicitta of aspiration, which is characterized by the pursuit of perfect complete enlightenment for the sake of others. It is like the ground.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the first thought of enlightenment of the bodhisattva is characterized by aspiration, the will to seek supreme enlightenment for the sake of others. It is like the earth, because it is the foundation of all the qualities of the Buddha and of the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: gnyis pa ni bsam pa dang ldan pa gser bzang po lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bsam pa dang ldan pa gser bzang po lta bu ste /
translated: The second is characterized by intention, like fine gold.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa phyis dang da lta dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa phyis dang da lta dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention to benefit and bring happiness, comprised of the six perfections, is unalterable by later or present circumstances.

original: a'a ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug pa'o //
analyzed: a'a ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug pa'o //
translated: The a is the limit of perfect enlightenment.

original: sha ya ni mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sha ya ni mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The sa is changeless.🔽The sa is known as intention.

original: a'a sha ya zhes shes nas bsam pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: a'a sha ya zhes shes nas bsam pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That intention is threefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par 'dod pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing @274b yongs su spyod ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can thams cad bde ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par 'dod pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing @274b yongs su spyod ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can thams cad bde ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention to worship the Tathagata is the perfect intention. The intention to enjoy the Buddha-land and the intention to bring happiness to all beings.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang bsam pa'i dbye ba mang po rnams 'dir mi bshad de mangs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang bsam pa'i dbye ba mang po rnams 'dir mi bshad de mangs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, there are many other classifications of intention, but they are not explained here for fear of being too wordy.

original: gsum pa ni khyad par lhag par rtogs pa'i ched du bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni khyad par lhag par rtogs pa'i ched du bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The third is the superior intention, which is the intention for the sake of realizing the special qualities.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos bzhi zla ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos bzhi zla ba lta bu ste /
translated: The four qualities of the bright side are like the moon.

original: dkar po phyogs kyi tshes pa'i zla ba 'phel ba bzhin du sems des dge ba rnams kye ba 'phel ba brnyes ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po phyogs kyi tshes pa'i zla ba 'phel ba bzhin du sems des dge ba rnams kye ba 'phel ba brnyes ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The moon of the bright half waxes, and in the same way, the mind acquires the waxing of virtues.

original: byang chub sems de gsum ni rim pa bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag pa'i spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems de gsum ni rim pa bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag pa'i spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: These three kinds of bodhicitta are respectively associated with the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, and the bases of supernatural power.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab phul du phyin pa'i gnas skabs thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las dang po pa'i sa tshogs kyi lam /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab phul du phyin pa'i gnas skabs thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las dang po pa'i sa tshogs kyi lam /
translated: The stage of the perfection of the wisdom born of hearing and reflection is the stage of the beginner, the root of the wholesome which is conducive to liberation, the path of equipment.

original: tshogs kyis / go cha'i sgrub pa smon pa'i sems so //
analyzed: tshogs kyis / go cha'i sgrub pa smon pa'i sems so //
translated: The path of equipment is the armor-like practice and the resolve of the aspiration thought.

original: gzhan byang chub sems bcu dgu ni 'jug pa'i sems so ;
analyzed: gzhan byang chub sems bcu dgu ni 'jug pa'i sems so ;
translated: The other nineteen thoughts of enlightenment are the engaged thought.

original: / bzhi pa ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni me lta bu ste /
analyzed: / bzhi pa ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni me lta bu ste /
translated: The fourth is the stage of the one endowed with application and the one endowed with superior intention, which is like fire,

original: bud shing khyad par can gyi me bzhin du des sbyor ba khyad par du 'phags par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud shing khyad par can gyi me bzhin du des sbyor ba khyad par du 'phags par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to the previous applications, like a fire with special fuel.

original: de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the practice through belief.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i sbyor ba'i lam /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i sbyor ba'i lam /
translated: The path of application is the stage of the Joyous.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin zag pa dang bcas pa'i sdom pa'i lam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin zag pa dang bcas pa'i sdom pa'i lam /
translated: The path of restraint with outflows is the mundane nature of cultivation.

original: nges par 'byed pa ni mngon du byed pa zhes nges par 'byed pa mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni mngon du byed pa zhes nges par 'byed pa mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of vision is the clear realization, which is the clear realization of the penetrating insight.

original: de'i cha ni brnyan pa ste de'i phyir phan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i cha ni brnyan pa ste de'i phyir phan pa'o //
translated: Its portion is the image, and therefore it is helpful.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dad mthun pa dang dbang po lda dang stobs lda dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dad mthun pa dang dbang po lda dang stobs lda dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The portion of penetration is the path of insight, which is endowed with the factors that are its aids, the faculties, and the powers.

original: lnga pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa gter chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa gter chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The fifth is like a great treasure, endowed with the supramundane, uncontaminated perfection of generosity.

original: chos dang zad zing gi longs spyod kyis gzhal du med pa'i sems can yang dag par tshim par byed pa'i phyir dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang zad zing gi longs spyod kyis gzhal du med pa'i sems can yang dag par tshim par byed pa'i phyir dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It satisfies innumerable beings with enjoyments of the Dharma and material gifts, and it is inexhaustible.

original: byang chub sems dpas 'di la bdag byang chub dang nye bar mthong ba dang / sems can gyi don sgrub pa mthong bas dga' ba rab tu gyur zhes /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'di la bdag byang chub dang nye bar mthong ba dang / sems can gyi don sgrub pa mthong bas dga' ba rab tu gyur zhes /
translated: The bodhisattva sees himself as close to enlightenment and sees the accomplishment of the aims of beings.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa mthong ba'i lam byang chub yan lag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa mthong ba'i lam byang chub yan lag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The stage of the joyous is the path of insight endowed with the factors of enlightenment.

original: drug pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
analyzed: drug pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
translated: The sixth is like a mine of jewels, endowed with the perfection of morality,

original: yon tan rin po che thams cad de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rin po che thams cad de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all jewels of good qualities come from it.
Here

original: rin po che'i 'byung khungs ni ri ro ha na la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i 'byung khungs ni ri ro ha na la sogs pa'o //
translated: the mine of jewels is the mountains of Malaya, etc.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pas dri ma dang rtsol ba dri ma dag las 'das pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pas dri ma dang rtsol ba dri ma dag las 'das pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage of stainlessness, because it is beyond the stain of immorality and the stain of effort.

original: bdun pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rgya mtsho lta bu ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rgya mtsho lta bu ste /
translated: The seventh is like the ocean, endowed with the perfection of patience,

original: mi 'dod pa'i nye bar 'dus pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i nye bar 'dus pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unshaken by any unwanted event.

original: ting nge 'dzin stobs dang tshad med pa'i chos tshol ba'i gzungs dag gis pha rol la chos kyi snang ba chen po byed pas 'od byed pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin stobs dang tshad med pa'i chos tshol ba'i gzungs dag gis pha rol la chos kyi snang ba chen po byed pas 'od byed pa'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage of blazing, because it creates a great light of the Dharma for others by means of the dhāraṇī of seeking the Dharma with immeasurable samādhis and strengths.

original: brgyad pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: The eighth is like a diamond, endowed with the perfection of effort,🔽because it is unbreakable by any adverse factors.

original: rdo rje bzhin du brtan pa'i phyir dang mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du brtan pa'i phyir dang mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is firm like a diamond and indivisible.🔽

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag sreg par byed pas 'od zer du gyur pa byang chub phyogs kyi bdag nyid kyi shes rab de 'di la yod pas 'od 'phro ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag sreg par byed pas 'od zer du gyur pa byang chub phyogs kyi bdag nyid kyi shes rab de 'di la yod pas 'od 'phro ba'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage of radiance because it has light rays, that is, the wisdom that is the nature of the elements leading to enlightenment, which burn away the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: dgu pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ri bo lta bu ste /
analyzed: dgu pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ri bo lta bu ste /
translated: The ninth stage is like a mountain because it possesses the perfection of meditative concentration.

original: mi bskyod pa'i phyir g-yeng ba med pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang rang sems bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i phyir g-yeng ba med pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang rang sems bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unshakable because it is undistracted, in order to ripen beings and to protect one's own mind.

original: gang la rgyal bar dka' zhes sbyang dka' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: gang la rgyal bar dka' zhes sbyang dka' ba'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage difficult to conquer because it is difficult to conquer.🔽The tenth stage is like the king of medicinal trees because it possesses the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcu pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa sman gyi rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa sman gyi rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.🔽It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.

original: sgrib pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma and puts an end to all the diseases of the afflictions.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba mngon du byed pas mngon du gyur pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba mngon du byed pas mngon du gyur pa'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage of the cloud of Dharma because it is like a cloud that rains

original: bcu gcig pa ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang byams pa la sogs pa'i tshad med pa dang ldan pa bshes gnyen lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang byams pa la sogs pa'i tshad med pa dang ldan pa bshes gnyen lta bu ste /
translated: The eleventh is like a spiritual friend, endowed with the perfection of means and endowed with the immeasurables of love, etc.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don btang snyoms su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don btang snyoms su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he never abandons the aim of beings in any situation.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel bas sbyor ba mthar thug par phyin ba'i phyir ring du song pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang 'brel bas sbyor ba mthar thug par phyin ba'i phyir ring du song pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage Gone Afar is so called because it is connected with the path of single progress and because it is the culmination of application.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa yid bzhin nor bu dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa yid bzhin nor bu dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The twelfth is like a wish-granting gem, endowed with the perfection of vows and endowed with the superknowledges.

original: ci ltar mos pa'i 'bras bu de rnams phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar mos pa'i 'bras bu de rnams phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the perfection of the results of those in accordance with their aspirations.

original: mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang mtshan ma med pa'i rtsol ba'i 'du shes kyis mi gyo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang mtshan ma med pa'i rtsol ba'i 'du shes kyis mi gyo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i sa'o //
translated: The stage Immovable is so called because it is unshaken by the perception of signs or by the perception of striving in signlessness.

original: bcu gsum pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang ldan pa nyi ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang ldan pa nyi ma lta bu ste /
translated: The thirteenth is the sun-like perfection of power, endowed with the four means of gathering disciples, which have the characteristics of generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful behavior and having the same purpose as those to be guided.

original: gdul bya'i lo thog yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i lo thog yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the sun because it ripens the harvest of those to be guided.

original: so sor yang dag par rig pa legs pa'i phyir zhes pa @275b gtso bo yin pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa'o //
analyzed: so sor yang dag par rig pa legs pa'i phyir zhes pa @275b gtso bo yin pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa'o //
translated: The ground of Excellent Intelligence is so called because it is the excellent intelligence of the four individual correct knowledges.

original: bcu bzhi pa yi shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang so sor yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa dri za'i glu dbyangs snyan ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa yi shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang so sor yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa dri za'i glu dbyangs snyan ba lta bu ste /
translated: The fourteenth is the melody of the gandharvas, endowed with the perfection of wisdom and the four individual correct knowledges,🔽because it is the cause for teaching the Dharma to the assembly of those to be guided and because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma.

original: gdul bya tshogs pa rnams la chos ston par phyed pa'i phyir dang / char 'bab pa dang chos mthun pas sprin dang 'dra ba'i phyir chos kyi sprin gyi sa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya tshogs pa rnams la chos ston par phyed pa'i phyir dang / char 'bab pa dang chos mthun pas sprin dang 'dra ba'i phyir chos kyi sprin gyi sa'o //
translated: The ground of Cloud of Dharma is so called because it is like a cloud that rains down the Dharma.

original: bco lnga pa ni mngon shes dang ldan pa dang ston pa dang ldan pa rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: bco lnga pa ni mngon shes dang ldan pa dang ston pa dang ldan pa rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The fifteenth is like a king, endowed with preternatural knowledge and teaching.

original: mi choms  pa'i nus pa gzhan don nyams su len pa'i phyir dang rnam par mi nyams pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: mi choms  pa'i nus pa gzhan don nyams su len pa'i phyir dang rnam par mi nyams pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: It is the cause of nondegeneration, because it is the practice for the benefit of others, which cannot be taken away.

original: rgyal po'i bka'i lcags kyus skye bo lam log par mi ltud ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bka'i lcags kyus skye bo lam log par mi ltud ste /
translated: The hook of a king's command does not allow people to stray from the path.

original: de bzhin du ston pa'i lcags kyus byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ston pa'i lcags kyus byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: In the same way, the hook of teaching does not allow the bodhisattvas to stray.

original: bcu drug pa ni bsod nams ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa mdzod khang lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu drug pa ni bsod nams ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa mdzod khang lta bu ste /
translated: The sixteenth is like a treasury, endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: shin tu mang ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes tshogs kyi mdzod nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: shin tu mang ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes tshogs kyi mdzod nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is a treasury of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, because it is extremely vast.

original: bcu bdun pa byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa lam po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu bdun pa byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa lam po che lta bu ste /
translated: The seventeenth is like a highway, endowed with the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad 'gro ba'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad 'gro ba'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: It is followed by all noble beings.

original: bco brgyad pa ni zhi gnas can du gyur pa snying rje dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa bzhon pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bco brgyad pa ni zhi gnas can du gyur pa snying rje dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa bzhon pa lta bu ste /
translated: The eighteenth is like a vehicle, for one who has attained serenity and is endowed with compassion and insight.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gcig tu mi ltung pas bde bar yang dag par bgrod pas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gcig tu mi ltung pas bde bar yang dag par bgrod pas so //
translated: Because one proceeds happily and correctly, without falling into either cyclic existence or nirvana.

original: bcu dgu pa gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa bkod ma'i chu lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu dgu pa gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa bkod ma'i chu lta bu ste /
translated: The nineteenth is like the water of a fountain, for one who is endowed with retention and eloquence.

original: bkod ma'i chu ni mi zad pa'i chu'i rgyun no //
analyzed: bkod ma'i chu ni mi zad pa'i chu'i rgyun no //
translated: The water of a fountain is an inexhaustible stream of water.

original: chu'i rgyun mi zad pa 'bab pa dang chos mthun pas thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos kyi don gzungs mi zad pa ston pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i rgyun mi zad pa 'bab pa dang chos mthun pas thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos kyi don gzungs mi zad pa ston pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to an inexhaustible stream of water, it is the source of the inexhaustible retention of the meaning of the teachings, both those one has heard and those one has not heard.

original: nyi shu pa ni 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu pa ni 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The twentieth is the knowledge that all conditioned things are impermanent,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: that all contaminated things are miserable,

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: and that all phenomena are empty, selfless, and peaceful.

original: mya ngan las 'das ba ni zhi ba'o zhes pa 'di ni chos kyi sbyin pa bzhi dang ldan pas snyan par smra ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das ba ni zhi ba'o zhes pa 'di ni chos kyi sbyin pa bzhi dang ldan pas snyan par smra ba lta bu ste /
translated: The statement nirvana is peace is like speaking pleasantly by means of the four kinds of Dharma generosity.

original: grol bar 'dod pa rnams kyi mnyan bya snyan pa yin pas /
analyzed: grol bar 'dod pa rnams kyi mnyan bya snyan pa yin pas /
translated: It is pleasant to hear for those who desire liberation.

original: nyi shu gcig pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa /
analyzed: nyi shu gcig pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa /
translated: The twenty-first is the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: sa de'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu dang bya ba mi phyed pas bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sa de'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu dang bya ba mi phyed pas bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam mo //
translated: The result and activity of the bodhisattvas on that level are indivisible, so it is the path of single progress.

original: de dang ldan pa chu bo'i rgyun lta bu ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa chu bo'i rgyun lta bu ste /
translated: Those who possess that are like a flowing river,

original: rang gi ngang gis rgyun 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis rgyun 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they flow naturally.

original: nyi shu gnyis pa ni thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa dga' @276a * //
analyzed: nyi shu gnyis pa ni thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa dga' @276a * //
translated: The twenty-second is the possession of skill in means.

original: ldan gnas su gnas pa la sogs pa de dang ldan pa dang chos kyi sku dang ldan pa sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: ldan gnas su gnas pa la sogs pa de dang ldan pa dang chos kyi sku dang ldan pa sprin lta bu ste /
translated: Those who possess that, such as dwelling in the abode of joy, and who possess the dharmakāya are like a cloud,

original: sems can gyi don ma lus pa kun du rdzogs par byed pa ni de las 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don ma lus pa kun du rdzogs par byed pa ni de las 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the complete fulfillment of the welfare of all sentient beings occurs from that.

original: sprin las snod kyi 'jig rten phun sum tshogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sprin las snod kyi 'jig rten phun sum tshogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the perfect world of the environment arising from clouds.

original: de rnams la drug pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bco lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la drug pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bco lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The fifteen arousings of mind beginning with the sixth are endowed with the eightfold noble path, which is the nature of the supramundane path.

original: 'di rnams la sems bskyed pa dang po dgu ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams la sems bskyed pa dang po dgu ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu rnams so //
translated: The first nine of these are the nine grounds such as Immaculate.

original: gzhan sems skye ba drug ni chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i gnas skabs khyad par ngo bo khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: gzhan sems skye ba drug ni chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i gnas skabs khyad par ngo bo khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The other six arousings of mind are the special path of the stage of the Cloud of Dharma ground.

original: khyad par gyi lam gyi tha ma sems bskyed pa nyi shu pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam gyi tha ma sems bskyed pa nyi shu pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The twentieth arousal of mind, the end of the special path, is the uninterrupted path of the Buddha ground.

original: sems bskyed pa nyer gcig pa dang nyer gnyis pa ni dngos gzhi dang rjes ngag gi kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ming gzhan kun du 'od ces sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyer gcig pa dang nyer gnyis pa ni dngos gzhi dang rjes ngag gi kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ming gzhan kun du 'od ces sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: The twenty-first and twenty-second arousals of mind are the ground of the Buddha, called the “universal light” and also known by the other name “universal good.”

original: des na 'jig rten ma lus pa la 'das pa mtha' med pa ngo mtshar ba'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten ma lus pa la 'das pa mtha' med pa ngo mtshar ba'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid /
translated: Therefore, the Teacher, whose nature is endowed with an infinite and marvelous assembly of qualities for the entire world,

original: mtshams med pa'i sems can gyi tshogs la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i snying rje'i stobs chen gyis yang dag par byi dor dri ma med par byas pa'i nang gi byed pa'i me long gi nad du nam mkhas khyab pa'i khams gsum gyi 'jug pa'i mtha' bye brag ma
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems can gyi tshogs la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i snying rje'i stobs chen gyis yang dag par byi dor dri ma med par byas pa'i nang gi byed pa'i me long gi nad du nam mkhas khyab pa'i khams gsum gyi 'jug pa'i mtha' bye brag ma
translated: with the great power of compassion that benefits the assembly of beings who have committed the heinous actions, is the one who has been polished by the stainless power of the great compassion that benefits the assembly of beings who have committed the heinous actions, and the image of the entire world, which is the external object, arises in the mirror of the internal object.

original: lus pa'i gzugs brnyan shar ba /
analyzed: lus pa'i gzugs brnyan shar ba /
translated: The image of the entire world, which is the external object, arises in the mirror of the internal object.

original: bla na med pa'i mtshan rnams sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi nor bu mnyam pa med pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su sbras pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i mu tig gi rgyan gyis sku la brgyan pa'i ston pa de lta bu rmad du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mtshan rnams sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi nor bu mnyam pa med pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su sbras pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i mu tig gi rgyan gyis sku la brgyan pa'i ston pa de lta bu rmad du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab
translated: The Teacher, who is adorned with the ornaments of the eighty minor marks of excellence, which are a garland of pearls, completely filled with the assembly of the thirty-two matching jewels of the unexcelled marks,

original: pa'i sku rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du rtsa ba rus shing btsugs pa lta bu byang chub kyi sems su nges par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i sku rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du rtsa ba rus shing btsugs pa lta bu byang chub kyi sems su nges par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In order to complete the body of a Buddha, one should definitely realize the thought of enlightenment, which is like a root or a pillar.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o /
translated: The great pandita Dashabalaśrībhadra has summarized the Bodhisattva way of life in the twenty-sixth chapter of the Ascertainment of the Compounded and the Uncompounded called “Ascertainment of the Thought of Enlightenment.”

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam bsgom pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam bsgom pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The stages of meditation on the path of the bodhisattvas should be explained.

original: dper na rgyal rigs 'ga' zhig rgyal po 'dod cing de la phan par 'dod pa rnams kyis spro bar byed pa na /🔽dang po @276b nyid du go cha gyon to //
analyzed: dper na rgyal rigs 'ga' zhig rgyal po 'dod cing de la phan par 'dod pa rnams kyis spro bar byed pa na / dang po @276b nyid du go cha gyon to //
translated: For example, when some of the royal class desire the kingdom and wish to benefit it, they first don armor.

original: de nas rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: de nas rab tu gnas te /
translated: Then they are established.

original: glang po la sogs pa'i theg pa la kun du gnas so //
analyzed: glang po la sogs pa'i theg pa la kun du gnas so //
translated: They are established in the vehicle of the elephant and so forth.

original: de rjes su tshogs rnams yang dag par sog go //
analyzed: de rjes su tshogs rnams yang dag par sog go //
