translated: After that, they gather the army.

original: de nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal lo //
analyzed: de nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal lo //
translated: Then he conquers the adverse side.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sa ru nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sa ru nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: He is liberated in the stage of liberation.

original: rgyal po thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po thob pa'o //
translated: He attains the sovereignty.

original: nga'i rjes su rang don byas shing brtse ba dang bcas pas ci ltar rigs par skye bo rnams yongs su skyong bar byed do //
analyzed: nga'i rjes su rang don byas shing brtse ba dang bcas pas ci ltar rigs par skye bo rnams yongs su skyong bar byed do //
translated: Having acted for his own welfare in accordance with his own aim, he protects beings in the best way possible through his compassion.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs pa nyid du ltag par mos pas skyed pa'i yang dag par yid ches pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du lhag par mos pa'i yang dag par rab tu dang ba dang / nus pa nyid du lhag par mos pas thob pa'i mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyis dad pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs pa nyid du ltag par mos pas skyed pa'i yang dag par yid ches pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du lhag par mos pa'i yang dag par rab tu dang ba dang / nus pa nyid du lhag par mos pas thob pa'i mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyis dad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, through the faith that is born of the conviction that the Dharma is well taught, through the clarity that is born of the conviction that the teacher has good qualities, and through the desire that is born of the conviction that he is able, has faith in the Dharma, the teacher, and the ability to practice.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin /
translated: He has the nature of the realm of the Dharma.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs sgrub pa'i rten dge ba rnams blang bya yin pas dang / mi dge ba rnams spang bya yin pas sgrub pa dag gis dmigs bzhin pa na /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs sgrub pa'i rten dge ba rnams blang bya yin pas dang / mi dge ba rnams spang bya yin pas sgrub pa dag gis dmigs bzhin pa na /
translated: Since the bases of virtue that establish the lineage of a perfect buddha are to be adopted and the nonvirtuous are to be abandoned, they are the objects of observation of the practice.

original: gzhan don phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa /
analyzed: gzhan don phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa /
translated: The practice is the desire for perfect complete enlightenment for the sake of others.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can byang chub kyi sems nyer gnyis rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can byang chub kyi sems nyer gnyis rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The essence of the practice is the mind of enlightenment that has the essence of emptiness and compassion, the perfection of wisdom that is the nature of the twenty-two aspects of the mind of enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam bden pa las mi 'da' zhing mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas 'jug pa zhes bslab pa thob pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam bden pa las mi 'da' zhing mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas 'jug pa zhes bslab pa thob pa /
translated: The engagement of the practice is the attainment of the training in the union of non-observation and non-transgression of conventional and ultimate truths.

original: sgrub pa de'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo bden pa mkhyen pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa de'i dmigs pa'i ngo bo bden pa mkhyen pa /
translated: The object of observation of that practice is the knowledge of the truths.

original: rten skyabs gsum rig pa /
analyzed: rten skyabs gsum rig pa /
translated: The basis is the knowledge of the three jewels.

original: khyad par rtogs pa la ma chags pa /
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa la ma chags pa /
translated: The special realization is non-attachment.

original: mi ldog pa'i ched du yongs su ngal pa med pa /
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i ched du yongs su ngal pa med pa /
translated: The non-retrogression is the absence of complete weariness.

original: phyogs bcu gzigs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu gzigs pa thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment is the attainment of the view of the ten directions.

original: de nas de ni theg pa gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i ched du sgrub pa'i lam yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //🔽ci ltar rigs par spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa drug dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dang 'phags pa'i lam rnams yang dag par bgrod pa'o zhes gdams pa'i rim gyis ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab thob pa rnams 'phel ba'i ched du dang ma thob pa
analyzed: de nas de ni theg pa gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i ched du sgrub pa'i lam yongs su 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro // ci ltar rigs par spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa drug dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dang 'phags pa'i lam rnams yang dag par bgrod pa'o zhes gdams pa'i rim gyis ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab thob pa rnams 'phel ba'i ched du dang ma thob pa
translated: Then, in order that they not go to another vehicle, they will also take up the path of meditation.🔽In whatever way is appropriate, they will correctly proceed on the paths of seeing and meditation and the noble paths, by means of the five eyes and the six superknowledges.

original: de rnams nyid thob pa'i ched du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis spro bar byed ba zhin pa na /
analyzed: de rnams nyid thob pa'i ched du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis spro bar byed ba zhin pa na /
translated: In this way, they will be encouraged by the buddhas and so forth, in order to increase the concentration and wisdom that they have attained through the stages of instruction and in order to attain those that they have not attained.

original: pha rol phyin pa re drug gi go cha'i sgrub pas pha rol tu phyin pa re re la pha rol tu phyin pa la lus pa nye bar gzhag pas sbyin bya la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa go cha nyid kyis go gyon te
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa re drug gi go cha'i sgrub pas pha rol tu phyin pa re re la pha rol tu phyin pa la lus pa nye bar gzhag pas sbyin bya la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa go cha nyid kyis go gyon te
translated: They will don the armor of the practice of the six perfections, by means of the armor of each of the perfections, by means of the armor of the aspects of the nonapprehension of the object of giving and so forth, and by means of the armor of the perfections that are left to be attained.
They will don the armor, thinking,

original: bar du gcod pa'i mda' thams cad kyis gegs byed do //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i mda' thams cad kyis gegs byed do //
translated: All the arrows of obstacles are blocked.

original: de'i rjes su go cha bgos nas rnam pa thams cad sgom pa la mngon par brtson pas rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su go cha bgos nas rnam pa thams cad sgom pa la mngon par brtson pas rab tu gnas so //
translated: After that, having put on the armor, one abides in the effort to cultivate all aspects.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos ma lus pa la rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos ma lus pa la rnam par gnas te /
translated: One abides in the dharmas of the Great Vehicle such as the concentrations.

original: de nas rgyu mthar thug pa lhag par bgrod pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par sog go //
analyzed: de nas rgyu mthar thug pa lhag par bgrod pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par sog go //
translated: Then, one accumulates the accumulations of merit and wisdom, the supreme progress to the ultimate cause.

original: de nas nges par 'byung bar bya ba 'bras bu'i sa la kun du gnon cing nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas nges par 'byung bar bya ba 'bras bu'i sa la kun du gnon cing nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, one ascends to the level of fruition, which is the definite emergence.

original: rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i lam rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags ma lus pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye ba rnams spangs par sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba bar chad med pa'i lam rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags ma lus pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye ba rnams spangs par sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du bgrod pa'o //
translated: The realization of the vajra-like uninterrupted path is the bodhisattva's progress to the buddha level, abandoning all the latent tendencies of afflictive and cognitive obscurations, the divisions of the opposing factors.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas pas bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba rnams spangs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin mtshams med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po thob po //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas pas bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba rnams spangs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin mtshams med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po thob po //
translated: And by realizing the perfect culmination of the path, one attains the result, the state of a sovereign of the Dharma, free of all obscurations and endowed with the two kinds of gnosis.

original: de'i tshe yang 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pa'i ngo bo chos kyi sku mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyi bya ba byas pas bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir sgrub pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pa'i ngo bo chos kyi sku mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyi bya ba byas pas bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir sgrub pa ni med do //
translated: At that time, there is no more practice, because the function of realizing the body of truth, the essence of the result, has been fulfilled and it is impossible for there to be any more practice.

original: sgrub pa ni bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni bya ba yin no //
translated: Practice is a function.

original: de'i rjes su dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen pos sngon gyi smon lam gyis 'phangs pa las dang gdul bya'i bden pa'i bsod nams kyi bdag po las nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par rgyun ma chad par sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed do
analyzed: de'i rjes su dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen pos sngon gyi smon lam gyis 'phangs pa las dang gdul bya'i bden pa'i bsod nams kyi bdag po las nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par rgyun ma chad par sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed do
translated: After that, by means of nonconceptual great compassion, the buddhas, impelled by their previous aspirations, continuously and uninterruptedly, until the end of the realm of space, bring about the perfect benefit of beings through the power of the truth of their karma and of those to be trained.

original: // des na mthong ba'i lam gyi brgyud pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni tshogs kyis ste go cha'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: // des na mthong ba'i lam gyi brgyud pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni tshogs kyis ste go cha'i sgrub pa'o //

analyzed: dngos kyi sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The nature of the path of preparation that is the actual path is the stage of action through faith, the path of preparation.

original: chos mchog rab kyi rang bzhin ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //🔽mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin rab tu dga' ba'i sa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i dngos po la khyad par gyi lam mthar thug pa rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi bar du bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin nges par 'byung ba'i @277b sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i dngos po la khyad par gyi lam mthar thug pa rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi bar du bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin nges par 'byung ba'i @277b sgrub pa'o //
translated: The nature of the path of meditation, the stage of the joyous, is the path of preparation that is the accumulation of merit.🔽The nature of the path of meditation

original: sems bskyed pa tha ma gnyis kyis bdag nyid 'bras bu'i ngo bo sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rang bzhin ni nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tha ma gnyis kyis bdag nyid 'bras bu'i ngo bo sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rang bzhin ni nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu sgrub pa ste /
translated: The last two kinds of generating the Thought are the cause of the definite emergence, the nature of the Buddha ground, which is the essence of the fruit, oneself.

original: nges par 'byung ba lam gyi spyod yul lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba lam gyi spyod yul lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, The definite emergence is the domain of the path.

original: yang 'phags pa thogs med zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa thogs med zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, the noble Asanga says:

original: de la go cha'i sgrub pa dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dag gi grangs bzhin du brgyud pa dang dngos kyi sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sa dag gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la go cha'i sgrub pa dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dag gi grangs bzhin du brgyud pa dang dngos kyi sbyor ba'i rang bzhin tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sa dag gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Therein, the armor practice and the engagement practice are included in the stages of the equipment and the practice with devoted interest, respectively, in accordance with the number of the practices.

original: dngos kyi sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin chos mchog rab kyis bsdus pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos kyi sbyor ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin chos mchog rab kyis bsdus pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of the equipment is included in the supreme mundane quality, which is the nature of the direct practice path.

original: mthong ba'i lam kyi bdag nyid rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i rang bzhin tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam kyi bdag nyid rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i rang bzhin tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of the equipment is the nature of the ground of the Joyful One, which is the nature of the path of seeing.

original: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyen po'i bdag nyid na'ang tshogs kyi sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyen po'i bdag nyid na'ang tshogs kyi sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: And on the second stage and so on, it is the very practice of the accumulation, since it is the very nature of the antidote.

original: lam gnyis spyod yul lam nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ste bsgom pa'i lam gyi byin rlabs kyis so zhes so //
analyzed: lam gnyis spyod yul lam nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ste bsgom pa'i lam gyi byin rlabs kyis so zhes so //
translated: The practice of the path is the practice of the sphere of the two paths, because of the blessing of the path of cultivation.

original: zhar la byung ba ste bzhag go //
analyzed: zhar la byung ba ste bzhag go //
translated: This is the digression.

original: skabs su bab pa brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa brjod par bya ste //
translated: Now we will discuss the topic at hand.

original: byang chub sems de ni byang chub phyogs kyi rnam pas yongs su bskor te bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems de ni byang chub phyogs kyi rnam pas yongs su bskor te bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That thought of enlightenment should be cultivated, surrounded by the aspects of the accessories of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpas stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems nang du gyur pa nyid kyis byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa gsum rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems nang du gyur pa nyid kyis byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa gsum rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should cultivate the thought of enlightenment, which is the unity of emptiness and compassion, by means of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, which are its consequences.

original: de nyid kyis na byang chub ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste phyogs ni rjes su mthun par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na byang chub ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste phyogs ni rjes su mthun par gyur pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is omniscience, and the factors are its favorable conditions.

original: stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las ci skad du gsungs te /
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las ci skad du gsungs te /
translated: The Twenty-Five Thousand says this:🔽“Śāriputra, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva should complete the four establishments of mindfulness.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su chub par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su chub par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi rol gyi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la lus la sogs pa rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi rol gyi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la lus la sogs pa rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: Thus, with regard to internal and external bodies, feelings, thoughts, and dharmas, he dwells contemplating the body, and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not think in terms of the body, and so on.

original: 'di ni bdag lus po rtag go mi rtag go bde pa'o sdug bsngal lo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag lus po rtag go mi rtag go bde pa'o sdug bsngal lo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: This is because he does not observe the body, and so on, as permanent or impermanent, as blissful or painful, as a self or not a self, and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa ldog pa'i sgo nas ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ldog pa'i sgo nas ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: The hearers meditate on the absence of observation by way of the reversal of non-observation.

original: de yang / nyan thos kyi tshig pa pa de ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis dmigs so //
analyzed: de yang / nyan thos kyi tshig pa pa de ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis dmigs so //
translated: And that is because the hearers observe the body, and so on, by way of permanence, and so on.

original: byang chub @278a * //
analyzed: byang chub @278a * //
translated: Enlightenment🔽

original: sems dpa'i theg pa pa ni de rnams nyid mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas dmigs te /
analyzed: sems dpa'i theg pa pa ni de rnams nyid mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas dmigs te /
translated: The bodhisattva vehicle is the object of those very [four foundations of mindfulness] through the application of non-apprehension.

original: de nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa stong pa nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams yul can du 'gyur ro zhes chos nyid mngon du gyur pas nyan thos kyi lam yang goms pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa stong pa nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams yul can du 'gyur ro zhes chos nyid mngon du gyur pas nyan thos kyi lam yang goms pa yin no zhes so //
translated: By that very [non-apprehension], the aspects of impermanence, etc. are also emptiness. The bodhisattvas are the subjects. Thus, by actualizing reality, they also cultivate the śrāvaka path.

original: da ni de bzhin du sems bskyed pa dang po gsum gyi grangs bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du sems bskyed pa dang po gsum gyi grangs bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams bsdus pa'o //
translated: Now, in the same way, the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and the four legs of supernatural power are included in the first three cultivations of the thought of enlightenment, respectively.

original: de ni 'di ltar tshogs kyi sa ru dge ba'i sems kyi dad pa la sogs pa yongs su goms pa nyid byang chub sems yang dag par len pa dang sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba bsags pa dang ldan pa bsod nams kyi tshogs yang

translated: It is like this: On the stage of accumulation, the very thorough familiarization with faith, etc. of a virtuous mind is the correct taking up of the thought of enlightenment. Possessing the accumulation of merit, which is endowed with the accumulation of virtue such as generosity and morality, etc.,

original: mkhyen pa gsum gyi tshu rol du bud shing gzhan khyad par gyis me gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i rtsom pa ni sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: bar chad med pa mthong ba'i lam ches nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las gsungs te /

analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba yang dag par ldan par 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'ang kun du spyod do //

translated: While engaged in the practice of conviction in the small, middling, great, and greater degrees of the stage of action in faith, he is said to be engaged in the practice of conviction.

analyzed: nges par @278b 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams zhes gsal ba'i rnam dbye mang po'i tshig gis kyang rgyas par bstan te /
translated: The term “stages conducive to penetrative insight” is also taught extensively in the sutras with many different words.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: kha cig tu ga ta zhes pa spyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ga ta zhes pa spyi brjod pa ste /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: drod kyi rnam pa dang / rtse mo'i rnam pa dang / bzod pa'i rnam pa dang / chos mchog gi rnam pa zhes so //

analyzed: de ni nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag ni yang ngo //
translated: That is the branches of penetrative insight.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: nges par 'byed pa ni nges 'byed de mtha' gcig tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni nges 'byed de mtha' gcig tu nges pa'o //
translated: Penetrative insight is definite discernment, definite in one direction.

original: de'i yan lag go zhes dbye ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i yan lag go zhes dbye ba bzhi ste /
translated: Its branches are fourfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu ni drod do //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu ni drod do //
translated: The small stage of heat is the stage of warmth.

original: 'bring ni rtse mo'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni rtse mo'o //
translated: The medium stage is the peak.

original: rab ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rab ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The great stage is the forbearance stage.

original: rab kyi rab ni chos mchog go zhes so //
analyzed: rab kyi rab ni chos mchog go zhes so //
translated: The great of the great is the supreme mundane quality.

original: de la gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i me bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i sngon gyi mtshan ma yin pas drod do //
analyzed: de la gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i me bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i sngon gyi mtshan ma yin pas drod do //
translated: The stage of warmth is so called because it is a sign of the fire of supramundane wisdom, like the sign of fire from rubbing wood.

original: g-yo ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mo'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mo'o //
translated: The peak is so called because it is the peak of the roots of virtue that are still subject to reversal.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog bzod pa'i phyir bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos mchog bzod pa'i phyir bzod pa'o //
translated: The forbearance stage is so called because it is the supreme mundane quality that is still subject to reversal.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad mchog yin pas chos mchog go zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad mchog yin pas chos mchog go zhes so //
translated: The supreme mundane quality is so called because it is supreme among all mundane phenomena.

original: yang drod la sogs pa rnams so sor chung ngu 'bring rab kyi dbye bas bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yang drod la sogs pa rnams so sor chung ngu 'bring rab kyi dbye bas bcu gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, each of these stages of warmth and so on is divided into small, medium and great, making twelve.

original: drod la sogs pa 'di ni byang chub gsum thob pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: drod la sogs pa 'di ni byang chub gsum thob pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: These stages of warmth and so on are the causes for attaining the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: gang zag kha cig rigs la sogs pa'i stobs kyi rtse mo yin byang chub thob pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag kha cig rigs la sogs pa'i stobs kyi rtse mo yin byang chub thob pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are the peak of the roots of virtue that are still subject to reversal and because they are the peak of the lineage and so on.

original: nyan thos dang rang rgyal theg pa pa dag gis drod la sogs pa mchog gi byang chub nam yang thob par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang rgyal theg pa pa dag gis drod la sogs pa mchog gi byang chub nam yang thob par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The disciples and hermit buddhas never attain supreme enlightenment through the stages of heat and so on.🔽In this context, the nine degrees of interest are the three degrees of interest in the small, medium, and great stages of the three phases of meditative warmth and so on.🔽The interest in the small stage of meditative warmth is the small degree of interest, and so on.🔽The interest in the great stage of meditative warmth is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of peak is the small degree of interest, and so on.

original: de la drod gsum la rim pa bzhin du chung ngu 'bring chen po'i mos pa'i rang bzhin la chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas mos pa dgu ste rang don no //🔽gang gis rang don nyid phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la drod gsum la rim pa bzhin du chung ngu 'bring chen po'i mos pa'i rang bzhin la chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas mos pa dgu ste rang don no // gang gis rang don nyid phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The interest in the great stage of peak is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of patient acceptance is the small degree of interest, and so on.

original: gzhan don ni ched du bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan don ni ched du bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The interest in the great stage of patient acceptance is the great degree of interest.

original: rtse mo gsum la ci ltar rang bzhin la de bzhin du mos pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rtse mo gsum la ci ltar rang bzhin la de bzhin du mos pa dgu ste /
translated: The interest in the small stage of the highest mundane experience is the small degree of interest, and so on.

original: rang dang gzhan don no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan don no //
translated: The interest in the great stage of the highest mundane experience is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of the path of seeing is the small degree of interest, and so on.

original: 'dir sbyor ba bar chod bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba bar chod bcas pa'o //
translated: The interest in the great stage of the path of seeing is the great degree of interest.

original: bzod pa gsum la ci ltar rang bzhin la de ltar mos pa dgu ste gzhan don no //
analyzed: bzod pa gsum la ci ltar rang bzhin la de ltar mos pa dgu ste gzhan don no //
translated: The interest in the small stage of the path of meditation is the small degree of interest, and so on.

original: 'dir bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The interest in the great stage of the path of meditation is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of the poised readiness for the cognition of the factors is the small degree of interest, and so on.🔽The interest in the great stage of the poised readiness for the cognition of the factors is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of the cognition of the factors is the small degree of interest, and so on.

original: gang las 'dis gzhan nyid kyi don du 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: gang las 'dis gzhan nyid kyi don du 'gyur ba na /
translated: The interest in the great stage of the cognition of the factors is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of the poised readiness for the cognition of the path is the small degree of interest, and so on.🔽The interest in the great stage of the poised readiness for the cognition of the path is the great degree of interest.

original: rang gi don ni mi @279a * //
analyzed: rang gi don ni mi @279a * //
translated: The interest in the small stage of the cognition of the path is the small degree of interest, and so on.🔽The interest in the great stage of the cognition of the path is the great degree of interest.🔽The interest in the small stage of the cognition of all aspects is the small degree of interest, and so on.🔽The

original: 'gal bas rang don 'grub pas so //
analyzed: 'gal bas rang don 'grub pas so //
translated: because of the contradiction, one accomplishes one's own aim.

original: de ltar mos pa nyer bdun sgom par byed pa byang chub sems dpa' spro bar bya ba'i ched du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis bstod pa bkur ba sngags pa byed bzhin pa rnams rim pa bzhin du de bzhin du nyi shu nyer bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa nyer bdun sgom par byed pa byang chub sems dpa' spro bar bya ba'i ched du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis bstod pa bkur ba sngags pa byed bzhin pa rnams rim pa bzhin du de bzhin du nyi shu nyer bdun no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who cultivates the twenty-seven kinds of devoted interest is praised by the Buddhas, etc., for his enthusiasm, just as the mantra practitioner is praised by the vidyadharas, etc., for his enthusiasm.

original: chos mchog la mos pa thams cad rab tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi chung ngu'i rnam pa la mos pa thams cad yid la byed pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bsod nams ni bden pa gnyis las mi 'da' bas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs
analyzed: chos mchog la mos pa thams cad rab tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi chung ngu'i rnam pa la mos pa thams cad yid la byed pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bsod nams ni bden pa gnyis las mi 'da' bas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs
translated: The merit that is accumulated by the bodhisattva who is engaged in the mental attention to all the forms of devoted interest in the stage of devoted interest, which has the nature of the transformation of all devoted interest, is completely transferred to perfect enlightenment, because it does not transgress the two truths.

original: su sngo bar byed pa na byang chub sems dpa' khas len par byed do //
analyzed: su sngo bar byed pa na byang chub sems dpa' khas len par byed do //
translated: When he completely transfers it, the bodhisattva accepts it.

original: 'bring po'i rnam pa la rang gis yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba'i don kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar dmigs te yi rang ba'i sems dang / don dam par mi dmigs pas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa na rang gzhan bsod nams bya ba mnyam pa nyid du thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring po'i rnam pa la rang gis yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'phel ba'i don kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar dmigs te yi rang ba'i sems dang / don dam par mi dmigs pas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa na rang gzhan bsod nams bya ba mnyam pa nyid du thob pa'o //
translated: But when one rejoices in the ultimate sense, without focusing on anything, one attains the sameness of merit with oneself and others.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro bas kyang yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes 'di dag la rim pa ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro bas kyang yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes 'di dag la rim pa ni nges pa med do //
translated: Sometimes, dedication is preceded by rejoicing, but there is no fixed sequence between these two.

original: yongs su bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba 'di dag ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la yod mod kyi /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba 'di dag ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la yod mod kyi /
translated: Dedication and rejoicing are present in the development of bodhicitta and so on that is associated with interest,

original: 'on kyang 'di de la ltos nas de mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di de la ltos nas de mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: but it should be understood that, in comparison with that, the latter is superior.

original: rab kyi rnam pa ni mos pa thams cad rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i rang bzhin nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab kyi rnam pa ni mos pa thams cad rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i rang bzhin nas bzung ste /
translated: The best kind of dedication and rejoicing is that which is characterized by the perfection of all interest to the highest degree.

original: rang sems dbang du byas pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi dag nus pa med pas dul ba'i sems dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gi nga rgyal mthon po med pas rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon pa bdud la sogs
analyzed: rang sems dbang du byas pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi dag nus pa med pas dul ba'i sems dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gi nga rgyal mthon po med pas rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon pa bdud la sogs
translated: Since one has control over one's own mind, one has no pride in self and in what pertains to self, and so one is naturally superior to the demons and so on.

original: pas byas pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba'i yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: pas byas pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba'i yul ma yin pa /
translated: One is not an object for the harm that is done by demons and so on.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par rung ba /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par rung ba /
translated: One is fit to attain perfect enlightenment.🔽One makes one's own basis an object of worship.

original: rang gi rten yul mchod bya nyid du byed do zhes pa ni drod la sogs pa'i byed pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rten yul mchod bya nyid du byed do zhes pa ni drod la sogs pa'i byed pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the functions of heat and so on.

original: de nyid kyis drod la sogs pa rnams mos pa brtan pa dang yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis drod la sogs pa rnams mos pa brtan pa dang yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes brjod do //
translated: By virtue of that, heat and so on are called the stage of action in faith, because they are the basis of firm faith and good qualities.

original: de yang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems chos thams cad bdag med pa sgom par byed pa na /
analyzed: de yang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems chos thams cad bdag med pa sgom par byed pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the mind that is in equipoise cultivates the meditation on the selflessness of all phenomena,

original: don tha dad du gyur pa mngon par zhen pa med pas shes pa'i snang ba cung zad gsal @279b bas yid tsam nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: don tha dad du gyur pa mngon par zhen pa med pas shes pa'i snang ba cung zad gsal @279b bas yid tsam nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: Since there is no more clinging to the appearance of objects as being different, the appearance of consciousness becomes slightly clearer, and one sees that it is merely mind.

original: de'i tshe 'di ni drod kyi rnam pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ni drod kyi rnam pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: At that time, this is the stage of heat.

original: de nyid snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the concentration of attaining light.

original: de'i rjes su shes pa'i snang ba 'bring du gsal ba ni rtse mo'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su shes pa'i snang ba 'bring du gsal ba ni rtse mo'i gnas skabs so //
translated: After that, the appearance of consciousness becomes clearer, and this is the stage of the peak.

original: de ni snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de ni snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: This is the concentration of attaining light.

original: gang gi tshe sems tsam du rnam par gnas pas phyi rol gyi don mngon par zhen pa med pa shes pa'i snang ba ches gsal ba skye ba de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems tsam du rnam par gnas pas phyi rol gyi don mngon par zhen pa med pa shes pa'i snang ba ches gsal ba skye ba de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: When one abides in mind-only, without clinging to external objects, and the appearance of consciousness becomes clearer still, this is the stage of acceptance.

original: de ni de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: This is the concentration of entering into one aspect of the meaning of reality.

original: gang gi tshe yang don 'dzin par byed pa'i g-yeng ba mi snang ba'i shes pa'i gsal ba rdzogs pa de'i 'jig rten chos mchog gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang don 'dzin par byed pa'i g-yeng ba mi snang ba'i shes pa'i gsal ba rdzogs pa de'i 'jig rten chos mchog gnas skabs so //
translated: When the clarity of consciousness, which does not appear as the distraction of grasping an object, is perfected, that is the stage of supreme mundane quality.

original: de nyid bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de nyid bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: That is the uninterrupted samadhi.

original: de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma chos thams cad bdag med pa de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa dngos kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma chos thams cad bdag med pa de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa dngos kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Immediately after that, the moment of the path of seeing is the actual antidote that realizes the reality of the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: des na skad cig de nyid la mthong bas spang bya thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: des na skad cig de nyid la mthong bas spang bya thams cad spong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, in that very moment, one abandons all that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mdo sde rgyan las gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las gsungs te /
translated: It is stated in the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras:

original: drod kyi rnam pa la sogs pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: drod kyi rnam pa la sogs pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The aspects of heat and so forth and the factors conducive to penetrative insight have already been explained.

original: de las pha rol nas mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de las pha rol nas mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Beyond that, the stage of the path of seeing is as follows.

original: gnyis rnam par grol ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis rnam par grol ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of the twofold liberation.

original: gzung bya dang 'dzin byed mi ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzung bya dang 'dzin byed mi ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not associated with the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: / rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: / rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: It is nonconceptual.

original: gzung bya dang 'dzin byed rnam rtog mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bya dang 'dzin byed rnam rtog mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the discrimination of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: dri ma dang mi ldan te mthong bas spang bya spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang mi ldan te mthong bas spang bya spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from defilement, because it has abandoned that which is to be abandoned by means of the path of vision.

original: de ni 'di rten yongs gyur pa //
analyzed: de ni 'di rten yongs gyur pa //
translated: That is the transformation of the basis,

original: sa ni dang po dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: sa ni dang po dag tu 'dod //
translated: which is considered to be the first stage.

original: gzhal med dang don thams cad kyis //
analyzed: gzhal med dang don thams cad kyis //
translated: By means of the immeasurable and all the aims,

original: shin tu rnam dag tu nges 'gro'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag tu nges 'gro'o //
translated: one definitely proceeds to the extremely pure.

original: zhes so // des na drod dang rtse mo'i rnam pa dag dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: zhes so // des na drod dang rtse mo'i rnam pa dag dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: Therefore, the aspects of heat and summit are the nature of the five faculties such as faith.

original: bzod pa dang chos mchog dag dad pa la sogs pa stobs lnga'i bdag nyid do zhes drod la sogs pa rnams dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid du grub pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang chos mchog dag dad pa la sogs pa stobs lnga'i bdag nyid do zhes drod la sogs pa rnams dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid du grub pa'o //
translated: Acceptance and the supreme mundane state are the nature of the five powers such as faith. Thus, heat and so on are established as the nature of the faculties and the powers.

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa nyid yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa nyid yang ngo //
translated: The practice of engagement is also that.

original: de rnams kyi sngon du bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sngon du bshad do //
translated: It was explained previously.

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa de'ang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa de'ang /
translated: That practice of engagement

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang theg pa chen po la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang theg pa chen po la gnas pa'o //
translated: is the entry into the Great Vehicle and the abiding in the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa la dang po gnas pa'am gnas pa dag 'jug pa zhes pa don gcig pas ming gcig nyid do zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes so //🔽bcom ldan 'das ma @280a * //
analyzed: theg pa la dang po gnas pa'am gnas pa dag 'jug pa zhes pa don gcig pas ming gcig nyid do zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes so // bcom ldan 'das ma @280a * //
translated: The noble Vimuktasena says that the first and the abiding are synonyms, since they have the same meaning as “engaged.”

original: las theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes tshig gnyis ni /🔽'jug pa'i sgrub pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid theg pa chen po'i chos la yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: las theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa dang / theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes tshig gnyis ni / 'jug pa'i sgrub pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid theg pa chen po'i chos la yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: In the Bhagavatī, two terms, “engaged in the Great Vehicle” and “abiding in the Great Vehicle,”🔽are said to refer to the Great Vehicle’s teachings on cause and effect, respectively, by way of engagement and accomplishment.

original: phyi nas gong nas gong du khyad par lhag par rtogs pas yang dag par gnas pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: phyi nas gong nas gong du khyad par lhag par rtogs pas yang dag par gnas pa'o zhes so //
translated: Later, one abides in the Great Vehicle by realizing its superiority.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen yang gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen yang gsungs te /
translated: Master Vasubandhu also says:

original: 'jug pa'i sgras 'gro bar rtsom pa dang / theg pa la gnas pa dang / bgrod pa rnams rim pa bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bdun dang / mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa gsum rnams la brjod par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgras 'gro bar rtsom pa dang / theg pa la gnas pa dang / bgrod pa rnams rim pa bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bdun dang / mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa gsum rnams la brjod par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The words “to enter” should be understood as referring to the stage of action in faith, the seven stages beginning with the Joyous, and the three stages beginning with the Immovable.

original: des na dang po mos pas spyod pa'i sa la lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: des na dang po mos pas spyod pa'i sa la lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: Thus, on the first stage, the stage of action in faith, one has superior aspiration.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun pa la rtsol bas bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun pa la rtsol bas bgrod pa'o //
translated: On the seven stages beginning with the Joyous, one proceeds by effort.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa'i sa gsum la ci zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa'i sa gsum la ci zhe na /
translated: What about the three stages beginning with the eighth?

original: rtsol ba med pas so //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pas so //
translated: One proceeds effortlessly.

original: theg pa nyid kyis 'di'i bgrod pa sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa nyid kyis 'di'i bgrod pa sgrub pa ste /
translated: One accomplishes the journey by means of the vehicle itself.

original: shin tu bzod pa'i shing rta bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu bzod pa'i shing rta bzhin no //
translated: It is like a chariot that moves by itself.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid du 'jug pa'i sgrub pas lam gyi rang bzhin theg pa chen po la gnas so //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid du 'jug pa'i sgrub pas lam gyi rang bzhin theg pa chen po la gnas so //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, from the very beginning, abides in the vehicle, the nature of which is the path, by the accomplishment of entering.

original: de la lam gyi rnam pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la lam gyi rnam pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa ste /
translated: The aspects of the path are the six perfections and so on.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i skabs su rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i skabs su rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: The truth of the path has already been explained in detail.

original: de las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from there.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni 'jig rten chos mchog nas brtsams te rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni 'jig rten chos mchog nas brtsams te rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The practice of the assembly is established starting from the supreme worldly dharmas.

original: 'dis byang chub chen po bsogs par byed pa'am lci ba nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: 'dis byang chub chen po bsogs par byed pa'am lci ba nyid kyis sam /
translated: Because this accumulates or makes heavy the great enlightenment,

original: 'gengs par byed pas tshogs so //🔽tshogs pas tshogs te /
analyzed: 'gengs par byed pas tshogs so // tshogs pas tshogs te /
translated: or because it fills, it is an assembly.🔽The assembly is an assembly because

original: rnam pa thams cad du tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is an assembly in all aspects.

original: tshogs de'ang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshogs de'ang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That assembly is also summarized as twofold.🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: the assembly of merit and the assembly of wisdom.

original: gang gi tshe yang sngon bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags kyang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang sngon bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags kyang /
translated: When one has previously accumulated the assemblies of merit and wisdom,

original: de bzhin du yang 'di nas bzung ste khyad par gyis zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'di nas bzung ste khyad par gyis zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and similarly, from here on it is established by distinction.

original: rgyas par ni tshogs rnam pa bcu bdun te /
analyzed: rgyas par ni tshogs rnam pa bcu bdun te /
translated: In detail, there are seventeen types of assemblies.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: dmyal ba pa dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i lha dang mi dag tu skye ba ni snying rje'i tshogs so //
analyzed: dmyal ba pa dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i lha dang mi dag tu skye ba ni snying rje'i tshogs so //
translated: The pacification of all the sufferings of the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals is the collection of compassion.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @280b tshogs dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @280b tshogs dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang /
translated: The collection of the perfection of generosity, the collection of the perfection of moral discipline, the collection of the perfection of patience, the collection of the perfection of effort, the collection of the perfection of meditation,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / zhi gnas kyi tshogs dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i tshogs dang / gang la las mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / zhi gnas kyi tshogs dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i tshogs dang / gang la las mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod cing /
translated: The accumulation of the perfection of wisdom, the accumulation of serenity, the accumulation of insight, the accumulation of the union of serenity and insight, and the accumulation of the practice of the perfections with the attention that is directed to omniscience without objectifying anything.

original: gzhan dag de la yang dag par 'jog pa de ni thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la yang dag par 'jog pa de ni thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of skill in means is the correct placement of others in that.

original: gang stong pa nyid nyi shu rnams yongs su shes pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid nyi shu rnams yongs su shes pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is the thorough understanding of the twenty kinds of emptiness.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba rin chen phyag rgya dang nam mkha' mdzod dang / seng ge rnam par rol pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba rin chen phyag rgya dang nam mkha' mdzod dang / seng ge rnam par rol pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of merit is the meditative absorptions such as the heroic gait, the jewel seal, the sky treasury, and the lion’s play.

original: byang chub phyogs rnam par thar pa snyoms par 'jug pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched zad par la sogs pa lam rnam pa mang po ni lam gyi tshogs sogs so //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs rnam par thar pa snyoms par 'jug pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched zad par la sogs pa lam rnam pa mang po ni lam gyi tshogs sogs so //
translated: The many kinds of paths, such as the factors of enlightenment, the deliverances, the spheres of conquest, the totalities, etc., are the equipment of the path.🔽The retention of the letter, etc., is the retention of the letter A, etc., which is the cause of the retention of the meaning of the letter. The retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the letter, i.e., thusness. The retention of the Dharma is the retention of the aggregates of the teachings of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions. The retention of the object is the retention of the aggregates of the teachings of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: aa ra pa tsa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la de'i don de bzhin nyid dmigs nas sgom par byed cing sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa dag / yi ge de'i don la bzod pa skyed pa de ni bzod pa'i gzungs dang / gzungs dang ldan pa'i blo la'o //🔽phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bstan pa'i phung po 'dzin pa'i rgyu dran pa dang shes rab dag gcig tu byas pa de ni chos kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la de'i don de bzhin nyid dmigs nas sgom par byed cing sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa dag / yi ge de'i don la bzod pa skyed pa de ni bzod pa'i gzungs dang / gzungs dang ldan pa'i blo la'o // phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bstan pa'i phung po 'dzin pa'i rgyu dran pa dang shes rab dag gcig tu byas pa de ni chos kyi gzungs so //
translated: The retention of the letter is the meditation on the meaning of the letter A, etc., which is thusness, by those who are engaged in meditation, and the production of the acceptance of the meaning of the letter by those who have completed the meditation.🔽The retention of the Dharma is the cause of the retention of the aggregates of the teachings of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions, which is a combination of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: de'i don 'dzin pa'i rgyu dran pa dang shes rab dag gcig tu byas pa de ni don gyi gzungs so //
analyzed: de'i don 'dzin pa'i rgyu dran pa dang shes rab dag gcig tu byas pa de ni don gyi gzungs so //
translated: The retention of the object is the cause of the retention of the aggregates of the teachings of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas of the past, present, and future, which is a combination of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa sgyu ma lta bu gsang sngags smra ba la dbang du gyur pa de ni gsang sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa sgyu ma lta bu gsang sngags smra ba la dbang du gyur pa de ni gsang sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: The dhāraṇī of mantra is the mastery of the mantra-reciters in the illusory retention of sentient beings.

original: gzungs bzhi po de ni gzungs kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gzungs bzhi po de ni gzungs kyi tshogs so //
translated: These four dhāraṇīs are the accumulation of dhāraṇī.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams ni sa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams ni sa'i tshogs so //
translated: The ten bodhisattva stages, such as the stage of the joyous, are the accumulation of the stages.

original: gzhan dag pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i yongs su sbyong ba ni sa yi tshogs zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i yongs su sbyong ba ni sa yi tshogs zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the purification that purifies the other stages is the accumulation of the stages.🔽The conception of the apprehended is the perception of the apprehended things such as reality and so on and dreams and so forth on the path of seeing.🔽The conception of the apprehender is the conception of the mind that apprehends those things as being truly existent.🔽The conception of nonanalytical recollection is the conception of the mind that recollects things such as the aggregates and so on without analysis.

original: mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa gzung bya dngos po rnams nye bar dmigs pa ni bzung ba'i rtog pa'o //🔽de rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid rtogs pa gnyen po dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs @281a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa gzung bya dngos po rnams nye bar dmigs pa ni bzung ba'i rtog pa'o //🔽de rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid rtogs pa gnyen po dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs @281a * //
translated: The conception of analytical recollection is the conception of the mind that recollects things such as the aggregates and so on through analysis.🔽The conception of the object of engagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of disengagement is the conception of the mind that disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three realms and disengages from the three realms.🔽The conception of the object of engagement and disengagement is the conception of the mind that engages in the three

original: rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug pa gnyen po'i dngos po rnams nye bar dmigs pa ni bzung ba'i rnam rtog go de rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa gnyen po'o //
analyzed: rgyas kyi chos kyi mthar thug pa gnyen po'i dngos po rnams nye bar dmigs pa ni bzung ba'i rnam rtog go de rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa gnyen po'o //
translated: The observation of the things that are the antidotes to the final dharmas of increase is the discursive thought of apprehended objects. The antidote of non-observation is because those are empty of inherent nature.

original: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa gang zag gi rdzas la nye bar dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa gang zag gi rdzas la nye bar dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The observation of the substance of a person such as an arhat is the discursive thought of the apprehending subject.

original: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote of non-observation is like that.

original: ming dang brda dang tha snyad la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog go //
analyzed: ming dang brda dang tha snyad la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog go //
translated: The observation of names, symbols, conventions, and so on is the discursive thought of the apprehending subject.

original: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote of non-observation is like that.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la /
translated: On the path of cultivation,

original: chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa ma yin mi gnas pa ma yin bzung ba'i dngos po rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i dngos po rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag gi rdzas rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa ma yin mi gnas pa ma yin bzung ba'i dngos po rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa gnyen po'i dngos po rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag gi rdzas rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang /
translated: the antidote of not observing the substances of the persons such as stream-enterers,🔽the antidote of not observing the continuums of the imputations of persons such as stream-enterers, such as the fruits of stream-entry,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa gang zag btags pa'i rten rnams kyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang / gnyen po brgyad po de rnams ni gnyen po'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa gang zag btags pa'i rten rnams kyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa gnyen po dang / gnyen po brgyad po de rnams ni gnyen po'i tshogs so //
translated: and those eight antidotes are the collection of antidotes.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi po de rnams ni brdar btags pa kun rdzob pa 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi po de rnams ni brdar btags pa kun rdzob pa 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: Those four generated minds are the conventional, worldly, symbolic generation.

original: de la sems bskyed pa lnga ni /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa lnga ni /
translated: Therein, the five generated minds are

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa rnams so //
translated: the forbearance of the dharma knowing of suffering and the dharma knowing of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung 'gog pa lam zhes bden pa bzhi dmigs pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa mngon du byas pas yang dag pa nyid nges pa la zhugs pa rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung 'gog pa lam zhes bden pa bzhi dmigs pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa mngon du byas pas yang dag pa nyid nges pa la zhugs pa rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
translated: Likewise, the path of seeing, which is the sixteen moments of the four truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, is the stage of the utterly joyful one, which is the entry into the ascertainment of reality, because it manifests the lack of intrinsic reality of all phenomena.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa de'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid sgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa de'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid sgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na /
translated: When the power of meditating on the lack of intrinsic reality of all phenomena on that stage of the utterly joyful one is perfected,

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyis rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa zag pa med pa'i shes pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyis rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa zag pa med pa'i shes pa skyes pa'o //
translated: the uncontaminated consciousness that manifests the nature of all phenomena in all aspects is born.

original: cha shas med pa mngon sum pa gcig ni rang 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha shas med pa mngon sum pa gcig ni rang 'gyur te /
translated: The single partless direct perception is self-arisen.

original: tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
translated: The object of investigation by valid cognitions

original: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: is not seen. What other part is there?

original: zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: des na mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni mthong bar rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig go //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni mthong bar rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig go //
translated: Therefore the nature of the path of seeing is the single moment of realization of seeing.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And also:

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Inconceivable Sphere of the Buddha says:

original: 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what are the four noble truths like?

original: lha'i bu 'dir gang gis 'du byed @281b thams cad rang bzhin ma skyes pa mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa nyid do //🔽gang gis chos thams cad shin tu yang dag par ma chad pa mthong ba des ni kun 'byung rab tu spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu 'dir gang gis 'du byed @281b thams cad rang bzhin ma skyes pa mthong ba des ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa nyid do // gang gis chos thams cad shin tu yang dag par ma chad pa mthong ba des ni kun 'byung rab tu spangs pa'o //
translated: Divine son, whoever sees all conditioned things as essentially unborn fully knows suffering.🔽Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly unceased abandons the origin.

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba des ni 'gog pa mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba des ni 'gog pa mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly nirvāṇa actualizes cessation.

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu stong pa mthong ba des ni lam bsgom pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu stong pa mthong ba des ni lam bsgom pa byas pa ste /
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly empty cultivates the path.

original: rang gi ngo bos ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not produced by way of their own nature.

original: 'dis ni bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa thams cad kyis rang gi ngo bo de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid kho na zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa thams cad kyis rang gi ngo bo de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid kho na zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This says that the reality of the nature of the four noble truths is just emptiness.

original: de'ang mngon par rtogs pa byed bzhin pa na lan cig nyid sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de'ang mngon par rtogs pa byed bzhin pa na lan cig nyid sbyor ba ste /
translated: Moreover, when one is engaged in the realization of this, one is engaged in it just once,

original: rim gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis ma yin te /
translated: not gradually,

original: stong pa nyid de la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid de la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that emptiness is partless.

original: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The Rice Seedling Sutra says:

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba de ni chos mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba de ni chos mthong ba'o //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin las tha dad med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin las tha dad med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
translated: Because the nature of the Dharma is not different, one sees the Buddha.

original: gang 'di yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes pa de ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes pa de ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that fully discerns this is Dharma knowledge.

original: chos ni yul lo //
analyzed: chos ni yul lo //
translated: The object is the Dharma.

original: shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness is Dharma knowledge.

original: 'dis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the forbearance of Dharma knowledge with regard to the truth of suffering.

original: gang las sdug bsngal la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang las sdug bsngal la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Since suffering is dependently arisen, it is not intrinsically produced.

original: gang rang bzhin skye ba med pa de nyid 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi rang bzhin ma skyes pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin skye ba med pa de nyid 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi rang bzhin ma skyes pa yin pas so //
translated: That which is not intrinsically produced is the nature of both cyclic existence and nirvana, since it is not produced.

original: dbu ma rtsa ba las gsungs te /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba las gsungs te /
translated: The Root of the Middle Way states:

original: mya ngan las 'das 'khor ba ni //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das 'khor ba ni //
translated: Nirvana and cyclic existence

original: tha dad cung zad yod pa min //
analyzed: tha dad cung zad yod pa min //
translated: Do not have the slightest difference.

original: 'khor ba las ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'khor ba las ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Cyclic existence and nirvana

original: tha dad cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: tha dad cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: Do not have the slightest difference.

original: mya ngan 'das kyi mtha' gang yang //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das kyi mtha' gang yang //
translated: Whatever is the limit of nirvana

original: 'khor ba rnams kyi mtha' yang yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba rnams kyi mtha' yang yin //
translated: Is also the limit of cyclic existence.🔽Between them there is not the slightest

original: de dag bar  du cung zad cig / shin tu phra ba'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: de dag bar  du cung zad cig / shin tu phra ba'ang yod pa min //
translated: Even a subtle particle.

original: zhes so // 'dis mtha'i sgra ni rab tu gyur pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dis mtha'i sgra ni rab tu gyur pa brjod pa ste /
translated: This passage explains that the term “limit” is used to refer to a transformation.

original: rab tu gyur pa zhes bya ba rting du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gyur pa zhes bya ba rting du gnas pa'o //
translated: A transformation is a complete change.

original: byis pa skye bo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa skye bo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature that is not the domain of experience of ordinary beings.

original: de ni de bzhin du bden pa bzhi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa dmigs pas mthong ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin du bden pa bzhi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa dmigs pas mthong ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig nyid do //
translated: And that is the single clear realization.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs par byed pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs par byed pa'i shes pas /
translated: Moreover, by the knowledge that perceives dependent origination,

original: gang sdug bsngal gyi skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa des bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //🔽@282a * // gang las nyon mongs pa dag gis mi skye ba mi 'gag pa yongs su gcod pa 'di ni kun 'byung yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal gyi skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa des bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o // @282a * // gang las nyon mongs pa dag gis mi skye ba mi 'gag pa yongs su gcod pa 'di ni kun 'byung yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: one fully comprehends the non-arising and non-ceasing of suffering, and thereby one fully knows one’s own suffering.🔽One fully comprehends the non-arising and non-ceasing of the origin of suffering through the non-arising and non-ceasing of the afflictions, and thereby one fully knows the origin.

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa de ni 'gog pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa de ni 'gog pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: One fully comprehends the unborn and unceasing nature of dependent origination, and thereby one fully knows cessation.🔽The path is dependent origination itself,

original: lam rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: lam rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pas /
translated: and

original: gang rang bzhin skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa de ni lam yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa yongs su gcod pa de ni lam yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The path is fully understood by one who fully understands the non-arising and non-ceasing of the nature of things.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos shes pas skad cig la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong bas 'di sngon ma mthong ba gzhan blta bar bya ba ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos shes pas skad cig la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong bas 'di sngon ma mthong ba gzhan blta bar bya ba ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Because, in this way, by knowing the Dharma, one sees dependent origination in a single moment, it is impossible that one should see anything else that was not seen before.

original: des na mthong ba'i lam ni mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig go //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i lam ni mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig go //
translated: Therefore, the path of seeing is the single moment of clear realization.

original: gal te gang tshe skad cig la de kho na nyid mthong na ci ltar mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug yin zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: gal te gang tshe skad cig la de kho na nyid mthong na ci ltar mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug yin zhe na brjod de /
translated: If reality is seen in a single moment, how can the path of seeing have sixteen moments?

original: shes pa de nyid kyi ngo bo gcig nyid yan lag rnam par phye ste skad cig ma bcu drug tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: shes pa de nyid kyi ngo bo gcig nyid yan lag rnam par phye ste skad cig ma bcu drug tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The very same cognition is divided into sixteen moments, on the basis of its aspects.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams gdams ngag des rjes su bzung ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams gdams ngag des rjes su bzung ba'i ched du'o //
translated: This is for the sake of those who are to be trained, who are of that kind.

original: gal te de ltar na rnam pa bcu drug lam bsgom pa ci ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rnam pa bcu drug lam bsgom pa ci ltar bshad ce na /
translated: If that is so, how can the cultivation of the path in sixteen aspects be explained?

original: 'di yang 'gro ba 'dod pa rnams rnam pa gzhan gyis de kho na nyid shes pa la bzhugs pa'i don du yongs su brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang 'gro ba 'dod pa rnams rnam pa gzhan gyis de kho na nyid shes pa la bzhugs pa'i don du yongs su brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is also posited by way of imagining that those who desire to go to reality abide in the knowledge of thatness in another way.

original: de kho na nyid ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Reality is the essence.

original: bsam pa 'di nyid kyis ni rigs pa'i stobs las mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig yin kyang /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di nyid kyis ni rigs pa'i stobs las mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig yin kyang /
translated: By this very intention, the power of reasoning is the one moment of realization.

original: mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma bcu drug tu gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma bcu drug tu gsungs so //
translated: The path of seeing is taught to be the sixteen moments of realization.

original: de dag gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag gsungs pa /
translated: They are taught:

original: gang gi tshe cha shas med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dag nyid thams cad kyis mngon du rtogs kyang nges pa skye ba la ltos pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyis mngon du rtogs pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid mngon du byed pa ches
analyzed: gang gi tshe cha shas med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dag nyid thams cad kyis mngon du rtogs kyang nges pa skye ba la ltos pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyis mngon du rtogs pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid mngon du byed pa ches
translated: When, although the realm of phenomena is realized by all because of being partless, the knowledge that is dependent on the arising of certainty is the realization by the meaning of going everywhere, then the knowledge that makes manifest the lack of inherent existence of all phenomena

original: gsal ba'i shes pa skye bar byed pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam brnyes pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i shes pa skye bar byed pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam brnyes pa'o zhes so //
translated: arises very clearly. At that time, the bodhisattva has attained the path of seeing.

original: de nyid kyis na brjod par bya ste /🔽gang rab tu dga' ba'i sa dang po gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod nas skye ba med pas mngon du rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin dang zung du 'jug pa brjod pa med pa sdug bsngal la chos
analyzed: de nyid kyis na brjod par bya ste / gang rab tu dga' ba'i sa dang po gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod nas skye ba med pas mngon du rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin dang zung du 'jug pa brjod pa med pa sdug bsngal la chos
translated: Therefore, it is to be expressed.

original: shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig nyid ni mthong ba'i lam mo /
analyzed: shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig nyid ni mthong ba'i lam mo /
translated: The first stage of the Joyful One is the instant of the forbearance of the doctrine of nonproduction with respect to forms and so on, which is the essence of the wisdom and meditative stabilization that are the union of the two, which is inexpressible, which is the forbearance of the doctrine of nonproduction with respect to forms and so on, which is the path of seeing.

original: @282b sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes so //🔽thog ma med pa ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor ba brgyud pa rnams su ma mthong ba de kho na nyid ni gtso bo yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
