analyzed: @282b sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo zhes so // thog ma med pa ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor ba brgyud pa rnams su ma mthong ba de kho na nyid ni gtso bo yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: The forbearance of the doctrine with respect to suffering and so on is the path of meditation.🔽In order to teach that the nonseeing of reality in the continua of cyclic existence that have been transmigrating since beginningless time together with ignorance is the principal cause,

original: de dag mngon du rtogs pa mngon par rtogs pa skyed par byed pa skad cig ma mngon par rtogs par bya bas mngon par rtogs pa mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de dag mngon du rtogs pa mngon par rtogs pa skyed par byed pa skad cig ma mngon par rtogs par bya bas mngon par rtogs pa mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: the instant of the generation of the realization of the seeing of that nonseeing is the path of seeing.

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan mas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i phyin ci log rab tu skye nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba nas 'byin pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa skad cig ma bco lnga la yang mthong ba'i lam zhes tha snyad byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan mas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i phyin ci log rab tu skye nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba nas 'byin pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa skad cig ma bco lnga la yang mthong ba'i lam zhes tha snyad byas pa nyid do //
translated: The path of seeing is also called the fifteen moments of transcendent wisdom, such as the knowledge of the dharma of suffering and so on, which are the fifteen moments of transcendent wisdom that arise from the root of affliction and eliminate the error of superimposition by the sign of delusion.

original: bsgom pa'i lam du bshad pas yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa de rnams ni brtags pa pa'i mthong lam nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam du bshad pas yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa de rnams ni brtags pa pa'i mthong lam nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is explained as the path of meditation, it is said that those such as the knowledge of the dharma of suffering are the path of seeing of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: gang gi tshe de lta ma yin na shing rta chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po la mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug go zhes mang du bshad pa dang ci ltar mi 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta ma yin na shing rta chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po la mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug go zhes mang du bshad pa dang ci ltar mi 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: If that were not so, how could it not contradict the many explanations of the Mahāyāna by the great charioteers that the path of seeing has sixteen moments?

original: yang gang ma tshang ba med pa'i rgyu spang bar mi nus pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya spong ba'i dus su kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: yang gang ma tshang ba med pa'i rgyu spang bar mi nus pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya spong ba'i dus su kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: Also, since it is impossible to abandon the incomplete causes, when the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing of suffering are abandoned, the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing of origin are abandoned.

original: de nyid kyis na 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: Therefore, he realizes cessation.

original: gzhan du na de'i 'gog pa mngon du byed pa mi 'thad pas lam bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i 'gog pa mngon du byed pa mi 'thad pas lam bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable that he realizes the cessation of that, so he cultivates the path.🔽The same is true of the origin and so on.

original: kun 'byung la sogs pa la de bzhin no zhes 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pas theg pa chen po la mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig yin par blta'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung la sogs pa la de bzhin no zhes 'bras bu mngon par rtogs pas theg pa chen po la mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa skad cig ma gcig yin par blta'o //
translated: Thus, through realizing the result, the path of seeing of the Mahayana is viewed as a single moment.

original: yang bden pa so so'i phyin ci log sel bas mngon du byed pa mngon par rtogs pas skad cig ma bcu drug gis mngon par rtogs par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: yang bden pa so so'i phyin ci log sel bas mngon du byed pa mngon par rtogs pas skad cig ma bcu drug gis mngon par rtogs par byed pa'o ;
translated: Again, since the path of seeing of the Mahayana is a single moment, it is the realization of the sixteen moments through the realization of the elimination of the error of each truth.

original: / des na ched du zhugs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa legs par gnas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / des na ched du zhugs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa legs par gnas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the presentation of the one who has entered the path and so on is well established.

original: de'i 'dod pas skad cig ma bcu drug thams cad kyang dngos kyi mthong lam mo zhes gsal lo //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas skad cig ma bcu drug thams cad kyang dngos kyi mthong lam mo zhes gsal lo //
translated: Thus it is clear that all sixteen moments are the actual path of seeing.

original: de ni de bzhin du bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid mthong bas mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin du bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid mthong bas mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
translated: The path of insight is the stage of the Joyous, because it is the first insight into the reality of the four noble truths.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dbye ba dang bcas pa yang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dbye ba dang bcas pa yang /
translated: The generation of the resolve is twenty-two fold, together with its divisions.

original: tha snyad pa'i dus kyi khyad par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes bya dang shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i dus kyi khyad par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes bya dang shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the conventional is the characteristic of the completion of action, and the ultimate is the characteristic of the completion of the knower and the known, up to the end of time.

original: mi khom pa brgyad kyi skad cig ci lta'o //🔽yang dus kyi mthar thug @283a * //
analyzed: mi khom pa brgyad kyi skad cig ci lta'o // yang dus kyi mthar thug @283a * //
translated: What is the moment of the eight inopportune states?

original: pa'i dus chung ngu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i dus chung ngu ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the end of time is not a short time.

original: de ni shin tu phra bas tha snyad bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shin tu phra bas tha snyad bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is extremely subtle, it is not a conventional.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa gang gis yongs su sbyong bar gyur pa'i chos gang dang gang ci srid du yongs su ma tshang ba de srid du sa de'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa gang gis yongs su sbyong bar gyur pa'i chos gang dang gang ci srid du yongs su ma tshang ba de srid du sa de'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever dharma is purified by whatever stage, to the extent that it is incomplete, that is that stage.

original: sa de yongs su rdzogs nas sa gzhan du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sa de yongs su rdzogs nas sa gzhan du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: When that stage is completed, it should be established as another stage.

original: de dang lhan cig spyod pa nges pa'i shes pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig spyod pa nges pa'i shes pa brgyad de /
translated: There are eight definite knowledges that accompany those.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spangs pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa brgyad ni bzod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spangs pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa brgyad ni bzod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The eight knowledges of suffering, etc., which have the nature of the uninterrupted path, are called “acceptance” because they abandon the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam yang nyon mongs pa bral ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa brgyad ni chos dang rjes su shes pa'o //🔽de la chos shes pa'i bzod pas rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa bzhi zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam yang nyon mongs pa bral ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa brgyad ni chos dang rjes su shes pa'o // de la chos shes pa'i bzod pas rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa bzhi zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The eight knowledges that manifest the separation from the afflictions are the path of liberation and are knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.🔽The four knowledges of the doctrine that are definite knowledge of realization through the acceptance of the knowledge of the doctrine should be posited as the four knowledges of the doctrine.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa ni yang rjes su shes pa zhes so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa ni yang rjes su shes pa zhes so //
translated: The four subsequent knowledges that are definite knowledge of realization through the acceptance of subsequent knowledge should be posited as the four subsequent knowledges.

original: 'dir gdams ngag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gdams ngag ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the instruction:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzod nas skye ba med pa mngon du rtogs pas sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal mtshan nyid dag mi dmigs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzod nas skye ba med pa mngon du rtogs pas sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal mtshan nyid dag mi dmigs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The moment of acceptance of the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering is called acceptance of the nonarising of factors, because it realizes that forms and so on are primordially unarisen and does not observe suffering and the characteristics of suffering.

original: de 'di shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'jug pa mngon par brjod pa med pa skad cig go //
analyzed: de 'di shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'jug pa mngon par brjod pa med pa skad cig go //
translated: This is the moment of the union of wisdom and samadhi, the inexpressible.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'di'i rjes la thob pa rang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i shes rab shar ba gang gis chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis mngon par brjod pa de ni
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'di'i rjes la thob pa rang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i shes rab shar ba gang gis chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis mngon par brjod pa de ni
translated: After this supramundane gnosis, the postmeditation wisdom that ascertains one's realization arises, and by it all phenomena are seen as emptiness, as having the nature of emptiness, in a way that is pure of the two kinds of obscurations.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering.

original: de gzugs la sogs pa 'di rnams stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes rab tu shes nas /
analyzed: de gzugs la sogs pa 'di rnams stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes rab tu shes nas /
translated: Having understood that these forms and so on are the pure nature of the characteristic of emptiness, which is not to be expressed by entities or non-entities,

original: yang mngon par brjod pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab shar ba de ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: yang mngon par brjod pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab shar ba de ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the arising of that supramundane wisdom free from verbal expression is the acceptance of subsequent understanding.

original: de'i tshe 'ang khams gsum pa'i chos thams cad brjod bya ma yin pa nyid du mngon du rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'ang khams gsum pa'i chos thams cad brjod bya ma yin pa nyid du mngon du rtogs te /
translated: At that time, all phenomena of the three realms are realized as not being objects of expression,

original: skad cig gnyis pas shes rab phul du phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pas shes rab phul du phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the second moment, wisdom is perfected.

original: sngon ma 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal shin tu che ba dang / shes rab mchog tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir khams su rtogs pa'i chos rnams nyid bdag med par mngon du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ma 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal shin tu che ba dang / shes rab mchog tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir khams su rtogs pa'i chos rnams nyid bdag med par mngon du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Previously, due to the great suffering of the desire realm and the absence of supreme wisdom, the phenomena realized in the realms were not realized as selfless.

original: des na de dang @283b don mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyu dang de'i rgyu can nyid kyis kyang shes pa de don du gnyer ba nyid kyis de'i rjes su 'gro bas bzod pa yin pas rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na de dang @283b don mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyu dang de'i rgyu can nyid kyis kyang shes pa de don du gnyer ba nyid kyis de'i rjes su 'gro bas bzod pa yin pas rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because it is the cause of that and because it is the cause of that, and because it is the forbearance that follows from the desire for that knowledge, it is called the forbearance of subsequent knowledge.

original: des na de bzhin du chos thams cad mngon par brjod bya ma yin pa smra bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid de kho na mngon par brjod pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni rjes su shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na de bzhin du chos thams cad mngon par brjod bya ma yin pa smra bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid de kho na mngon par brjod pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni rjes su shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the arising of the wisdom that expresses that inexpressibility, that unspeakable nature of all phenomena, is called subsequent knowledge.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung 'gog pa lam rnams la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung 'gog pa lam rnams la rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the truths of origin, cessation, and path.

original: de la bzod pa brgyad rnams ni rkun po phyi rol du 'byin pa'i rigs pas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa brgyad rnams ni rkun po phyi rol du 'byin pa'i rigs pas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, the eight forbearances are associated with the activity of abandoning the afflictions through the method of expelling thieves from a house.

original: shes pa brgyad rnams ni sgo glegs 'gebs pa'i rigs pas bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad rnams ni sgo glegs 'gebs pa'i rigs pas bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The eight knowledges are associated with the activity of blocking the door through the method of blocking the door.

original: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /
translated: In the four acceptances of the knowledge of phenomena, the desire realm's desire, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, the view of the transitory collection, the view grasping extremes, wrong view,

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the view holding a view as paramount, and the view holding ethics and modes of conduct as paramount dissolve.

original: so sor bcu bcu zhes nyon mongs pa bzhi bcu thim pa rab tu spong ba'o //
analyzed: so sor bcu bcu zhes nyon mongs pa bzhi bcu thim pa rab tu spong ba'o //
translated: The ten each are the dissolution of the forty afflictions.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi la /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi la /
translated: In the four acceptances of subsequent knowledge,

original: de nyid la khong khro ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de nyid la khong khro ma gtogs pa /
translated: except for anger,

original: gzugs khams kyi dgu ste /
analyzed: gzugs khams kyi dgu ste /
translated: the nine of the form realm dissolve.

original: so sor dgu dgu ni dgu tshan bzhi'o //
analyzed: so sor dgu dgu ni dgu tshan bzhi'o //
translated: The nine each are the four sets of nine.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dgu tshan bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dgu tshan bzhi ste /
translated: Similarly, the four sets of nine of the formless realm dissolve.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis rab tu spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis rab tu spong ba'o //
translated: This is the dissolution of the seventy-two afflictions.

original: des na nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis ni mthong ba'i lam gyi spang bya'o //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis ni mthong ba'i lam gyi spang bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one hundred and twelve afflictions are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'dis ni sems bskyed skad cig bcu drug 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems bskyed skad cig bcu drug 'di ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes so //
translated: This is the clear realization of the truths in sixteen moments of the generation of the will.

original: de skad cig ma bco lnga rnams la byang chub sems dpa' brgyad pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de skad cig ma bco lnga rnams la byang chub sems dpa' brgyad pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: In the fifteen moments, the bodhisattva is a stream-enterer, entered into the result of stream-enterer, and in two ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the two?

original: dang po ni dbang po rtul po dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / dad pas de'i lam rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ni dbang po rtul po dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / dad pas de'i lam rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the one of dull faculties who follows faith, because he practices the path of faith.

original: gnyis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang po rnon po'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba lta bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang po rnon po'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba lta bas thob pa'o //
translated: The second is the one of sharp faculties who does not return, who follows the doctrine, and who has attained through views.

original: chos dang mthong ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: chos dang mthong ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: The doctrine and seeing are wisdom.

original: de dag gis de'i lam rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de'i lam rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he practices the path of that.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
translated: In the sixteenth moment, he is a stream-enterer who abides in the result of stream-enterer.

original: drug pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bco lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //🔽de la gang gi tshe yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag gi ngo bo gcig nyid yin @284a * //
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bco lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo // de la gang gi tshe yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag gi ngo bo gcig nyid yin @284a * //
translated: The sixteenth stage and so on, up to the fifteenth stage, are the supramundane path of cultivation.

original: pas phan tshun tha dad du brjod par mi nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: pas phan tshun tha dad du brjod par mi nus pa bzhin du /
translated: Therein, when the unconditioned and conditioned are of the same nature, they cannot be said to be mutually different.🔽Just as it is said, the path of vision is actualized, and the different things are not perceived as different.

original: ci ltar gsungs pas mthong ba'i lam mngon du byas pa'i dngos po tha dad ma yin par dmigs pas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi tha dad pa ma yin pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid can rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ci ltar gsungs pas mthong ba'i lam mngon du byas pa'i dngos po tha dad ma yin par dmigs pas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi tha dad pa ma yin pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid can rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because the paths of vision and cultivation are not different, the path of cultivation is established as having the characteristic of non-difference.

original: de bzhin du yin na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yin na yang /
translated: Although it is so,

original: bsgom pa'i lam de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid yin pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid yin pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: that path of cultivation is the antidote to the things to be eliminated by cultivation, and should be cultivated by the reality of dependent origination.

original: des mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba'i de kho na nyid rgyun gyis mkhyen pa ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: des mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba'i de kho na nyid rgyun gyis mkhyen pa ni sgom pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is the continuous knowledge of reality that is seen by the path of seeing.

original: de nyid lam mo //
analyzed: de nyid lam mo //
translated: That itself is the path.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: In that, innate attachment, anger, ignorance, and the innate afflicted view of the self and wrong view exist.

original: mngon pa kun las btus pa las mthar 'dzin pa lta ba gsum kyang mthar 'dzin pa lta ba ni log par lta ba'i khyad yin pas so //
analyzed: mngon pa kun las btus pa las mthar 'dzin pa lta ba gsum kyang mthar 'dzin pa lta ba ni log par lta ba'i khyad yin pas so //
translated: In the Compendium of Abhidharma, the three views that grasp the extremes are also said to be types of wrong view.

original: 'dir yang dngos po rnams dam pa yang dag pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyin ci log gi lta ba ni log par lta bar bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po rnams dam pa yang dag pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyin ci log gi lta ba ni log par lta bar bzung ste /
translated: Here, wrong view is considered to be the distorted view that superimposes the quality of being pure, excellent, and so on, onto things.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni ma yin no zhes de rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa drug go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni ma yin no zhes de rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa drug go //
translated: It is not the denial of cause and effect. These are the six afflictions that exist in the desire realm.

original: de nyid gzugs na spyod pa zhe sdang spangs pa'i lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzugs na spyod pa zhe sdang spangs pa'i lnga'o //
translated: The five that exist in the form realm are the same as those in the desire realm except for anger.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa lnga ste nyon mongs pa bcu drug ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rim gyis spong ngo //🔽bag la nyal yin gyi kun du rgyu ba nyams pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa lnga ste nyon mongs pa bcu drug ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rim gyis spong ngo // bag la nyal yin gyi kun du rgyu ba nyams pas ni ma yin te /
translated: The sixteen afflictions are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: sngon nyid du 'gribs pa nyid du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon nyid du 'gribs pa nyid du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are latent states, not manifest states, because they are already diminished.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa drug po de rnams chen po 'bring chung ngu'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa drug po de rnams chen po 'bring chung ngu'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The six afflictions of the desire realm, such as attachment, are divided into three types: great, medium, and small.

original: yang so sor chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsum ste rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: yang so sor chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsum ste rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Each of these is again divided into three types: great-great, etc., making nine types.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa lnga rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa lnga rnams /
translated: Similarly, the five afflictions such as attachment

original: gzhan gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa la so sor dgu dgu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa la so sor dgu dgu'o //
translated: are each divided into nine types in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa 'khor ba'i sa dgu la dgu dgu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa 'khor ba'i sa dgu la dgu dgu ste /
translated: Thus, there are nine afflictions for each of the nine levels of cyclic existence, such as the desire realm.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are eighty-one types of afflictions.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen po nyes pa skye bzhin pa nges par 'joms pas nyes pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen po nyes pa skye bzhin pa nges par 'joms pas nyes pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The antidote to those is the path of cultivation, which is the opposite of the aspects of the counteragent.🔽The path of cultivation is divided into eleven types, each of which is further divided into three degrees: weak, medium, and strong.

original: de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa las bzlog pas chung ngu 'bring chen po rnams yang chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad cu @284b rtsa gcig go //🔽de la dri ma med pa 'od byed pa /
analyzed: de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa las bzlog pas chung ngu 'bring chen po rnams yang chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad cu @284b rtsa gcig go // de la dri ma med pa 'od byed pa /
translated: The first four aspects of the path are the nature of the stages of stainlessness,🔽radiance,

original: 'od 'phro ba /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba /
translated: and difficult to purify.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.

original: sbyang dka' ba'i sa'i rang bzhin lam gyi rnam pa dang po bzhi rtogs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa nyid de rnam pa gnyis so //🔽'di lta ste /🔽gang thabs la mkhas pas mi rnams kyi nang du rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
analyzed: sbyang dka' ba'i sa'i rang bzhin lam gyi rnam pa dang po bzhi rtogs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa nyid de rnam pa gnyis so // 'di lta ste / gang thabs la mkhas pas mi rnams kyi nang du rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
translated: The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a chen po lta bu'am /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a chen po lta bu'am /
translated: The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.

original: khyim bdag rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bur skye ba de ni mi'i rigs nas rigs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bur skye ba de ni mi'i rigs nas rigs so //
translated: The first two of these are the stage of the stream-enterer.🔽The

original: 'dod pa ni  spyod pa'i lha drug gi nang du skye ba de ni lha'i rigs nas rigs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni  spyod pa'i lha drug gi nang du skye ba de ni lha'i rigs nas rigs so //
translated: The one who is born among the six gods of the realm of desire is of the family of gods.

original: rnam pa lnga la mngon du gyur pa'i sa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga la mngon du gyur pa'i sa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who has realized the stage of the manifest, which is of the nature of the five members, is the candidate for the fruit of the once-returner.

original: drug pa la ring du song ba'i sa'i rang bzhin la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa la ring du song ba'i sa'i rang bzhin la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The one who has realized the stage of the far-reaching, which is of the nature of the sixth member, is the once-returner.

original: de nyid ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: This one is the one-intervaller.

original: rnam pa bdun pa la mi g-yo ba'i sa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa la dang / brgyad pa la legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa'i ngo bo rtogs pa la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun pa la mi g-yo ba'i sa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa la dang / brgyad pa la legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa'i ngo bo rtogs pa la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who has realized the stage of immovable, which is of the nature of the seventh member, and the one who has realized the stage of excellent-intellect, which is of the nature of the eighth member, are the candidates for the fruit of the non-returner.

original: gnyen po rnam pa dgu pa la chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa la phyir mi 'ong ba'o //🔽de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa dgu pa la chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa la phyir mi 'ong ba'o // de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The one who has realized the stage of the cloud of the teaching, which is of the nature of the ninth member, is the non-returner.🔽This one is also of five kinds.

original: gang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshangs ris nas brtsams te ci srid du 'og min zhes pa'i bar skabs su lha'i ris gang yang rung bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: tshangs ris nas brtsams te ci srid du 'og min zhes pa'i bar skabs su lha'i ris gang yang rung bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: From the Brahma world up to Akaniṣṭha, he manifests complete enlightenment in any of the celestial realms.

original: 'dir mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pa ston pa de ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par byang chub pa la sogs pa ston pa de ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Here, the teaching of manifest enlightenment, etc., is the parinirvāṇa without remainder.

original: gang byang chub shing drung du skyil krung bcas te /
analyzed: gang byang chub shing drung du skyil krung bcas te /
translated: He sits cross-legged at the foot of the enlightenment tree.

original: gang dang po sems bskyed pa de ni 'dir skyes nas so //
analyzed: gang dang po sems bskyed pa de ni 'dir skyes nas so //
translated: The first generation of the thought of enlightenment is here the birth.

original: bskyed pa des skyes pa nyid du lhag ma nyid du lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa des skyes pa nyid du lhag ma nyid du lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The parinirvāṇa with remainder is the remainder. The parinirvāṇa without remainder is the parinirvāṇa after birth.

original: gsum pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: gsum pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: The third is the parinirvāṇa with exertion.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: It is said with reference to this:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing 'jig rten gyi khams su yang dag par 'gro ba /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing 'jig rten gyi khams su yang dag par 'gro ba /
translated: Śāriputra, those bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections and go to the world systems

original: de ni sems can rnams kyi don du bya ba la rtag tu rtsol ba dang ldan pa ci srid du bskal pa grangs med pa dpag tu med pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams kyi don du bya ba la rtag tu rtsol ba dang ldan pa ci srid du bskal pa grangs med pa dpag tu med pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par sangs rgya'o //
translated: are always striving for the sake of sentient beings. For as long as they are not fully enlightened in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment by means of incalculable, immeasurable eons,

original: de yang rtag tu sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la gnas pa dag yod do //
analyzed: de yang rtag tu sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la gnas pa dag yod do //
translated: they are always engaged in the activities for the sake of sentient beings.

original: dper na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang sgrol ma dang 'jam dpal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang sgrol ma dang 'jam dpal la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, there are Ārya Avalokiteśvara, Tārā, Mañjuśrī, and so on.
Here,

original: sems can gyi don la brtson pa dang ldan pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la brtson pa dang ldan pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: the one who is engaged in striving for the sake of sentient beings is the one who forms volitions.

original: bzhi pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
translated: The fourth, passing into nirvāṇa without formation,

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: is taught with reference to🔽.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang byang chub sems dpa' gang dang po byang nub tu sems bskyed pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'am nges pa bzhugs nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par🔽rdzogs par sangs rgya ba yod do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang byang chub sems dpa' gang dang po byang nub tu sems bskyed pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'am nges pa bzhugs nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya ba yod do //
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who, by merely generating the thought of awakening for the first time, abide as bodhisattvas in other buddhafields until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.🔽And that is known as the path of preparation.

original: de yang mngon par sbyor ba'i lam zhes shes nas rigs kyi khyad par las ches myur bar 'bad pa chung ngu nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mngon par sbyor ba'i lam zhes shes nas rigs kyi khyad par las ches myur bar 'bad pa chung ngu nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Those who fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood with little effort due to the excellence of their lineage, without application, are those who attain nirvāṇa without application.

original: lnga pa ni gong du 'pho ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gong du 'pho ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The fifth is the one who goes upstream, who is of two types.

original: 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa'o //

analyzed: de la gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub par byed cing ji srid du dge ba bcu la rab tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub par byed cing ji srid du dge ba bcu la rab tu bzhag ste /
translated: As long as they have established them in the ten virtues,

analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha nas ci srid du 'og min gyi lha'i bar du skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyab yod do //

original: 'og min gyi mthar thug pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'og min gyi mthar thug pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'pho ba'o //
translated: the leapers, the half-leapers, and those who pass through all the abodes.

original: de la gang bsam gtan gsum las /
analyzed: de la gang bsam gtan gsum las /
translated: Among them, those who fall from the three meditative absorptions

analyzed: sngon goms pa'i dbang las bsam gtan bzhi pa skyed de /
translated: By the power of previous habituation, he generates the fourth meditation and,🔽after passing away from there, he is born in Akaniṣṭha.

original: de las 'phos te 'og min du skye ba de ni dbus su ma zhugs pas 'phar ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de las 'phos te 'og min du skye ba de ni dbus su ma zhugs pas 'phar ba zhes brjod do //

original: gang tshangs ris las 'phos te /
analyzed: gang tshangs ris las 'phos te /
translated: One who passes beyond the Abode of Brahma

original: gnas gtsang mar skyes nas bar gyi gnas gzhan las gcig kyang rnam par rgal te ;
analyzed: gnas gtsang mar skyes nas bar gyi gnas gzhan las gcig kyang rnam par rgal te ;
translated: and is born in the Pure Abodes, passing over one intermediate state,

original: 'og min du 'jug pa de ni phyed du 'phar ba'o //
analyzed: 'og min du 'jug pa de ni phyed du 'phar ba'o //
translated: and enters Akaniṣṭha is one who leaps over half.

analyzed: gang gnas gzhan thams cad du kun du brgyus nas 'og min du 'jug pa de ni gnas thams cad du 'pho ba'o //
translated: One who passes through all the intermediate states and enters Akaniṣṭha is one who passes through all the stages.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With reference to these, it is said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dga' ldan nas bzung ste tshangs ris nas ci srid du 'og min @285b du skyes nas thabs la mkhas pas dmyal ba pa dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston par byed
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dga' ldan nas bzung ste tshangs ris nas ci srid du 'og min @285b du skyes nas thabs la mkhas pas dmyal ba pa dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston par byed
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva who is born in Tuṣita, in the Abode of Brahmā, and up to Akaniṣṭha, teaches the Dharma to the sentient beings in the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama, by means of skillful means.

original: do // phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du yang dag par 'gro zhing /
analyzed: do // phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du yang dag par 'gro zhing /
translated: They go from buddhafield to buddhafield in the ten directions,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsnyen bkur te sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag rdzogs par byed do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsnyen bkur te sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag rdzogs par byed do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: serve the lord buddhas, and having brought sentient beings to maturity, they perfect the unsurpassed buddhafields.

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan gyi ro myangs pas gnas gtsang ma nyid du ni mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan gyi ro myangs pas gnas gtsang ma nyid du ni mi 'jug cing /
translated: Those who enter other absorptions and experience their taste do not enter the pure abodes,

analyzed: gnas gzhan thams cad du skye zhing gzugs med du rim gyis skyes nas srid pa'i rtse mor song ste /
translated: but are born in all other abodes, and having been born in the formless realm in order, they go to the peak of existence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya ba yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya ba yod do //
translated: They attain manifest, complete buddhahood in various buddhafields.

original: yang gang gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba phyir mi 'ong ba de 'di nas 'phos te gzugs med par skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni gong du 'pho ba srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa rnam🔽pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang gang gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba phyir mi 'ong ba de 'di nas 'phos te gzugs med par skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de ni gong du 'pho ba srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, nonreturners free from attachment to the form realm who are reborn in the formless realm and attain manifest complete buddhahood in various buddha realms are those who relocate to higher levels.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are of two types:

original: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //

original: de la gang gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la gang gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in this life are explained in the sutra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang skyes bu chen pa'i mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i sku ci srid du tshe dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po stong phrag brgya stong du ma yongs su blangs te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang skyes bu chen pa'i mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i sku ci srid du tshe dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po stong phrag brgya stong du ma yongs su blangs te /
translated: Sariputra, bodhisattvas who possess the body adorned with the thirty two marks of a great being and immeasurable lifespan take rebirth as a universal emperor many hundreds of thousands of times.

original: de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byas nas phyis 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya ba yod do zhes de ni mthong ba'i chos la yongs
analyzed: de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byas nas phyis 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya ba yod do zhes de ni mthong ba'i chos la yongs
translated: Having abided in that, they please many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, and later they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in this very world.

original: su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is the parinirvana of the present life.

analyzed: skye ba thams cad du bar chad med par mthong ba la sbyin pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are uninterrupted in seeing the Dharma of generosity, ethics, and so forth in all their lives, they fully awaken to perfect buddhahood.

original: gang phyir mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de lus kyis mngon du byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de lus kyis mngon du byed pa ste /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon du byed pas so //

original: lus kyis mngon du byed pa'ang /
analyzed: lus kyis mngon du byed pa'ang /

analyzed: pa'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa phyir mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de bzhin du /

original: gang gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /

analyzed: bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis rol cing /

analyzed: de dag bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /

analyzed: ci srid du thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis thong rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya ba dag yod do zhes so
translated: There are those who, by the power of skill in means, enter into meditative absorption in the meditative stabilization of skipping, and who fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood in various buddha-fields.

analyzed: // de ltar rigs nas rigs la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni /

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag gi gnas bdun la dgu dgu'o //

analyzed: gzhan pa bzhi bcu tham pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o /

translated: Through correct skill in means, he enters the lion's sport meditative absorption for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar / bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /

analyzed: de'i rjes su rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa dag la blta'o //
translated: After that, he views the forward and reverse sequences of dependent origination.

original: de'i rjes su bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin thong rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin thong rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: After that, he enters the alternating meditative attainment that has the nature of the path of cultivation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: He enters the first absorption.

original: de nas gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang / gzugs mod pa'i dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang 'gog pa la snyogs par 'jug pa 'di ni song ba gcig go //

translated: Then, he enters the second, third and fourth, and the first, second, third and fourth formless attainments, and then the attainment of cessation. This is one complete cycle.

original: de las bzhengs nas bsam gtan dang po la'o //
analyzed: de las bzhengs nas bsam gtan dang po la'o //
translated: Rising from that, he enters the first absorption.

original: de nas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa'o //

original: de nas bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: Then, he enters the second absorption.

original: de nas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa'o //

original: de nas bsam gtan gsum pa'o //

analyzed: brjod de / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun du rgyu ba la snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar btags pa ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is said that there is no contradiction in designating the skipping of meditative attainment as meditative attainment, because it is a movement of meditative attainment.

original: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam /
translated: The sixth generation of mind is the uninterrupted path of the stage of buddhahood, with seventy-one aspects.

original: skad cig gcig la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mngon par rdzogs pa bdun pa'o //🔽bar chad bya ru ni gegs bya bar nus pa ni bar chad do //

translated: The seventh is the complete clear realization in one instant.🔽The obstacle is that which can obstruct.

original: bar gzhan med pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: bar gzhan med pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
translated: The absence of another obstacle is the absence of obstacles.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam /🔽thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bos gcig tu zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la lan cig gis chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'i rnam par smin pa nyid kyis nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam / thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bos gcig tu zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la lan cig gis chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'i rnam par smin pa nyid kyis nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The path without obstacles.🔽The complete clear realization of all dharmas as the nature of the dharmadhatu is the complete clear realization of the uncontaminated dharma in one instant, because all dharmas are ascertained by that, because they are ascertained by the cultivation of the antidote, and because they are ascertained by the nature of nonexistence like a dream.

original: rmi lam bzhin du rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa gnyis rtsa bas zad pas gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bos nges par rtogs pas ldog pa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin du rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa gnyis rtsa bas zad pas gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bos nges par rtogs pas ldog pa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: And because the two obscurations are exhausted by the root, they are ascertained by the nature of nonduality. Thus, it has the nature of four reversals.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' zhing gi @287b tshogs dpag tu med pa rnam pa thams cad rdzogs par byas nas chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid skad cig gcig la mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par byed pa na /

translated: Here, the bodhisattva, having completed the immeasurable collection of fields in every way, causes the realization of the reality of all phenomena in a single moment.

original: dper na zo chun gyi rgyud mo skyes bus rkang stabs gcig gis bskyod pa na thams cad cig car du g-yo ba de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems ldan pa gcig kyang mngon du byas pa na zag pa med pa'i ye shes thams cad 'gugs par
analyzed: dper na zo chun gyi rgyud mo skyes bus rkang stabs gcig gis bskyod pa na thams cad cig car du g-yo ba de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems ldan pa gcig kyang mngon du byas pa na zag pa med pa'i ye shes thams cad 'gugs par
translated: For example, when a waterwheel is set in motion by a single step of a man, all [the buckets] move simultaneously. In the same way, when a single thought endowed with generosity, etc. is actualized, all uncontaminated wisdom is drawn forth

original: byed do // nges par byang chub par byed do //
analyzed: byed do // nges par byang chub par byed do //
translated: and definitely causes enlightenment.

original: sngon bsgom pa'i 'phen pa'i nus pa las so //
analyzed: sngon bsgom pa'i 'phen pa'i nus pa las so //
translated: [It is] from the power of the projection of prior cultivation.

original: 'dir ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the uninterrupted path, is the stage of the reality of ripening.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtsol ba med pas 'jug pa'i gnas skabs 'di'o zhes byas nas 'di la yang zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad de bzhin du cig car du mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtsol ba med pas 'jug pa'i gnas skabs 'di'o zhes byas nas 'di la yang zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad de bzhin du cig car du mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The reality of evolutionary maturity is the stage of engagement, since it is naturally effortless.  And here, all uncontaminated and contaminated phenomena are realized simultaneously in that way.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs de yang sa brgyad pa nas bzung ste 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs de yang sa brgyad pa nas bzung ste 'byung mod kyi /
translated: That stage of the reality of evolutionary maturity occurs from the eighth stage on,

original: 'dir ni khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa yin no //
translated: but here it is attained in a special way.

original: de ltar na sems bskyed pa drug gi rang bzhin khyad par gyi lam rtogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de ltar na sems bskyed pa drug gi rang bzhin khyad par gyi lam rtogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has attained the special path that has the six kinds of generating the thought of awakening for his own sake is said to be “engaged in the result of arhatship.”

original: / byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni smon lam gyis rang sangs rgyas sku can no //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni smon lam gyis rang sangs rgyas sku can no //
translated: This bodhisattva, by his vow, has the body of a solitary enlightened one.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: In what sense is he said to be engaged in the result of arhatship?

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas med cing nyan thos dang bral ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rang rgyal gyi byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas med cing nyan thos dang bral ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rang rgyal gyi byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who fully awaken to perfect buddhahood in a world system that is devoid of buddhas and devoid of śrāvakas, as pratyekabuddhas.

original: de thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par bya ste /
analyzed: de thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par bya ste /
translated: Through the power of their skill in means, they bring to maturity many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of beings through the three vehicles.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dag yod do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dag yod do //
translated: They fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid gcig pu gcig sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid gcig pu gcig sangs rgyas te /
translated: They are the only ones who are buddhas.

original: rang nyid ces pa rang byung ngo //
analyzed: rang nyid ces pa rang byung ngo //
translated: They are self-arisen.

original: sgra med par chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgra med par chos ston pa'o //
translated: They teach the Dharma without words.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of pratyekabuddhas:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rang sangs rgyas dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: They are similar to pratyekabuddhas.

original: gcig pu bdag dang gzhan mnyam par sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pu bdag dang gzhan mnyam par sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is alone, and because he illuminates the qualities of the Buddha by means of the equality of self and others.

original: gzhan ni rang sangs rgyas su sprul pa @288a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni rang sangs rgyas su sprul pa @288a * //
translated: The other is a Pratyekabuddha emanation.

original: yin pa yang byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: yin pa yang byed pa'i phyir ro // de de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
translated: He is also a creator.🔽Thus, there are seven persons: one who has entered for the result of Stream-enterer, the Stream-enterer, one who has entered for the result of Once-returner, the Once-returner, one who has entered for the result of Non-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / gang zag bdun no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / gang zag bdun no //
translated: the Non-returner, one who has entered for the result of Arhatship, and the Arhat.

original: rab tu dbye bas bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas bcu dgu'o //
translated: There are nineteen by way of classification.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang nyi shu'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nyi shu'o //
translated: There are twenty by adding the Pratyekabuddha.

original: slob pa rnams 'dus pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: slob pa rnams 'dus pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The Noble Sangha of Bodhisattvas who are irreversible is included in the learners.

original: lha dang bcas bdud dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sa dang dman pa'i byang chub kyi sgrub byed kyis dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi phyed cing mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang bcas bdud dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sa dang dman pa'i byang chub kyi sgrub byed kyis dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi phyed cing mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: The diamond-like thought is not divided from perfect enlightenment, not carried away by the world with its gods, men, and titans, by its teachings of virtue and of nonvirtue.

original: kha cig tu rdo rje lta bu'i sems ni mi slob pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig tu rdo rje lta bu'i sems ni mi slob pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In some places, the diamond-like thought is said to be the nonlearner’s thought.

original: mi slob pa rnam par grol ba sangs rgyas pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa rnam par grol ba sangs rgyas pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nonlearner’s thought is the path of no-more-learning, the path of liberation, the path of Buddhahood.

original: so so skye bo ni slob pa yin zhing mi slob pa yin te slob par brjod du med do //
analyzed: so so skye bo ni slob pa yin zhing mi slob pa yin te slob par brjod du med do //
translated: The thought of the ordinary man is the learner’s thought, not the nonlearner’s thought, and it is not to be called the learner’s thought.

original: 'o na ci 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar ba'i sems rnam par grol zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar ba'i sems rnam par grol zhe na /
translated: Is the thought liberated as past, or future, or present?

original: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa'i sems skye bzhin pa mi slob pa sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa'i sems skye bzhin pa mi slob pa sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
translated: The future thought, the thought in the process of arising, is the nonlearner’s thought liberated from obscurations.

original: 'o na lam gyi gnas skabs de las skyes pas sgrib pa spong ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lam gyi gnas skabs de las skyes pas sgrib pa spong ba ci zhe na /
translated: But if it is produced from the state of the path, what is the abandonment of obscurations?

original: smras pa / 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyi lta bu'o //
translated: He said, “It is like that which is in the process of ceasing.”

original: 'o na sa brgyad pa la phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na sa brgyad pa la phyir mi ldog pa nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: “Well then, why is it said that one is irreversible on the eighth stage?”

original: 'dir thams cad ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad ci ltar zhe na /
translated: “Why is it said that one is irreversible on all stages?”

original: smras pa / dbang po rnon po'i byang chub sems dpa' so so skye bo'i gnas skabs mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i tshu rol du yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin nges pas dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pas tshogs gnyis rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po rnon po'i byang chub sems dpa' so so skye bo'i gnas skabs mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i tshu rol du yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin nges pas dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pas tshogs gnyis rdzogs pa'i
translated: He said, “The bodhisattva of sharp faculties, even before the stage of action in faith, the stage of ordinary men, by cultivating calming and insight, by means of the perfection of wisdom and great compassion, completes the two collections.

original: phyir rgyun du mngon par sbyor ba'i dga' ba ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid do //🔽dbang po 'bring ni rab tu dga' ba la phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgyun du mngon par sbyor ba'i dga' ba ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid do // dbang po 'bring ni rab tu dga' ba la phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Because of the joy of constant application, he is irreversible.🔽The one of middling faculties is irreversible from the stage of joy.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams ni mi g-yo ba la phyir mi ldog pa'o ;
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams ni mi g-yo ba la phyir mi ldog pa'o ;
translated: The one of dull faculties is irreversible from the stage of immovability.

original: / ring du song ba la thams cad phyir mi ldog pa nyid do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: / ring du song ba la thams cad phyir mi ldog pa nyid do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that on the far-reaching stage, all are irreversible.”

original: ldog pa'i ched du skye ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i ched du skye ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: The birth for the sake of turning back is the turning back.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni de bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni de bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: The non-turning back is the non-such.

original: de yang / rtogs pa'i don byang chub mchog la sogs pa'i rang bzhin chos ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang / rtogs pa'i don byang chub mchog la sogs pa'i rang bzhin chos ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, the Dharma of the nature of the supreme enlightenment, etc., is fivefold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.🔽🔽

original: bsgrubs pa dang / bskyed @288b pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa dang / bskyed @288b pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the established, 2. the generated, 3. the imagined, 4. the inconceivable, and 5. the accomplished.

original: mdo sde rgyan las dpe lngas bstan par rig par bya'o //🔽de la kun du rdzogs pa'i theg pa chen po thos pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis log par rtog pa thams cad bsal nas skyabs dkon mchog gsum la brten te sgrib pa spong zhing mngon par shes pa la sogs pa khyad par
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las dpe lngas bstan par rig par bya'o // de la kun du rdzogs pa'i theg pa chen po thos pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis log par rtog pa thams cad bsal nas skyabs dkon mchog gsum la brten te sgrib pa spong zhing mngon par shes pa la sogs pa khyad par
translated: It should be understood that these are taught by the five examples in the Sutralamkara.

original: can gyi yon tan 'phags pa'i nor la longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyid du rig par byas nas /
analyzed: can gyi yon tan 'phags pa'i nor la longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyid du rig par byas nas /
translated: Therein, having eliminated all false notions by the process of generating the knowledge of the nature of hearing, etc., of the universal Great Vehicle, one should understand that the cause of the enjoyment of the special qualities of the noble wealth of the superknowledges, etc., is the reliance on the Three Jewels, the refuges, and the elimination of the obscurations.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sems rab tu bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sems rab tu bsgrubs pas /
translated: By means of the mental practice of aspiration and so on,

original: ci srid du mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bsgrubs pa sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo chos gser bzang po lta bu dga' ba dam pa skye bar byed do //
analyzed: ci srid du mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bsgrubs pa sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo chos gser bzang po lta bu dga' ba dam pa skye bar byed do //
translated: one generates the excellent joy of the nature of the Dharma, which is like good gold, that is generated by the practice on the stage of action in faith.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa khyad par du dben pas bskyed pa mngon du byed pas skyed pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo chos pad ma rgyas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa khyad par du dben pas bskyed pa mngon du byed pas skyed pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo chos pad ma rgyas pa lta bu'o //
translated: On the stage of the Joyful One, one manifests the generation of the nature of reality, which is like an opened lotus, by means of the vision that is generated by the special isolation of the passions that are to be abandoned by the path of vision, and by means of the purity of superior intention.

original: de nyid rtsol ba dang bcas pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i sa dri ma med pa la sogs pa drug tu bsam par byed pa na tshogs gnyis nus pa dang ldan pa ni legs par byas pa'i zas zos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtsol ba dang bcas pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i sa dri ma med pa la sogs pa drug tu bsam par byed pa na tshogs gnyis nus pa dang ldan pa ni legs par byas pa'i zas zos pa lta bu'o //
translated: When one is practicing on the six stages, beginning with the Stainless, which are the stages of the one who is stationed in the signless with effort, the two collections that are endowed with power are like the eating of well-prepared food.

original: rtsol ba med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa /
translated: The one who is stationed in the signless without effort,

original: sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa gsum la sngon gyi tshogs yongs su smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa gsum la sngon gyi tshogs yongs su smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: On the three grounds of Immovability and so forth, the accumulations of the past are fully ripened and inconceivable.

original: legs pa'i phrin yig rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: legs pa'i phrin yig rig pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a letter of good news.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: On the ground of Buddhahood, it is fully accomplished.

original: byang chub rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa nyid rin po che'i sgrom sgo phye ba lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa nyid rin po che'i sgrom sgo phye ba lta bu nyid de /
translated: The attainment of the nature of enlightenment, the knowledge of all things, the abandonment of all obscurations, is like the opening of a jewel chest.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ston par byed do //
translated: It is the teaching of Buddhahood itself.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtogs pa'i rnam pa mtha' med cing mtha' yas pa phyogs tsam yang brjod pa'i nus pa med pas gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtogs pa'i rnam pa mtha' med cing mtha' yas pa phyogs tsam yang brjod pa'i nus pa med pas gzhag go //
translated: Thus, since there is no ability to express even a fraction of the infinite and limitless aspects of the realizations of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, I will leave it at that.

original: cung zad brjod par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: cung zad brjod par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: I will say a little bit.

original: rtogs pa'i chos rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gcig pas rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gcig pas rnam pa gcig go //
translated: The Dharma of realization is of one kind, because it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //🔽rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so // rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three natures are also twofold, according to the mundane and supramundane distinctions, and according to the distinctions of cause and effect.🔽The three natures are also threefold:

original: de bzhin nyid kyi gnas skabs gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi gnas skabs gsum ste /
translated: the three states of reality,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: so so skye bo'i gnas skabs su de bzhin nyid ma dag pa'i gnas skabs te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can ming can no //🔽ma dag pa dang dag pa ste /
analyzed: so so skye bo'i gnas skabs su de bzhin nyid ma dag pa'i gnas skabs te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can ming can no // ma dag pa dang dag pa ste /
translated: In the state of ordinary beings, reality is in the state of impurity, having the essence of the Tathagata, but the name.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems @289a * //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems @289a * //
translated: In the state of the bodhisattva, it is both impure and pure,

original: dpa'i sa bcu la rab kyi rab la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa ci rigs par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpa'i sa bcu la rab kyi rab la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa ci rigs par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bodhisattva has not abandoned the aspects of the defilement-related and cognitive obscurations, and because he has abandoned some aspects of these two obscurations.

original: shin tu dag pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: In the state of the Buddha, it is extremely pure.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, the bodhisattva stages are twofold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: sa bdun rnams rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa nyid yin pas ma dag pa'o ;
analyzed: sa bdun rnams rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa nyid yin pas ma dag pa'o ;
translated: The first seven stages are impure, because they are only mental activity with effort.

original: / mi g-yo ba la ni sogs pa ni sa ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: / mi g-yo ba la ni sogs pa ni sa ma dag pa'o //
translated: The immovable and so on are the pure stages.

original: shin tu mchog tu dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mchog tu dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'o //
translated: The extremely pure stage is the stage of the Tathāgata.

original: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma la rtogs pa po'i sgo nas rnam pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma la rtogs pa po'i sgo nas rnam pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: In the Mahāyāna Ugraparipṛcchā Sūtra, four types of bodhisattvas are taught from the perspective of their realization.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rab tu dga' ba la dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has first generated the thought of awakening on the stage of the joyous one.

original: dri ma med pa la sogs pa drug la spyod pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa la sogs pa drug la spyod pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered into practice on the six stages beginning with the stainless one.

original: nye bar gos pa med pa'i spyad pa spyod pas so //
analyzed: nye bar gos pa med pa'i spyad pa spyod pas so //
translated: Because he practices the conduct that is unstained.

original: mi g-yo ba la phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is irreversible on the stage of the immovable one.

original: chos kyi sprin la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is impeded by only one birth on the stage of the cloud of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la skye ba tha ma gcig gis thogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la skye ba tha ma gcig gis thogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is impeded by only one birth on the stage of buddhahood.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde na re /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde na re /
translated: The ārya Vimuktisena says:

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la dang po theg pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la dang po theg pa la zhugs so //
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered the vehicle is on the stage of practice through devoted interest.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun pa spyod pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun pa spyod pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered into practice is on the seven stages beginning with the joyous one.

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa gsum la phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa gsum la phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is irreversible is on the three stages beginning with the immovable one.

original: sa bcu pa la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: On the tenth stage, he is a bodhisattva who is impeded by one birth.

original: mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ development of the mind of awakening is of four kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: On the stage of engagement through aspiration, it arises from interest.

original: sa bdun pa lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa las byung ba'o //
translated: On the seven pure stages, it arises from pure superior intention.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams la rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams la rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: On the eighth stage and so forth, it arises from maturation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: On the buddha stage, it is free from obscurations.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Entering Lanka says:

original: sa bdun rnams la sogs yin no //
analyzed: sa bdun rnams la sogs yin no //
translated: The seven stages and so forth are the domain of the mind of awakening.

original: snang ba med pa'ang sa brgyad 'dir //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'ang sa brgyad 'dir //
translated: The absence of appearances is on this eighth stage.
