original: sa gnyis la 'dir rnam par gnas //
analyzed: sa gnyis la 'dir rnam par gnas //
translated: The two stages are present here.

original: lhag ma sa ni nga yi dngos //
analyzed: lhag ma sa ni nga yi dngos //
translated: The remaining stages are my domain.

original: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang gzhung 'grel las rnam pa lngar bkral lo //
analyzed: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang gzhung 'grel las rnam pa lngar bkral lo //
translated: The master Vasubandhu also explains it in five ways in his commentary.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: On the first ground, the Joyous, the superior intention is pure.

original: sa drug la rtsol pa bcas pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa drug la rtsol pa bcas pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: On the six grounds, the bodhisattvas abide in the signless, but with effort.

original: brgyad pa la rtsol ba med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la rtsol ba med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: On the eighth ground, they abide in the signless without effort.

original: sa gnyis la nges pa'i spyod pa la rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis la nges pa'i spyod pa la rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: On the first two grounds, they engage in the conduct of certainty.

original: de'i steng du skye ba gcig gis thogs @289b pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i steng du skye ba gcig gis thogs @289b pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes so //
translated: On the remaining grounds, they are bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one birth.

original: de rnams la sogs pa mnyam pa med pa'i brtse ba'i rang bzhin gyi sku kun byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa sna tshogs gdul bya'i bsam ngo las rnam par gzhag pa mthar thug pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: de rnams la sogs pa mnyam pa med pa'i brtse ba'i rang bzhin gyi sku kun byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa sna tshogs gdul bya'i bsam ngo las rnam par gzhag pa mthar thug pa med mod kyi /
translated: The bodies of the buddhas, which are by nature incomparable love, are beyond all conceptual elaboration. They are the ultimate, for they are the object of the bodhisattvas’ desire. They are beyond all conceptualization, for they are defined in terms of the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: gdul bya'i bsam ngo las de rnams ni mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gdul bya'i bsam ngo las de rnams ni mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: They are not contradictory, for they are defined in terms of the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: 'bad pas don du gnyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bad pas don du gnyer bar bya'o //
translated: They are to be striven for with effort.

original: gal te yod med thams cad legs par gnas pas gzhag go //
analyzed: gal te yod med thams cad legs par gnas pas gzhag go //
translated: If they exist, they are to be posited as existing. If they do not exist, they are to be posited as not existing.

original: da ni skabs su bab pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni skabs su bab pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the occasion that has arrived should be stated.

original: de nas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi de ma thag tu rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu'i chung ngu rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'i gnyen po chen po'i chen po
analyzed: de nas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi de ma thag tu rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu'i chung ngu rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'i gnyen po chen po'i chen po
translated: Then, immediately after the uninterrupted path, the antidote to the seventy-two small of the small and so on of the sphere of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, which has the nature of the path of liberation,

original: rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: is the seventy-two great of the great.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the nature of complete purity through abandoning all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience.

original: nyer gcig pa dang nyer gnyis pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni mnyam bzhag dang rjes kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: nyer gcig pa dang nyer gnyis pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni mnyam bzhag dang rjes kyi rang bzhin /
translated: The twenty-first and twenty-second mental states are the natures of meditative equipoise and subsequent attainment.

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba'i ming bla dags gzhan kun du 'od do //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba'i ming bla dags gzhan kun du 'od do //
translated: The name Samantabhadra is another name for the stage of Universal Illumination.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang des 'bras bu'i gnas skabs chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang des 'bras bu'i gnas skabs chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The aspect of buddhahood is omniscience, and the realization of the fruition stage is the eighth.

original: chos ni lam ste mngon par rtogs pa bdun gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: chos ni lam ste mngon par rtogs pa bdun gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Dharma is the path, which is the nature of the seven realizations.

original: chos kyi thob bya las kyi ni chos sku'o zhes shes nas /
analyzed: chos kyi thob bya las kyi ni chos sku'o zhes shes nas /
translated: The result of obtaining the Dharma is the Dharma body.

original: 'di dag rtogs pa las bcom ldan 'das ni 'bras bu la gnas pa mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag rtogs pa las bcom ldan 'das ni 'bras bu la gnas pa mi slob pa ste /
translated: Knowing this, the Bhagavān is one who abides in the result, the nonlearner.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because he is the equality of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: chos kyi sku de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de ni rnam pa bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: That Dharma body is of four types:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang / mdzad pa'o ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang / mdzad pa'o ;
translated: The essence body, the enjoyment body, the emanation body, and its deeds.

original: / de sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ni gsum ste /
analyzed: / de sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ni gsum ste /
translated: The bodies of the buddhas are three:

original: bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo las gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo las gsungs te /
translated: It is said in the Great Bhagavatī:

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su rig par bya'o zhes ni chos kyi sku'o ;
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su rig par bya'o zhes ni chos kyi sku'o ;
translated: “That which is the nature of all uncontaminated phenomena, completely purified in every way, should be known as the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha.” This is the Dharma body.

original: / gzhan yang chos de rnams nyid rtogs pa las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa /
analyzed: / gzhan yang chos de rnams nyid rtogs pa las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa /
translated: Furthermore, the Dharma that is realized is the perfect enlightenment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku /🔽bla na @290a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku / bla na @290a * //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, whose body is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks,🔽is the supreme enjoyment for the sake of enjoying the unsurpassed supreme bliss.

original: med pa'i dga' ba mchog tu dga' ba bde ba nye bar longs spyod par bya ba'i ched du dam par gyur pa theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: med pa'i dga' ba mchog tu dga' ba bde ba nye bar longs spyod par bya ba'i ched du dam par gyur pa theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is the highest, is the Enjoyment Body.

original: gzhan yang chos de rnams nyid rtogs pa las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten
analyzed: gzhan yang chos de rnams nyid rtogs pa las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten
translated: Furthermore, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, who has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through realizing those very phenomena, is a buddha in the limitless, boundless worlds of the ten directions.🔽

original: gyi khams su thams cad du sprul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gyi khams su thams cad du sprul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: Furthermore, the dharmakāya is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, who has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment through the realization of those dharmas, and who acts for the welfare of all sentient beings through various kinds of emanations in all the limitless and boundless world systems in the ten directions.🔽This is the emanation body.

original: de la ngo bo ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo ni rang bzhin te /
translated: Here, the essence is the nature.

original: rang bzhin nyid ni ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature itself is the essence.

original: rang bzhin las byung ba rnam par dag pa'i mthar rab tu phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las byung ba rnam par dag pa'i mthar rab tu phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: The ultimate perfection of the pure nature is the essence body.

original: de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin mi skye ba /
analyzed: de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi rang bzhin mi skye ba /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the factors of enlightenment is non-arising,

original: ma byas pa 'dus ma byas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob par bya ba /
analyzed: ma byas pa 'dus ma byas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob par bya ba /
translated: unfabricated, unconditioned, and to be attained by the supramundane path.

original: sgro btags pa'i spros pa ma lus pa log pa rang bzhin med pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i spros pa ma lus pa log pa rang bzhin med pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: The absence of intrinsic reality, the cessation of all conceptual elaborations of superimposition, is the essential body.

original: ta phyi pa dang  bha ba'i rkyen bstan pa dag las /
analyzed: ta phyi pa dang  bha ba'i rkyen bstan pa dag las /
translated: In the teachings of the suffix ta and the conditional affix bha,

original: chos nyid kyi sku ni chos sku'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sku ni chos sku'o zhes brjod do //
translated: the dharmatākāya is called the dharmakāya.

original: 'di ru rnam par rtog pa thams cad nub pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ru rnam par rtog pa thams cad nub pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, the subsiding of all conceptualization is called nirvāṇa.

original: rgyal po la gdams pa rin po che phreng ba'i rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rgyal po la gdams pa rin po che phreng ba'i rnam 'grel las /
translated: In the commentary on the Precious Garland of Advice to the King,🔽it says:

original: chos nyid kyi sku ni chos sku'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sku ni chos sku'o //
translated: The dharmatākāya is the dharmakāya.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi lus nyid yin pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin las ma 'das pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi lus nyid yin pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin las ma 'das pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: Since it is the very body of all phenomena, it is the body of all beings, since the suchness of all beings does not go beyond its nature, and it is the body that is the basis of all mundane and supramundane qualities.

original: rten gyi ngo bo yang yon tan thams cad 'jug par blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rten gyi ngo bo yang yon tan thams cad 'jug par blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The nature of the basis should be seen as the basis of all qualities.

original: da ltar na rten chos rnams kyi chos nyid de kun rdzob kyis de las byung ba'am de'i bdag nyid las so //
analyzed: da ltar na rten chos rnams kyi chos nyid de kun rdzob kyis de las byung ba'am de'i bdag nyid las so //
translated: Now, the reality of those phenomena that are the basis is the relative, which arises from it or is of its nature.

original: de nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i sgras ngo bo nyid kyi sku brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i sgras ngo bo nyid kyi sku brjod pa'o //
translated: That itself is called the reality body, and the essential body is expressed by the reality body.

original: de yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyis so sor rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyis so sor rang rig pa'o //
translated: And that is the perfect enlightenment itself, which is individually intuited.

original: gang ston pa rang gi chos bstan pa las sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams zab pa rgya che ba'i chos bstan pa thos nas mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod dga' ba bde ba nyams su myong ba ni longs
analyzed: gang ston pa rang gi chos bstan pa las sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams zab pa rgya che ba'i chos bstan pa thos nas mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa theg pa chen po'i chos kyi longs spyod dga' ba bde ba nyams su myong ba ni longs
translated: The enjoyment of the Dharma is the enjoyment of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is supremely irreproachable, when the lords of the tenth stage hear the teachings of the profound and the magnificent Dharma from the Teacher.

original: spyod / yang dag par longs spyod pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod / yang dag par longs spyod pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the Dharma is the perfect enjoyment.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dag par 'tshogs nas longs spyod pa ni longs spyod @290b rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dag par 'tshogs nas longs spyod pa ni longs spyod @290b rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Or, the perfect enjoyment is the enjoyment of the Dharma by the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: longs spyod pa'i ched du nus pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i ched du nus pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body of enjoyment is the body that is capable of enjoying the Dharma.

original: yang na longs spyod par bya ba'i sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: yang na longs spyod par bya ba'i sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Or, the body of enjoyment is the body that is to be enjoyed by others.

original: yang na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ched du sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: yang na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ched du sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Or, the body of enjoyment is the body for the sake of enjoyment.

original: rang don phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan don byed pa mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: rang don phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan don byed pa mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'o //
translated: The body of personal enjoyment is the body that is endowed with the major and minor characteristics and that is the basis for the enjoyment of the Dharma for the bodhisattvas.

original: yang na zab cing rgya che ba'i chos bstan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su skyong bar byed pa'am /🔽yang dag par mnyes par gsol bar byed pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: yang na zab cing rgya che ba'i chos bstan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su skyong bar byed pa'am / yang dag par mnyes par gsol bar byed pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Or, the body of personal enjoyment is the body that protects the bodhisattvas by teaching the profound and the magnificent Dharma.🔽Or, the body of personal enjoyment is the body that delights the bodhisattvas by teaching the Dharma.

original: yang na 'dir chos de dag bstan pa las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de'i brjod bya dag nyams su myong ba las kun du spyod pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dir chos de dag bstan pa las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de'i brjod bya dag nyams su myong ba las kun du spyod pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Or, the body of personal enjoyment is the body that is the basis for the enjoyment of the Dharma by the bodhisattvas who experience the content of that teaching.🔽The body of universal enjoyment is the body that is the basis for the enjoyment of the Dharma by all bodhisattvas who have entered the stages.

original: sprul pa ni sprul pa nyid des grub pa'i sku ste sprul pa'i sku'o //🔽de yang / thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe 'khor ba ci srid du nam mkha' ci srid du dus ci lta ba bzhin du bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mtho ba ma lus pa nges par legs pa ma lus pa yang dag par sgrub pa ni sprul
analyzed: sprul pa ni sprul pa nyid des grub pa'i sku ste sprul pa'i sku'o // de yang / thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe 'khor ba ci srid du nam mkha' ci srid du dus ci lta ba bzhin du bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mtho ba ma lus pa nges par legs pa ma lus pa yang dag par sgrub pa ni sprul
translated: The emanation body is the body established by that very emanation.🔽Moreover,

original: pa'i las dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: pa'i las dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: as long as cyclic existence lasts, as long as space remains, for that long, in whatever way is suitable, in whatever way is desired, the complete establishment of the highest mundane success and the complete establishment of the highest spiritual success is the activity of emanation and the emanation body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes so //
translated: The essence of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni and so on is the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: Similarly,

original: dge bsnyen chen po zla ba'i zhal nas /
analyzed: dge bsnyen chen po zla ba'i zhal nas /
translated: the great upāsaka Candraprabha Kumāra says:

original: chos kyi sku'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: From the perspective of the dharma body, it is said:

original: 'di yi chos sku de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'di yi chos sku de bzhin nyid //
translated: The suchness of this dharma body

original: rnam rtog rnams kyi spyod yul min //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnams kyi spyod yul min //
translated: is not the domain of conceptual thought.

original: sems can rnams dang don rnams kyi //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang don rnams kyi //
translated: The nature of sentient beings and of objects

original: rang bzhin de dag gnyis su med //
analyzed: rang bzhin de dag gnyis su med //
translated: is nondual.

original: sna tshogs ngo bo'i sku rnams dang // 'gro rnams de nyid ngo bo rnams //
analyzed: sna tshogs ngo bo'i sku rnams dang // 'gro rnams de nyid ngo bo rnams //
translated: and the beings who are of that essence

original: gang du ro gcig 'gro 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du ro gcig 'gro 'gyur ba //
translated: become of one taste.

original: rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu bo bzhin //
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu bo bzhin //
translated: Like rivers flowing into the ocean,

original: rnam pa 'di 'dra'i sku de ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di 'dra'i sku de ni //
translated: that body of such a kind

original: skyob pa rnams kyi chos sku ste //
analyzed: skyob pa rnams kyi chos sku ste //
translated: is the Dharma body of the protectors.

original: rnam pa thams cad rnam dag pa //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rnam dag pa //
translated: It is completely pure in every way

original: rdzogs byang chub kyi spyod yul nyid //
analyzed: rdzogs byang chub kyi spyod yul nyid //
translated: and the domain of perfect enlightenment.

original: de yis nus pa rang dang gos //
analyzed: de yis nus pa rang dang gos //
translated: Its power, like the sun,

original: dus rnams kun du 'jig rten du //
analyzed: dus rnams kun du 'jig rten du //
translated: is always in the world,

original: mtha' yas don rnams byed pa ni //
analyzed: mtha' yas don rnams byed pa ni //
translated: accomplishing infinite benefits

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
translated: with its light rays.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni //
translated: The sambhogakāya is as follows:

original: dmus long lta bus bdag spangs nas //
analyzed: dmus long lta bus bdag spangs nas //
translated: Those who are blind from birth, having abandoned the self,

original: rang nyid bsod nams bsags can gyis //
analyzed: rang nyid bsod nams bsags can gyis //
translated: those who have accumulated merit

original: don gcig pu cig car du //
analyzed: don gcig pu cig car du //
translated: see the one purpose simultaneously,

original: nyi ma lta bur kun gyis mthong //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bur kun gyis mthong //
translated: like the sun.

original: 'on pa lta bu bdag spangs nas //🔽bsod nams nor bsags snyan rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'on pa lta bu bdag spangs nas // bsod nams nor bsags snyan rnams kyis //
translated: Those who are deaf, having abandoned the self,🔽those who have accumulated the wealth of merit

original: dam chos bdud rtsi'i bcud len ni //
analyzed: dam chos bdud rtsi'i bcud len ni //
translated: drink the nectar of the holy Dharma🔽like the sweet sound of a lute.

original: de la de @291a * //
analyzed: de la de @291a * //
translated: It is said:

original: ring yang ldan nyid //
analyzed: ring yang ldan nyid //
translated: It is connected with that for a long time.

original: ces so // sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas pa ni //
analyzed: ces so // sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas pa ni //
translated: From the perspective of the emanation body, it is said:

original: mtha' yas phyogs su mtha' med pa'i //🔽sems can theg pa gsum gyis 'dir //
analyzed: mtha' yas phyogs su mtha' med pa'i // sems can theg pa gsum gyis 'dir //
translated: In infinite directions,🔽Sentient beings are purified again and again

original: yang dang yang du rnam dag byed //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam dag byed //
translated: In the three vehicles here.

original: sa bon ci bzhin bsam ci bzhin //
analyzed: sa bon ci bzhin bsam ci bzhin //
translated: Like seeds and like thoughts.

original: zhes so // des na sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ni gsum nyid do //🔽byang chub phyogs la sogs pa chos kyi phung po ni ngo bo nyid kyi skus yongs su bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // des na sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ni gsum nyid do // byang chub phyogs la sogs pa chos kyi phung po ni ngo bo nyid kyi skus yongs su bsdus pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodies of the buddhas are just three.

original: chos dang chos nyid dag dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid dag dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates of Dharma such as the factors of awakening are subsumed by the essential body because there is no distinction between the Dharma and dharmatā.

original: kun rdzob tu de rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //🔽gzhan dag du chos kyi phung po 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bsdus so zhes pa'ang rung ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o // gzhan dag du chos kyi phung po 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bsdus so zhes pa'ang rung ngo //
translated: Conventionally, their characteristics are different.🔽In other sources, it is suitable to say that this aggregate of Dharma is subsumed by the enjoyment body.

original: kha cig na re byang chub phyogs la sogs pa'i chos kyi phung po ni sku bzhi pa'o zhes nges par 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re byang chub phyogs la sogs pa'i chos kyi phung po ni sku bzhi pa'o zhes nges par 'chad do //
translated: Some explain that the aggregate of Dharma such as the factors of awakening is the fourth body.

original: 'di ni bsam par bya'o //🔽sku gsum po 'di ni rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam par bya'o // sku gsum po 'di ni rtag pa nyid de /
translated: This is to be considered.🔽These three bodies of the Buddha are eternal.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
translated: The essential body is eternal because of its intrinsic eternity,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pas so //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pas so //
translated: because it has no beginning or end.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni nyams pa med pas rtag pa ste ;
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni nyams pa med pas rtag pa ste ;
translated: The beatific body is eternal because it is not subject to degeneration,

original: dang po ldan yang tha ma med pas so //
analyzed: dang po ldan yang tha ma med pas so //
translated: because it is endowed with the beginning but not with the end.

original: de bzhin du byang chub phyogs kyi chos kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub phyogs kyi chos kyang ngo //
translated: The same is true of the factors of enlightenment.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
translated: The emanation body is eternal because its continuity is eternal,

original: mi snang zhing nub kyang yang dang yang du bar med pas yul gyi dbye bas rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang zhing nub kyang yang dang yang du bar med pas yul gyi dbye bas rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it functions uninterruptedly in all world-realms, even though it disappears and reappears.

original: de bzhin du phrin las kyang rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phrin las kyang rtag pa'o //
translated: The same is true of its activity.

original: des na chos kyi sku ni bcom ldan 'das kyi don dam pa pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: des na chos kyi sku ni bcom ldan 'das kyi don dam pa pa'i sku ste /
translated: Thus, the Dharma body is the ultimate body of the Lord,

original: gang yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa rab tu grub pa'o //
translated: which is the pure, perfected suchness.

original: kha cig tu de bzhin nyid ces pa dang chos nyid ces pa ni spyi'i tshig go //
analyzed: kha cig tu de bzhin nyid ces pa dang chos nyid ces pa ni spyi'i tshig go //
translated: In some places, suchness and reality are general terms.

original: yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i de bzhin nyid dag don dam par na dbye ba med do zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i de bzhin nyid dag don dam par na dbye ba med do zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The thoroughly pure and the thoroughly impure suchnesses are undifferentiated in the ultimate.

original: gang yang chos kyi sku la rag las pa sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos byang chub phyogs la sogs pa /
analyzed: gang yang chos kyi sku la rag las pa sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos byang chub phyogs la sogs pa /
translated: The Dharma of the Buddha is the Dharma of enlightenment, etc., which is dependent on the Dharma Body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku rnams te de gsum ni sangs rgyas de rnams kyi kun rdzob pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku rnams te de gsum ni sangs rgyas de rnams kyi kun rdzob pa'i sku'o //
translated: The Enjoyment Body and the Emanation Body are the three bodies of those Buddhas, which are conventional.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dus byas pa rang bzhin med pa'i chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dus byas pa rang bzhin med pa'i chos nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The Dharma Body is the ultimate, because it is the essence of the reality of the insubstantiality of the compounded, which is attained by the supramundane path.

original: de la sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos byang chub phyogs la sogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos byang chub phyogs la sogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The Dharma of the Buddha is the sphere of the Perfectly Enlightened One, which is the Dharma of enlightenment, etc.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is the domain of experience of the lords of the tenth stage.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni de dang gzhan byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi spyod @291b yul lo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni de dang gzhan byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi spyod @291b yul lo //
translated: The Emanation Body is the domain of experience of those bodhisattvas and others.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid /
translated: Similarly, the realization of the Dharma Body is the nature of the two arousings of mind.

original: sku gsum du snang ba'o //
analyzed: sku gsum du snang ba'o //
translated: It appears as the three bodies.

original: de la sems bskyed pa nyer gcig pa ni dngos gzhi ste chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa nyer gcig pa ni dngos gzhi ste chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the twenty-one arousings of mind are the main part, the realization of the Dharma Body and the Enjoyment Body.

original: sems bskyed pa nyer gnyis pa ni rjes la thob pa sprul pa'i skur snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyer gnyis pa ni rjes la thob pa sprul pa'i skur snang ba'o //
translated: The twenty-second arousing of mind is the post-attainment, appearing as the Emanation Body.

original: des na chos sku nyid ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i snang ba skyed par byed pa /
analyzed: des na chos sku nyid ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i snang ba skyed par byed pa /
translated: Thus, the Dharma Body itself generates the appearance of the Enjoyment Body,

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa'i gzhan don rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa'i gzhan don rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: and it fulfills the welfare of others in all worlds.

original: sems bskyed pa de gnyis ni /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de gnyis ni /
translated: These two arousings of mind

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: are the nature of the five pristine wisdoms.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, the noble Buddha-field Sutra states:

original: rnam pa lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa spyir bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa spyir bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Buddha-ground is summarized in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang // mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang // bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang // mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang // bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: What are the five? The pure reality realm, mirror-like wisdom, the wisdom of individual realization, the wisdom of equality, and the wisdom that accomplishes all activities.

original: 'dir chos dbyings rnam par dag pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos dbyings /
analyzed: 'dir chos dbyings rnam par dag pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos dbyings /
translated: Here, the pure reality realm is the extremely pure reality realm.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa med do //
translated: The extremely pure reality of phenomena is called the reality realm. There is no difference in meaning.

original: de bzhin du dngos gzhi'i sems bskyed pa yang ye shes bzhi bdag nyid du rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos gzhi'i sems bskyed pa yang ye shes bzhi bdag nyid du rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Likewise, the generation of the mind of the main practice is also presented as having the nature of four wisdoms.

original: des na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang me long lta bu'i ye shes dag chos sku rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang me long lta bu'i ye shes dag chos sku rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the extremely pure reality realm and mirror-like wisdom are the realization of the Dharma body.

original: gang du mdo sde rgyan las /🔽me long ye shes longs spyod rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: gang du mdo sde rgyan las / me long ye shes longs spyod rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: In the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,🔽it says, “Mirror wisdom is the enjoyment buddhahood.”

original: zhes so // 'di longs spyod rdzogs pa sangs rgyas kyi rgyu nyid yin pas /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di longs spyod rdzogs pa sangs rgyas kyi rgyu nyid yin pas /
translated: Since it is the cause of enjoyment buddhahood,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do zhes 'grel pa byed pas so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do zhes 'grel pa byed pas so //
translated: it is called “enjoyment buddhahood,” according to the commentary.

original: des na me long lta bu'i ye shes nyid las ma lus pa'i longs spyod dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo rab tu 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na me long lta bu'i ye shes nyid las ma lus pa'i longs spyod dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo rab tu 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that the enjoyment and emanation wheels operate from mirror wisdom itself.

original: mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The wisdom of equality and discerning wisdom are the enjoyment body.

original: rjes kyi sems kyi bdag nyid sprul pa'i sku bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rjes kyi sems kyi bdag nyid sprul pa'i sku bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The emanation body, which is the subsequent mind, is the wisdom that accomplishes activities.

original: de la de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni /
analyzed: de la de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdom of the extremely pure realm of reality is the dharma body.

original: gang bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba brtse ba shes rab gnyis su med pa chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa rdzogs pa /
analyzed: gang bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba brtse ba shes rab gnyis su med pa chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa rdzogs pa /
translated: The one who is free from the two obscurations together with their habitual tendencies, who is the nondual union of love and wisdom, who has realized the dharmadhatu, who is perfect,

original: spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa /🔽yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa phul du phyin pa las skyes pa yang dag pa'i don gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyis mi slu ba'i tshad ma rtog bral ma 'khrul pa nyid yin pas mngon @292a * //
analyzed: spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa / yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa phul du phyin pa las skyes pa yang dag pa'i don gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyis mi slu ba'i tshad ma rtog bral ma 'khrul pa nyid yin pas mngon @292a * //
translated: who has the perfect abandonment and realization,

original: sum ci lta ba thams cad mkhyen pas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sum ci lta ba thams cad mkhyen pas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: who is born from the perfection of the meditation on the perfect meaning, and who is the nonmistaken valid cognition free from conceptualization, because of the clarity of the perfect meaning, is the omniscient Bhagavan, the one who is just like a direct perception.

original: de'i tshe me long lta bu'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe me long lta bu'i ye shes ni /
translated: At that time, the mirror-like wisdom

original: gang du mtshams med pa khams kyi rdul phran so so dang sems dang cig shos kyi dngos po thams cad /
analyzed: gang du mtshams med pa khams kyi rdul phran so so dang sems dang cig shos kyi dngos po thams cad /
translated: is where the particles of the elements, the individual karmic actions, the mind, and all other things🔽are not seen.

original: ci ltar yun ring ba dang cig shos dang dus 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i gnas skabs so sor me long du gzugs brnyan shar ba bzhin du gsal bar so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar yun ring ba dang cig shos dang dus 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i gnas skabs so sor me long du gzugs brnyan shar ba bzhin du gsal bar so sor snang ngo //
translated: Just as the long and the short, the past, future, and present, are individually and clearly reflected in a mirror, so are all things.

original: de nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni /
analyzed: de nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni /
translated: Then, the wisdom of equality is

original: gang gis de bzhin du gzugs brnyan shar ba'i 'gro ba rnams chos la bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid bsgrubs nas des thams cad du sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid rab tu brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin du gzugs brnyan shar ba'i 'gro ba rnams chos la bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid bsgrubs nas des thams cad du sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid rab tu brnyes pa'o //
translated: that by which, having established the equality of the selflessness of phenomena of all beings reflected in that way, one attains the equality of mind toward all sentient beings.

original: de nas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de bzhin du mnyam par gzhag pa nyid bcom ldan 'das rnam rtog med kyang /
analyzed: de nas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de bzhin du mnyam par gzhag pa nyid bcom ldan 'das rnam rtog med kyang /
translated: Then, the wisdom of discernment is that by which, in that way, the Bhagavān, without conceptualization,

original: rang gi sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can gyi bsod nams kyi bdag po las sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa so sor rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can gyi bsod nams kyi bdag po las sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa so sor rtog pa nyid do //
translated: discerns the mental activities of sentient beings through the power of his previous aspirations and the merit of sentient beings.

original: de nas bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de nas bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: Then, the wisdom that accomplishes activities is

original: gang gis de bzhin du so sor brtags pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i bya ba rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin du so sor brtags pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i bya ba rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: By means of that, he accomplishes the activity of going.

original: ye shes bzhi po de rnams ni rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi po de rnams ni rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: These four knowledges are the perfection of realization.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum ji snyed pa thams cad mkhyen pa bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum ji snyed pa thams cad mkhyen pa bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One is the omniscient one who directly perceives everything.

original: phrin las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te /
analyzed: phrin las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te /
translated: There are twenty-seven types of activity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das de gzugs su sprul te gang dmyal ba pa rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me sbubs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de gzugs su sprul te gang dmyal ba pa rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me sbubs nas /
translated: The Blessed One emanates as a form and, from the blazing fire of the hells,

original: dud 'gro rnams la rang gi sha la sogs pa byin zhing yi dvags rnams la bza' btung la sogs pa phyin te /
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams la rang gi sha la sogs pa byin zhing yi dvags rnams la bza' btung la sogs pa phyin te /
translated: gives his own flesh and so forth to the animals and food and drink to the hungry ghosts.

original: chos bstan pas sems mngon par dang bas /
analyzed: chos bstan pas sems mngon par dang bas /
translated: By teaching the Dharma, he causes their minds to become clear and

original: de rnams lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: de rnams lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed do //
translated: they are reborn as gods and humans.

original: lha rnams kyang theg pa dman pa la mos pa rnams la chos bstan pas mngon par rab tu dang bas mi rnams su skyes pa nas ci srid du nyan thos kyi byang chub la rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni 'gro ba zhi bar byed pa'i las so
analyzed: lha rnams kyang theg pa dman pa la mos pa rnams la chos bstan pas mngon par rab tu dang bas mi rnams su skyes pa nas ci srid du nyan thos kyi byang chub la rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni 'gro ba zhi bar byed pa'i las so
translated: The activity of pacifying beings is the activity of establishing in the enlightenment of the sravakas those who are devoted to the lower vehicle, by teaching them the Dharma and by their being born among humans through the purity of faith.

original: // gang dag mi rnams la phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi zang zing gi sbyin pa dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa dang / don spyod pa dang don mthun pa rnams la slob par byed pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po la bkod par byed pa'i las so //
analyzed: // gang dag mi rnams la phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi zang zing gi sbyin pa dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa dang / don spyod pa dang don mthun pa rnams la slob par byed pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po la bkod par byed pa'i las so //
translated: The activity of establishing in the means of gathering is the activity of teaching humans the generosity of material things, which is of external and internal nature, the generosity of the Dharma, which is mundane and transcendental, and the generosity of the gift of fearlessness, and the activity of establishing them in the four ways of gathering disciples.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag nub par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag nub par gyur pa ste /
translated: The activity of purifying the buddhaverse is the activity of purifying the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictive obscurations, which are the afflictions and the purities.

original: de'ang gang zag @292b dang chos la bdag med pa shes pa las zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba shes pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: de'ang gang zag @292b dang chos la bdag med pa shes pa las zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba shes pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: The phrase from the knowledge of the selflessness of persons and things refers to the function of establishing the knowledge of the completely afflicted and the completely purified.

original: ci ltar sgyu ma'i rnam pa sna tshogs pas dngos po rnams sprul te /
analyzed: ci ltar sgyu ma'i rnam pa sna tshogs pas dngos po rnams sprul te /
translated: Just as various illusory forms emanate things,

original: sgyu ma'i dngos po de thams cad la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dngos po de thams cad la /
translated: and all those illusory things

original: rdzas med pa zhes 'jig rten rnams mi shes so //
analyzed: rdzas med pa zhes 'jig rten rnams mi shes so //
translated: are not known by the world to be substanceless,

original: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni phung po la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni phung po la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid du blta'o //
translated: so the bodhisattva, who practices the perfection of wisdom, sees the aggregates and so forth as having a single taste in their emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: don dam par ni sems can med cing sems can du btags pa yang med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni sems can med cing sems can du btags pa yang med do //
translated: In the ultimate, there are no sentient beings and there is no designation of sentient beings,

original: chos rnams ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas so zhes pa ni sems can gyi don ci lta ba'i bdag nyid la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: chos rnams ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas so zhes pa ni sems can gyi don ci lta ba'i bdag nyid la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: because things are empty of intrinsic nature. This is the function of establishing the nature of the benefit for sentient beings.🔽When he gives a gift,🔽he thinks, I am giving a gift,

original: de sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: de sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
translated: and he gives a gift.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he causes them to apply themselves to generosity.🔽And so on up to: he causes them to observe morality, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod pa'i lam mo //
translated: This is the path of establishing them in the six perfections.🔽He causes them to enter into the acceptance of the ten wholesome courses of action, etc.

original: de dag dge ba bcu yang dag par blangs te 'jug go zhes pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: de dag dge ba bcu yang dag par blangs te 'jug go zhes pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the action of establishing them in the path of the Buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ teachings of the perfections, etc.

original: de rnams kyi mtha' gsum dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ston par byed cing /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtha' gsum dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ston par byed cing /
translated: are shown to be empty of the three extremes and of results, by their intrinsic reality.

original: de de dag sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de de dag sgom par byed de /
translated: He causes them to cultivate those.🔽As long as they proceed to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: ci srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gro'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: ci srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gro'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the action of establishing them in the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid rang bzhin stong nyid ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid rang bzhin stong nyid ni chos thams cad de /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic reality of all things is the emptiness of intrinsic reality of all things.

original: de nyid ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do zhes pa ni /
translated: That itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in the nondual Dharma.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bcom ldan 'das don dam par na chos 'ga' zhig nye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bcom ldan 'das don dam par na chos 'ga' zhig nye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: In perfect complete enlightenment, the Blessed One does not apprehend any Dharma ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas phung po khams la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa ston pa ni brda can gyi shes pa la dgod pa'i las so
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas phung po khams la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa ston pa ni brda can gyi shes pa la dgod pa'i las so
translated: Having fully awakened to the conventional, he teaches the aggregates, constituents, and so on, the perfections and so on, and the knowledge of all aspects and so on. This is the activity of establishing in the cognition of symbols.

original: // gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la spyod cing de rnams kyi mthar gsum dang 'bras bu dag nye bar mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: // gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la spyod cing de rnams kyi mthar gsum dang 'bras bu dag nye bar mi dmigs pa /
translated: One who practices the perfections and so on, and does not apprehend the three ends of those and their results,

original: de'i tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ched du nus pa'o zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ched du nus pa'o zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: at that time is able to attain perfect complete enlightenment. This is the activity of establishing in nonapprehension.

original: gang gi tshe yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na don dam @293a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na don dam @293a * //
translated: When the bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not see any dharma that is not included in the five aggregates.

original: par sems can nye bar mi dmigs te /
analyzed: par sems can nye bar mi dmigs te /
translated: When the bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not apprehend ultimately any sentient beings.

original: de ltar yin yang kun rdzob tu sems can rnams dngos po la mngon par zhen pas kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang kun rdzob tu sems can rnams dngos po la mngon par zhen pas kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: However, on the conventional level, sentient beings are afflicted by their attachment to entities.

original: de de'i de dag spang ba'i ched du theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de de'i de dag spang ba'i ched du theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: For the sake of their abandonment, he brings them to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing sentient beings in the maturation of their virtue.🔽He practices each of the perfections, such as generosity, and trains sentient beings in all the virtuous dharmas and in the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa re re la spyod cing dkar po'i chos thams cad dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid la sems can rnams slob par byed pa'o zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dgod pas so //
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa re re la spyod cing dkar po'i chos thams cad dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid la sems can rnams slob par byed pa'o zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dgod pas so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing them in the bodhisattva path.

original: de 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
translated: He reflects in the following way:

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not settle down on the voidness of voidness.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad par bya zhing de la'am de'i 'bras bu la rlom par mi bya'o zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad spang ba la dgod pa'i las so //🔽byang chub nyid ni lam yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad par bya zhing de la'am de'i 'bras bu la rlom par mi bya'o zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad spang ba la dgod pa'i las so // byang chub nyid ni lam yin /
translated: One should practice generosity and so on, but one should not be proud of it or its result. This is the function of establishing the relinquishment of all settling down.🔽Enlightenment itself is the path.

original: lam nyid ni byang chub po //
analyzed: lam nyid ni byang chub po //
translated: The path itself is enlightenment.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva does not become a buddha.

original: de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas gang gi tshe rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag par dgod pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes pa ni byang chub thob pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas gang gi tshe rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag par dgod pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes pa ni byang chub thob pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: And when, after the perfection of all the qualities of a buddha, he is established in perfect enlightenment, then he is a tathagata. This is the function of establishing the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de phung po skye mched la sogs pa chos thams cad 'du shes gnas ngan len bzlog cing bdag dang gzhan pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos thams cad la 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de phung po skye mched la sogs pa chos thams cad 'du shes gnas ngan len bzlog cing bdag dang gzhan pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos thams cad la 'jog par byed do //
translated: He establishes all phenomena, such as the aggregates and sense bases, in the wholesome dharmas such as the perfections, reversing the bad habits of discrimination.

original: dge ba de dag rang gi dang gzhan gyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dag tu yongs su sngo bar byed cing smon lam yang 'debs par byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba de dag rang gi dang gzhan gyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dag tu yongs su sngo bar byed cing smon lam yang 'debs par byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: He dedicates those wholesome roots to the complete enlightenment of himself and others, and to the purification of his own buddha field. He also makes prayers of aspiration.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in a pure buddha field.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva, from the very first production of the thought of enlightenment, is certain for complete enlightenment.

original: nges pa na ngan song du skye ba med do zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub nges pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: nges pa na ngan song du skye ba med do zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub nges pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: When he is certain, he does not take rebirth in the evil destinies. This is the activity of establishing in certainty for complete enlightenment.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing phyogs bcu grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can rnams kyi don byed cing gos pa med de /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing phyogs bcu grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can rnams kyi don byed cing gos pa med de /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom, they work for the welfare of sentient beings in the countless world systems of the ten directions without being defiled.

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pas dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pas dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Abiding in emptiness, they abide in all the virtuous dharmas.🔽Because emptiness is not other than all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad las stong pa nyid gzhan nyid med pas so zhes pa ni gzhal du med pa'i sems can don la @293b dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: chos thams cad las stong pa nyid gzhan nyid med pas so zhes pa ni gzhal du med pa'i sems can don la @293b dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing incalculable sentient beings in the Dharma.

original: de 'di bzhin du dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de 'di bzhin du dpyod par byed de /
translated: They investigate in the following way:

original: gang dag gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / gang dag de rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / gang dag de rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The world systems of the ten directions, equal to the sands of the Ganges river, and the Tathagatas of those, all of them are emptiness by nature.

original: gang tshe yang 'ga' zhig stong pa nyid ma yin par gyur na de nyi tshe bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang tshe yang 'ga' zhig stong pa nyid ma yin par gyur na de nyi tshe bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If at any time they were not emptiness, they would be limited.

original: des na chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te mngon par shes pa drug mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas nye bar dgod pa la sogs pa la dgod pa'i
analyzed: des na chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te mngon par shes pa drug mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas nye bar dgod pa la sogs pa la dgod pa'i
translated: This is the activity of establishing the Buddhas of the ten directions, etc.

original: las so // byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: las so // byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s branch of enlightenment?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du zhes pa ni byang chub yan lag la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du zhes pa ni byang chub yan lag la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: From the six perfections up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, this is the activity of establishing the branch of enlightenment.

original: gang gi tshe yang don dam par na chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang don dam par na chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa'o //
translated: When, in the ultimate sense, all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: de ltar na yang kun rdzob tu las yod de'i 'bras bu dag yod do ;
analyzed: de ltar na yang kun rdzob tu las yod de'i 'bras bu dag yod do ;
translated: still, conventionally, karma exists and its effects exist.

original: / sems can rnams kyi chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid mi shes so //
analyzed: / sems can rnams kyi chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid mi shes so //
translated: Sentient beings do not understand that phenomena are empty of their own marks.

original: ma shes pas gang zag dang chos dag tu rtog par byed cing las mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma shes pas gang zag dang chos dag tu rtog par byed cing las mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Due to ignorance, one conceives of persons and phenomena and creates karma.

original: des nyes par spyad pas ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
analyzed: des nyes par spyad pas ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
translated: Due to faulty conduct, one falls into the three lower realms.

original: legs par spyad pas lha dang mi rnams su nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: legs par spyad pas lha dang mi rnams su nye bar skye'o //
translated: Due to good conduct, one is born as a god or human.

original: kha cig yang gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu goms pas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro spangs nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig yang gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu goms pas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro spangs nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some, through familiarity with the selflessness of persons, abandon good and bad rebirths and proceed to nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag med gnyis rnam par goms nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rim gyis sa bcu bgrod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag med gnyis rnam par goms nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rim gyis sa bcu bgrod de /
translated: Bodhisattvas, through familiarity with the two types of selflessness, complete the virtuous dharmas such as the perfections and gradually traverse the ten grounds.

original: skad cig gcig la yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes pa ni las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa rnam par ma nyams pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes pa ni las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa rnam par ma nyams pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: In a single moment, through the wisdom that is perfectly endowed, one will become a Buddha, a Bhagavat, who has fully awakened to all dharmas. This is the activity of establishing the unbroken connection between action and result.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bden pa shes pas mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bden pa shes pas mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin te /
translated: A Bodhisattva does not attain nirvana through the knowledge of the truths.

original: de lta mod kyi bden pa bzhi rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi bden pa bzhi rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
translated: Nevertheless, through the absence of own-being of the four noble truths, he knows suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs so rab tu 'gog pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs so rab tu 'gog pa mngon du byed do //
translated: he abandons the origin, he actualizes the cessation,

original: lam sgom par byed do zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi la dgod pa'i las so //🔽rtag pa bde bdag bdag gi phyin @294a * //
analyzed: lam sgom par byed do zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi la dgod pa'i las so // rtag pa bde bdag bdag gi phyin @294a * //
translated: and he cultivates the path. This is the activity of establishing the four noble truths.

original: ci log bzhi ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mi mthun phyogs so //
analyzed: ci log bzhi ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mi mthun phyogs so //
translated: The four inversions are the counteragents to the selflessness of the person.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni chos la bdag med pa'i mi mthun phyogs so zhes phyin ci log la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni chos la bdag med pa'i mi mthun phyogs so zhes phyin ci log la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: Attachment to things is the counteragent to the selflessness of phenomena.

original: phyin ci log gis sems can rnams las mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: phyin ci log gis sems can rnams las mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Sentient beings form karma through error.🔽Then, conventionally, the world is defiled.

original: de nas tha snyad kyis 'jig rten rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / don dam par na phyin ci log ni dngos po med pa nyid shes pa dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: de nas tha snyad kyis 'jig rten rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / don dam par na phyin ci log ni dngos po med pa nyid shes pa dgod pa'i las so //
translated: But ultimately, error is the knowledge of the nonexistence of things.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: That which is the sameness of all things, suchness, the limit of reality, and nirvana.

original: sems can thams cad kyi phyin ci log rab tu spang ba'i ched du byang chub sems dpa' tshogs sogs pa la spyod cing ci srid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba dang tshogs
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi phyin ci log rab tu spang ba'i ched du byang chub sems dpa' tshogs sogs pa la spyod cing ci srid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba dang tshogs
translated: The bodhisattva practices the accumulations in order to eliminate the errors of all sentient beings.🔽As long as he has not attained manifest, complete enlightenment, he brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the function of establishing in purification and the accumulations.

original: chos nyid ni mnyam pa nyid de ;
analyzed: chos nyid ni mnyam pa nyid de ;
translated: The nature of phenomena is equality.

original: chos nyid la tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid la tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference in the nature of phenomena.

original: de ni 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas ma yin 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: It is neither compounded nor uncompounded.🔽The realm of the compounded and the realm of the uncompounded are not connected.

original: gang 'dus byas kyi dbyings dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings dag kun du ldan pa ma yin mtshan ma nyid dag pa'o zhes 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha dad med pas shes pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: gang 'dus byas kyi dbyings dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings dag kun du ldan pa ma yin mtshan ma nyid dag pa'o zhes 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha dad med pas shes pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: This is the function of establishing in knowledge, since compounded and uncompounded are not different.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste de bzhin gshegs pas ma byas pa gang dag rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni dngos po dngos po med par mchog tu 'dzin pa zad pas mya ngan las 'da'o zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba la dgod pa'i
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste de bzhin gshegs pas ma byas pa gang dag rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni dngos po dngos po med par mchog tu 'dzin pa zad pas mya ngan las 'da'o zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba la dgod pa'i
translated: Those who hold the emptiness of nature to be a thing or a non-thing will attain nirvana through the exhaustion of that grasping. This is the activity of establishing in nirvana.

original: las so // phrin las ni kun spyod do //
analyzed: las so // phrin las ni kun spyod do //
translated: Activity is conduct.

original: de'i khyab pa nyid ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams su gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis snod ci lta ba bzhin du rnam par thar pa med pas nam mkha' ci srid du 'jug pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i khyab pa nyid ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams su gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis snod ci lta ba bzhin du rnam par thar pa med pas nam mkha' ci srid du 'jug pa'o zhes so //
translated: Its pervasiveness is engaging in all aspects for all sentient beings abiding in the worlds of the ten directions, in accordance with their faculties, until the end of space.

original: gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni /
translated: Others say:

original: 'gro ba bzang po dang bzang po ma yi pa mngon par zhen pa'i gnas skabs ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'gro ba zhi ba'i las dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la dgod pa'i las dang / thos pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pas shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag spang bya dang spang bya'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par byang ba rtogs pa la dgod pa'i las dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba bzang po dang bzang po ma yi pa mngon par zhen pa'i gnas skabs ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'gro ba zhi ba'i las dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la dgod pa'i las dang / thos pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pas shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag spang bya dang spang bya'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par byang ba rtogs pa la dgod pa'i las dang /
translated: The activity of pacifying migration is the characteristic of the nonabiding state of the good and bad migrations.🔽The activity of establishing in the four factors of attracting others is the activity of establishing in the knowledge of the antidotes and their objects of elimination through the knowledge of the antidotes and their objects of elimination through listening and so on.🔽The activity of establishing in the knowledge of the purification of affliction is the activity of establishing in the nature of love and so on for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan don du byams pa la @294b sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni sems can gyi don ci lta ba'i bdag nyid la dgod pa'i las dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug goms pa la dgod pa'i las dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang sangs rgyas kyi lam la dgod pa'i las dang /
analyzed: gzhan don du byams pa la @294b sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni sems can gyi don ci lta ba'i bdag nyid la dgod pa'i las dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug goms pa la dgod pa'i las dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang sangs rgyas kyi lam la dgod pa'i las dang /
translated: The activity of establishing in the nature of the benefit of sentient beings is the activity of establishing in the practice of the six perfections, the activity of establishing in the ten virtuous actions and the path of the Buddha, and the activity of establishing in the four truths.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid goms pa la dgod pa'i las dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mthus sa dang po la thams cad du chos dbyings mngon du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis zad pa la dgod pa'i las dang / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i shes pa la dgod pa'i las dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid goms pa la dgod pa'i las dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mthus sa dang po la thams cad du chos dbyings mngon du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis zad pa la dgod pa'i las dang / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i shes pa la dgod pa'i las dang /
translated: the activity of establishing all beings in the practice of the emptiness of inherent existence of all phenomena; the activity of establishing all beings in the realization of the two kinds of no-self, the realization of the expanse of reality on the first level through the power of generosity and so forth;🔽the activity of establishing all beings in the knowledge that all phenomena are imputed by the mind, the perfection of discipline and so forth, which are the causes for completing the accumulations on the second level and so forth;

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus sa drug pa la shes pa shes bya sgom pa mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la dgod pa'i las dang / bdun pa la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin pa la dgod pa'i las dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus sa drug pa la shes pa shes bya sgom pa mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la dgod pa'i las dang / bdun pa la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin pa la dgod pa'i las dang /
translated: the activity of establishing all beings in the nonapprehension of all phenomena through the power of the perfection of wisdom, the nonconceptual meditation on consciousness and objects of cognition on the sixth level; the activity of establishing all beings in the full maturation of sentient beings through the power of the perfection of skillful means on the seventh level;

original: brgyad pa la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus nyan thos la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dgod pa'i las dang / sa de nyid la sgom par mngon par zhen pa spong ba la dgod pa'i las dang /
analyzed: brgyad pa la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus nyan thos la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dgod pa'i las dang / sa de nyid la sgom par mngon par zhen pa spong ba la dgod pa'i las dang /
translated: On the eighth level, through the power of transcendent strength, they engage in the activity of introducing disciples to the bodhisattva path, which is not held in common with the listeners and solitary realizers, and they engage in the activity of introducing them to the elimination of attachment to meditation on that same level.

original: dgu pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nus pa las byang chub yang dag par thob pa la dgod pa'i las dang / bcu pa la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs las sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa gnyis yongs su sbyong ba la 'god pa'i las dang /
analyzed: dgu pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nus pa las byang chub yang dag par thob pa la dgod pa'i las dang / bcu pa la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs las sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa gnyis yongs su sbyong ba la 'god pa'i las dang /
translated: On the ninth level, through the power of transcendent aspirations, they engage in the activity of introducing disciples to the perfect attainment of enlightenment and on the tenth level, through the power of transcendent wisdom, they engage in the activity of introducing them to the purification of the two kinds of buddha field.

original: sa de nyid la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu so sor nges pa la 'god pa'i las dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams kyi sems can don la 'god pa'i las dang 'jig rten khams thams cad du sangs rgyas nye bar 'chags pa la sogs pa'i yon tan la 'god pa'i las dang /🔽de nyid kyi khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin la byang chub ma lus pa thob par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi yan lag la 'god pa'i las dang / las 'bras 'brel pa rnam par mi nyams pa la 'god pa'i las dang /
analyzed: sa de nyid la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu so sor nges pa la 'god pa'i las dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten khams kyi sems can don la 'god pa'i las dang 'jig rten khams thams cad du sangs rgyas nye bar 'chags pa la sogs pa'i yon tan la 'god pa'i las dang / de nyid kyi khyad par gyi lam gyi rang bzhin la byang chub ma lus pa thob par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi yan lag la 'god pa'i las dang / las 'bras 'brel pa rnam par mi nyams pa la 'god pa'i las dang /

original: zad par bcu ste ;
analyzed: zad par bcu ste ;

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyir gzugs chung ngu la lta zhing zil gyis mnan nas shes shing lta ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Perceiving no forms internally, one sees small external forms and knows them by surpassing them. This is the third.

analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //

analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis gang las bzhengs nas grong la sogs par zhugs te de dmigs pas de na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa mi skye ba de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Having entered into meditative stabilization, he arises from it by the power of his former vow and enters the village, etc. The non-arising of the afflictions of the sentient beings who are there by objectifying him is the absence of afflictions.

original: de dag nyan thos la yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag nyan thos la yang yod mod kyi /

analyzed: nyan thos dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag gi nyon mongs med pa de dag ni phrin las khyad par yod de /

analyzed: de yang / nyan thos kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni /

analyzed: de rnams kyi mthong ba nyid rnam par spong ngo // de bzhin @296a * //

original: spros pa thams cad ni rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad ni rtsod pa ste /
translated: All elaborations are conflicts.

analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi smon pa mkhyen pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi smon pa mkhyen pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pas rtsol ba med pa'o //
