original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ma chags pa'o //

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pas gegs med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pas gegs med pa'o //

analyzed: sems rtag tu mnyam par gzhag ste gnas pas dus thams cad du gnas pa dang lan thams cad 'debs par byed pa'o //

original: mngon par shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug ste /
translated: There are six higher knowledges:

original: 'di ltar / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /

analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //

analyzed: yongs su dag pa bzhi ni / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rten yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //

analyzed: de la rang gi nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnas ngan len gyi bag chags rnams kyi rten las shin tu med par byas nas /
translated: Having completely eliminated the support for the latent tendencies of the negative tendencies of all one's own mental afflictions,

translated: As before, the complete purity of the mind is the freedom from negative tendencies of all sentient beings and the increase of the roots of virtue in all aspects of the mind.

translated: As before, the complete purity of gnosis is mastery over objects of knowledge and gnosis due to being free from all the negative tendencies of the side of ignorance.

original: dbang bcu ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang bcu ste 'di lta ste /
translated: There are ten masteries. They are as follows.

original: tshe 'jog pas dang / yongs su spang pas tshe la dbang ba'o //🔽'di lta ste /🔽tshe'i tshad brjod du med pa'i skal par byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'jog pas dang / yongs su spang pas tshe la dbang ba'o // 'di lta ste / tshe'i tshad brjod du med pa'i skal par byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of life is due to the prolongation of life and the total abandonment of life.🔽Mastery of mind is due to the meditative concentration of the dhyanas, etc.,

original: ci ltar 'dod par bsam gtan ting nge 'dzin snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las bzhengs pas sems la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod par bsam gtan ting nge 'dzin snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las bzhengs pas sems la dbang ba'o //
translated: as one wishes, and to the arising from meditative concentration as one wishes.🔽Mastery of necessities is due to the display of the adornment of all worlds with many arrays, etc.,

original: 'jig rten thams cad rgyan bkod pa du mas rab tu brgyan pa nyid du byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa kun du ston pas ci ltar 'dod pa phan 'dogs pa nye bar gnas pas yo byad la dbang ba dang / ci ltar 'dod pa lus dang ngag gi las grub pa dang dus ci lta ba bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyi rlabs kun du ston pas las la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad rgyan bkod pa du mas rab tu brgyan pa nyid du byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa kun du ston pas ci ltar 'dod pa phan 'dogs pa nye bar gnas pas yo byad la dbang ba dang / ci ltar 'dod pa lus dang ngag gi las grub pa dang dus ci lta ba bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyi rlabs kun du ston pas las la dbang ba dang /
translated: and to the presence of assistance as one wishes. Mastery of action is due to the display of the transformation of action as one wishes, and of the maturation of action in accordance with the time.

original: skye gnas thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin skye bas skye ba la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: skye gnas thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin skye bas skye ba la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of birth is due to birth in all wombs as one wishes.

original: ci ltar 'dod pa mngon par shes pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rnam par 'gyur ba kun du ston pa la sogs pa ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod pa mngon par shes pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rnam par 'gyur ba kun du ston pa la sogs pa ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of the superknowledges consists of the ability to manifest all the transformations of the buddhaverse that one wishes.

original: smon lam phun sum tshogs pas smon lam la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam phun sum tshogs pas smon lam la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of vows consists of the ability to fulfill all one's aspirations through the perfection of vows.

original: gang ci lta ba nyid du mos pa de kho na bzhin du 'byung ba 'di ni mos pa la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: gang ci lta ba nyid du mos pa de kho na bzhin du 'byung ba 'di ni mos pa la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of resolve consists of the ability to make whatever one resolves to occur just as one has resolved it.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas yongs su gang ba kun du ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas yongs su gang ba kun du ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It consists of the ability to manifest all the universes as filled with buddhas, and so forth.

original: gang nyid shes par 'dod pa de nyid shes pa 'di ni ye shes la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: gang nyid shes par 'dod pa de nyid shes pa 'di ni ye shes la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of knowledge consists of the ability to know whatever one wishes to know.

original: 'di ltar stobs mi 'jigs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mtshan bzang dpe byad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs mi 'jigs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mtshan bzang dpe byad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It consists of the ability to manifest the attainment of the strengths, fearlessnesses, special buddha qualities, major and minor marks, and so forth.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa rnam par bzhag pa la mkhas pa ni chos la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa rnam par bzhag pa la mkhas pa ni chos la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery of Dharma consists of the ability to teach the scriptures and so forth.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four forms of fearlessness.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / nges @297a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / nges @297a * //
translated: They are as follows:

original: bar 'byung ba la mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: bar 'byung ba la mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: fearlessness with regard to perfect awakening, fearlessness with regard to the destruction of the impurities, fearlessness with regard to the teaching of the obstacles, and fearlessness with regard to the teaching of the path of definite release.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three forms of absence of fear.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: the Tathāgata’s physical actions are pure,

original: de la lus kyi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la lus kyi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa nyid de /
translated: and he has no impure physical actions at all.

original: gang kha cig gzhan gyis mi shes par bya ba yongs su 'chab par bya bar sems pa de med do //
analyzed: gang kha cig gzhan gyis mi shes par bya ba yongs su 'chab par bya bar sems pa de med do //
translated: There is nothing that he thinks should be concealed because others do not know about it.

original: de ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first absence of fear.

original: de bzhin du ngag gi las ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag gi las ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, his verbal actions are the second absence of fear.

original: yid kyi las ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las ni gsum pa'o //
translated: His mental actions are the third absence of fear.

original: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la gsum ste /
translated: There are three forms of the applications of mindfulness that are not shared by disciples.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos bstan pa las la la gus par nyan pa dang rna gtod par byed pa dang kun shes pa sems la nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos bstan pa las la la gus par nyan pa dang rna gtod par byed pa dang kun shes pa sems la nye bar 'jog par byed pa dang / chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,🔽does not pay attention,🔽and does not apply his mind to understand.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa dga' bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dga' bar mi 'gyur /
translated: The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone who listens respectfully,🔽pays attention, and applies his mind to understand,🔽and practices in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,

original: yid bde ba ma yin /
analyzed: yid bde ba ma yin /
translated: does not pay attention,

original: sems khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: and does not apply his mind to understand.🔽The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone who listens respectfully,🔽pays attention, and applies his mind to understand,🔽and practices in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,

original: gzhan zhig gis ma gus par nyan par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis ma gus par nyan par byed do //
translated: does not pay attention,

original: rna rnam par gtod par mi byed do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rna rnam par gtod par mi byed do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and does not apply his mind to understand.🔽The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone who listens respectfully,🔽pays attention, and applies his mind to understand,🔽and practices in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,🔽does not pay attention,🔽and does not apply his mind to understand.🔽The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone who listens respectfully,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi dga' ba ma yin mnar sems ma yin /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi dga' ba ma yin mnar sems ma yin /
translated: pays attention, and applies his mind to understand,🔽and practices in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,

original: mi bzod pa ma yin /
analyzed: mi bzod pa ma yin /
translated: does not pay attention,🔽and does not apply his mind to understand.🔽The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone who listens respectfully,🔽pays attention, and applies his mind to understand,🔽and practices in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,🔽does not pay attention,

original: mi gcugs pa ma yin sems mngon par mi mnyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gcugs pa ma yin sems mngon par mi mnyes pa ma yin no //
translated: and does not apply his mind to understand.

original: kha cig gus par nyan par byed ma gus par nyan par byed /
analyzed: kha cig gus par nyan par byed ma gus par nyan par byed /
translated: The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone who listens respectfully,🔽pays attention, and applies his mind to understand,

original: thos pa nges par 'byin par byed //
analyzed: thos pa nges par 'byin par byed //
translated: and practices in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not displeased by someone who listens disrespectfully,🔽does not pay attention,🔽and does not apply his mind to understand.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is not pleased by someone

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa dga' ba dang mnar sems gnyi gar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dga' ba dang mnar sems gnyi gar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not affected by either pleasure or irritation.

original: thams cad du btang snyoms la rnam par gnas pa nyid dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: thams cad du btang snyoms la rnam par gnas pa nyid dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa'o zhes so //
translated: He is always indifferent, mindful, and aware.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba dus las mi 'da' bas bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba dus las mi 'da' bas bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: He never forgets, because he never misses the time for acting for the sake of beings.

original: nyon mongs sangs kyang gang zhig nyon mongs ma spangs pa bzhin du spyod pa de ni nyon mongs bag chags te /
analyzed: nyon mongs sangs kyang gang zhig nyon mongs ma spangs pa bzhin du spyod pa de ni nyon mongs bag chags te /
translated: The Tathāgata has eliminated the afflictions, but he acts as if he had not eliminated them. This is the instinct for the afflictions.

original: bum snam la sogs pa rnams kyis til gyi me tog la sogs pa bsal yang de dang 'dres pa'i dri phra mo gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum snam la sogs pa rnams kyis til gyi me tog la sogs pa bsal yang de dang 'dres pa'i dri phra mo gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, although a cloth is cleansed of stains by removing the stains with such things as a potsherd, a subtle odor of the potsherd may remain in the cloth.

original: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags ni gang shes bya yongs su spyod pa'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags ni gang shes bya yongs su spyod pa'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The instinct for ignorance is that which obstructs the thorough knowledge of objects of knowledge.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags ni lus ngag gis 'jug pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags ni lus ngag gis 'jug pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu yang ngo //
translated: The instinct for attachment, etc., is the cause of the special engagement of body and speech.

original: dper na dge slong sngon spre'u ru gyur pas 'gro ba na mchong ba dang / sngon bram zer gyur pas dmangs mo smra ba'o //
analyzed: dper na dge slong sngon spre'u ru gyur pas 'gro ba na mchong ba dang / sngon bram zer gyur pas dmangs mo smra ba'o //
translated: For example, a monk who was formerly a monkey jumps about when he walks, and a monk who was formerly a brahman speaks roughly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de thams cad kyang nub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de thams cad kyang nub ste /
translated: All of these have disappeared in the Tathāgata.

original: nyon @297b mongs pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa de ni bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyon @297b mongs pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa de ni bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod do //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he has completely destroyed the instinct for the afflictions.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is the one who has completely destroyed the instincts.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das phan par 'dod pas dus thams cad du lan drug tu ni su ni 'grib su ni 'phel zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten rnams la rnam par gzigs pa de ni phan par 'dod pa'i snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das phan par 'dod pas dus thams cad du lan drug tu ni su ni 'grib su ni 'phel zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten rnams la rnam par gzigs pa de ni phan par 'dod pa'i snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The great compassion of the Blessed One, which is the desire to benefit, is the observation of the world six times during the day and night, thinking, “Who is declining? Who is advancing? ” and so forth.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin khyad par mtshan nyid dbye ba mthar thug pa mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin khyad par mtshan nyid dbye ba mthar thug pa mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of all the aspects of all the dharmas is the knowledge of all the aspects.

original: stobs ni bcu ste /
analyzed: stobs ni bcu ste /
translated: The powers of the Blessed One are ten in number.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of diverse faculties,🔽the power of knowledge of all paths and their destinations,🔽the power of knowledge of the meditative absorptions, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis that are thoroughly afflicted and completely purified,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin snyoms par 'jug pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang ba bzhengs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin snyoms par 'jug pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang ba bzhengs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of recollecting former states,🔽the power of knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: and the power of knowledge of the elimination of contaminants.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdo las /🔽gnas dang gnas ma yin pa ni srid pa dang mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdo las / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa ni srid pa dang mi srid pa'o //
translated: Their characteristics are described in the sūtras:🔽The possible and impossible are what is possible and impossible.

original: rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are causes and noncauses.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gnas ni gnas nyid dang gnas ma yin pa ni gnas ma yin pa nyid du shes pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni gnas nyid dang gnas ma yin pa ni gnas ma yin pa nyid du shes pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The place is known as a place, and a non-place is known as a non-place.

original: de la nyes par spyod pa rnams ni mi 'dod pa'i rnam smin gyi gnas so //
analyzed: de la nyes par spyod pa rnams ni mi 'dod pa'i rnam smin gyi gnas so //
translated: Among them, bad conduct is the place of undesirable karmic maturation.

original: 'dod pa'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: It is not the place of desirable [karmic maturation].

original: legs par spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i gnas so //
translated: Good conduct is the place of desirable [karmic maturation].

original: mi 'dod pa'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: It is not the place of undesirable [karmic maturation].

original: ser snas dbul po gnas yin zhing longs spyod chen po gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: ser snas dbul po gnas yin zhing longs spyod chen po gnas ma yin no //
translated: Stinginess is the place of poverty and not the place of great wealth.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod chen po nyid gnas dang dbul po gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod chen po nyid gnas dang dbul po gnas ma yin no //
translated: Generosity is the place of great wealth and not the place of poverty.

original: pha ma dgra bcom bsad pa dge 'dun 'byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba'i mtshan nyid mtshams med pa'i las byed pa dang / ma nyid dgra bcom ma /
analyzed: pha ma dgra bcom bsad pa dge 'dun 'byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba'i mtshan nyid mtshams med pa'i las byed pa dang / ma nyid dgra bcom ma /
translated: Killing one's mother, father, or an arhat, causing a schism in the saṅgha, and with evil intent causing blood to flow from the body of a tathāgata - these are the characteristics of committing the heinous acts.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pas sun phyung ba dang / nges pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa dang / mi slob pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun rnyed pa'i sgo 'phrog pa dang / mchod rten 'jig pa'i nye ba'i @298a * //
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pas sun phyung ba dang / nges pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa dang / mi slob pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun rnyed pa'i sgo 'phrog pa dang / mchod rten 'jig pa'i nye ba'i @298a * //
translated: The five actions of immediate retribution are: to kill one's father, to kill one's mother, to kill an arhat, to injure the Tathagata and cause his blood to flow, and to cause a schism in the order.

original: mtshams med lnga'i las byed pa ni sems rnam par gnas pa ni gnas ma yin zhing 'gyod pa rab tu gnas pa'i sems las su rung ba ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams med lnga'i las byed pa ni sems rnam par gnas pa ni gnas ma yin zhing 'gyod pa rab tu gnas pa'i sems las su rung ba ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: The five actions of immediate retribution are not the basis for the stability of mind, and a mind that is remorseful and unstable is not fit for action.

original: bud med rang gi dngos po nyid kyis 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dang / brgya byin nyid dang tshangs pa nyid la sogs pa gnas ma yin zhing bzlog pas thams cad gnas yin no //🔽de lta bu la sogs pa gnas dang gnas pa yin pa dag la chags pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: bud med rang gi dngos po nyid kyis 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dang / brgya byin nyid dang tshangs pa nyid la sogs pa gnas ma yin zhing bzlog pas thams cad gnas yin no // de lta bu la sogs pa gnas dang gnas pa yin pa dag la chags pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: It is not possible for a woman to become a universal monarch, Sakra, or Brahma, but it is possible for a man.🔽The knowledge of what is possible and impossible is unobstructed knowledge concerning what is possible and impossible.

original: de la dag pa ni yang dag pa ci lta ba phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dag pa ni yang dag pa ci lta ba phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
translated: Purity is the knowledge of what is pure and impure.

original: gang dang gang yang dag pa la ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang yang dag pa la ma chags pa'o //
translated: It is the non-attachment to any reality whatsoever.

original: rnam pa gang dang gang gis yang dag pa zhes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pas thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang gang gis yang dag pa zhes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pas thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unobstructed in all modes of reality, since it is the knowledge of all modes.

original: ye shes de nyid ni stobs te /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid ni stobs te /
translated: That very knowledge is a power,

original: gzhan gyis ches shin tu mi thub pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ches shin tu mi thub pas so //
translated: since it is not overcome by others.

original: las ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Action is merit, demerit, and stability, etc.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na ldan pa'i bsod nams ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na ldan pa'i bsod nams ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Stability is merit in the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: kha cig tu khams gsum na ldan pa'i dge ba yang bsod nams su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kha cig tu khams gsum na ldan pa'i dge ba yang bsod nams su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In some places, virtue in the three realms is established as merit.

original: rnam par smin pa ni bden pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni bden pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: Maturation is the truth of suffering, etc.

original: khams sna tshogs ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i g-yo ba la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i g-yo ba la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The various realms are the superior resolve that generates the movement of merit and demerit, etc.

original: mos pa sna tshogs ni sred pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs ni sred pa sna tshogs te /
translated: Various inclinations are various cravings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags la gnas kyang zhe sdang la sred pa dang / zhe sdang la gnas kyang 'dod chags la sred pa dang / dman pa'i sbyor ba rgya che ba'i sbyor ba la sred pa dang / rgya che ba'i sbyor ba dman pa'i sbyor ba la sred pa zhes pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la gnas kyang zhe sdang la sred pa dang / zhe sdang la gnas kyang 'dod chags la sred pa dang / dman pa'i sbyor ba rgya che ba'i sbyor ba la sred pa dang / rgya che ba'i sbyor ba dman pa'i sbyor ba la sred pa zhes pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: One abides in attachment, but craves for aversion; one abides in aversion, but craves for attachment; one abides in the inferior, but craves for the superior; one abides in the superior, but craves for the inferior.

original: dbang po dad pa brtson 'grus dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes rab bo //
analyzed: dbang po dad pa brtson 'grus dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes rab bo //
translated: The faculties are faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de rnams kyi mchog dang mchog ma yin pa ni tha ma 'bring rab nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog dang mchog ma yin pa ni tha ma 'bring rab nyid do //
translated: Their supremacy and non-supremacy are just the lowest, middling, and highest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'di ni dbang po tha ma'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po tha ma'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the lowest faculty, and so on.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ni /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ni /
translated: The path that goes everywhere is:

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gyi khams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang ma nges pa dag shes so //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gyi khams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang ma nges pa dag shes so //
translated: Here, the Tathagata knows the realms of sentient beings who are destined for perfect enlightenment and those who are not.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa de dag gi rjes su mthun pa rnams kyi lam dag shes shing ston par byed do //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa de dag gi rjes su mthun pa rnams kyi lam dag shes shing ston par byed do //
translated: He knows and teaches the paths that are suitable for those who are destined and those who are not.

original: log pa nyid du nges pa dag mkhyen nas de dag nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa btang snyoms su byed do zhes dus de srid pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa dag mkhyen nas de dag nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa btang snyoms su byed do zhes dus de srid pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: Having understood those who are definitely perverted, he acts with equanimity in accordance with them.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i lam mo //
translated: This is the path that acts as the antidote to attachment.

original: @298b 'di ni zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @298b 'di ni zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the path that acts as the antidote to anger, and so on.

original: bsam gtan bzhi rnam thar brgyad rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang ba bzhengs pa
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi rnam thar brgyad rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang ba bzhengs pa
translated: He knows the afflicted and the purified through the four concentrations, eight liberations, various concentrations such as that associated with investigation and analysis, four formless absorptions, and nine serial absorptions.

original: shes pa'o // de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myang ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: shes pa'o // de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myang ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Therein, affliction is through relishing and so on.

original: rnam par byang ba ni mi dmigs pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni mi dmigs pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Purification is through nonobservation and so on.

original: langs pa ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa pas thod rgal gyis so //
analyzed: langs pa ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa pas thod rgal gyis so //
translated: Rising is through leaping over, like a lion stretching.

original: sngon gyi gnas ni sngon gyi skye ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas ni sngon gyi skye ba'o //
translated: The former states are former lives.

original: de rnams rjes su dran pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams rjes su dran pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of them is memory.

original: shi 'pho ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi skye'o //
analyzed: shi 'pho ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi skye'o //
translated: Death and birth are the death and birth of sentient beings.

original: de ni 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The noble King of Contemplations on the Suprema Sutras says,

original: de la 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan te /
translated: The divine eye of the Tathagata is this:

original: gang gi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i mtha'i mur thug pa rnams su /
analyzed: gang gi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i mtha'i mur thug pa rnams su /
translated: Whatever in the ten directions is reached by the end of space,

original: gang zhig tu snang ba de rnams la /
analyzed: gang zhig tu snang ba de rnams la /
translated: whatever appears there,

original: kha cig sreg bzhin pa dang / 'jig bzhin pa dang / 'chag bzhin pa rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: kha cig sreg bzhin pa dang / 'jig bzhin pa dang / 'chag bzhin pa rnams mthong ngo //
translated: some burning, some breaking up, some being crushed, some being born,🔽some dying, some happy, some miserable, some with good color, some with bad color, some with good destiny, some with bad destiny, some with good deeds, some with bad deeds, some with good understanding, some with bad understanding, some in the hells, some in the animal world, some in the world of Yama, some humans, some gods,

original: sems can snang ba de rnams la kha cig 'pho bzhin pa dang / skye bzhin pa dang / gang dag mi snang bar rtogs pa'i sems can ji srid du de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis snang bar son pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: sems can snang ba de rnams la kha cig 'pho bzhin pa dang / skye bzhin pa dang / gang dag mi snang bar rtogs pa'i sems can ji srid du de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis snang bar son pa'o zhes so //
translated: all those sentient beings are seen by the Tathagata with his divine eye.

original: gang gi tshe yang dbang po rnams gnas ngan len rang bzhin no zhes gsungs pas mi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang po ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi gnas skabs su spangs pas yid kyi blo bzhin du dbang po'i blos rig pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dbang po rnams gnas ngan len rang bzhin no zhes gsungs pas mi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang po ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi gnas skabs su spangs pas yid kyi blo bzhin du dbang po'i blos rig pa ste /
translated: Since it is said that the faculties are by nature the assumption of bad states, the faculties that are by nature ignorance are abandoned in the state of buddhahood. Therefore, like mental cognition, the faculties are not aware of objects.

original: yul yongs su gcod pas bcom ldan 'das rnam shes thams cad ni yul thams cad 'dod do //
analyzed: yul yongs su gcod pas bcom ldan 'das rnam shes thams cad ni yul thams cad 'dod do //
translated: The Bhagavān says that all consciousnesses desire all objects.

original: yang dad pa'i stobs skyed pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dad pa'i stobs skyed pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: Also, the Sūtra on Generating the Power of Faith says:

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor gyis kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor gyis kyang mthong ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the uṣṇīṣa of the Tathāgata sees.

original: de bzhin du mdzod spus kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzod spus kyang mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the ūrṇā sees.

original: de bzhin du mtshan bzang re res kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan bzang re res kyang mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, each of the excellent signs sees.

original: de bzhin du dus cig car du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams mthong ngo zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus cig car du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams mthong ngo zhes so //
translated: In the same way, all the world systems of the ten directions are seen simultaneously.

original: de lta mod kyi sngon gyi dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs nas rnam par bzhag pas zhes lha'i spyan dang lha'i rna ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sngon gyi dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs nas rnam par bzhag pas zhes lha'i spyan dang lha'i rna ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Nevertheless, the Buddha has established the divine eye and the divine ear by taking into account the organ of sight and the organ of hearing.

original: zag pa ni sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs so //
analyzed: zag pa ni sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs so //
translated: The defilements are the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: thams cad zad pa dang / lam gang gis zad par byed pa dang / de dag gnyi ga zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad zad pa dang / lam gang gis zad par byed pa dang / de dag gnyi ga zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The extinction of all the defilements and the path by which one causes them to be extinguished are the extinction of the defilements.

original: @299a * // yang sangs rgyas kyi sku ni sred med kyi bu'i stobs su smra'o //
analyzed: @299a * // yang sangs rgyas kyi sku ni sred med kyi bu'i stobs su smra'o //
translated: The body of the Buddha is said to have the strength of Narayana.

original: mtshams mtshams su ni sred med bu'i stobs zhes gzhan dag go //🔽ston pa'i yid kyi stobs bzhin du //
analyzed: mtshams mtshams su ni sred med bu'i stobs zhes gzhan dag go // ston pa'i yid kyi stobs bzhin du //
translated: Others say that it has the strength of Narayana in each of its parts.🔽Others say that the strength of his body is like the strength of his mind,

original: lus kyi stobs kyang mtha' med pa'i stobs zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: lus kyi stobs kyang mtha' med pa'i stobs zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: and that it is infinite strength.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: ye shes kyi stobs mtha' med pa bzod par mi 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams klu mdud do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi stobs mtha' med pa bzod par mi 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams klu mdud do //
translated: the infinite strength of his knowledge would not be possible.🔽The Blessed Buddhas have the knots of the nagas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi mtshams rnams lu gu rgyud do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi mtshams rnams lu gu rgyud do //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas have the links of the chain.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i mtshams rnams lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i mtshams rnams lcags kyu'o //
translated: The Cakravartin Kings have iron hooks.

original: sred med bu'i stobs ni tha mal pa'i glang po che bcu'i stobs de ni /
analyzed: sred med bu'i stobs ni tha mal pa'i glang po che bcu'i stobs de ni /
translated: The strength of Narayana is the strength of ten ordinary elephants.

original: spos kyi glang po che gcig gi'o ;
analyzed: spos kyi glang po che gcig gi'o ;
translated: The strength of one gandhahastin is the strength of ten elephants.

original: / de bzhin du chen po che chen po dang rab gnon dang yan lag mchog dang stobs mchog dang sred med bu rnams gong nas gong du bcu 'gyur du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du chen po che chen po dang rab gnon dang yan lag mchog dang stobs mchog dang sred med bu rnams gong nas gong du bcu 'gyur du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the strength of one mahānagna, one mahānagna, one varadanta, one varabala, and one Narayana is the strength of ten of the preceding.

original: gang seng ge bzhin du bag tsha ba med par rigs pa smra ba de ni mi 'jigs pa zhes brjod do //🔽de'i ngo bo 'am yang dag ni mi 'jigs pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang seng ge bzhin du bag tsha ba med par rigs pa smra ba de ni mi 'jigs pa zhes brjod do // de'i ngo bo 'am yang dag ni mi 'jigs pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: He who speaks with certainty, without fear, like a lion, is said to be fearless.🔽Fearlessness is the nature of this, or its reality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is of four types:

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness with regard to complete knowing is the perfection of the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: de gnyis ni rang don no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rang don no //
translated: These two are for the benefit of oneself.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gegs byed pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness with regard to the hindrances is the obstacle to nirvana.

original: nges par 'byin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The one that definitely leads to deliverance is that which causes the attainment of nirvana.

original: 'di gnyis ni gzhan don te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni gzhan don te /
translated: These two are for the sake of others,

original: gzhan ched du de dag ston pas so //
analyzed: gzhan ched du de dag ston pas so //
translated: because they are taught for the sake of others.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The fearlessnesses are for the sake of both oneself and others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni chos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni chos so //
translated: The twelve branches of the Tathagata's excellent speech are the Dharma.

original: brjod bya ma lus ni don to //
analyzed: brjod bya ma lus ni don to //
translated: The totality of what is expressed is the meaning.

original: chos de rnams kyi rjod par byed pa'i ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs rnam pa mang po nges pa'i gsung ni nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi rjod par byed pa'i ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs rnam pa mang po nges pa'i gsung ni nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The many kinds of collections of names, collections of words, and collections of letters that express those Dharmas are the etymological definitions.

original: yang na rgyu'i chos thams cad ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i chos thams cad ni rgyu'o //
translated: Alternatively, all causal dharmas are the cause.

original: 'bras bu'i chos thams cad ni don no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos thams cad ni don no //
translated: All resultant dharmas are the meaning.

original: 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad ni nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad ni nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The languages of the sentient beings who are included in the six transmigrations are the etymological definitions.

original: de rnams ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: These are the correct and discerning awarenesses of the Dharma, the meaning, and the etymological definitions.

original: chos la sogs pa rnams rmongs pa la bstan pa'i ched du chos la sogs pa so so yang dag pa rig pa rnams mngon sum du gyur pa ni spobs pa'o //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa rnams rmongs pa la bstan pa'i ched du chos la sogs pa so so yang dag pa rig pa rnams mngon sum du gyur pa ni spobs pa'o //
translated: The direct realization of the analytical knowledges of Dharma, etc. for the sake of teaching the Dharma, etc. to the confused is eloquence.

original: de nyid so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the analytical knowledges.

original: gcig pus spyod pa 'di ni ma 'dres pa ste sangs rgyas rnams kho na'i 'o //
analyzed: gcig pus spyod pa 'di ni ma 'dres pa ste sangs rgyas rnams kho na'i 'o //
translated: This practice of the Buddhas alone is unshared, for it belongs to the Buddhas alone.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa de chos @299b bco brgyad de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa de chos @299b bco brgyad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: These are the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddhas.🔽What are the eighteen?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: The Tathāgatas have no error,

original: ci ltar dgra bcom pa rnams grong la sogs pa rnams su bsod snyoms kyi ched du rgyu ba na gtum po glang po che dang rta dang ba lang dang khyi dang tsher ma dang sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyi gnod pa dang / rkun ma dang stag la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jigs pa skye'o //
analyzed: ci ltar dgra bcom pa rnams grong la sogs pa rnams su bsod snyoms kyi ched du rgyu ba na gtum po glang po che dang rta dang ba lang dang khyi dang tsher ma dang sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyi gnod pa dang / rkun ma dang stag la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jigs pa skye'o //
translated: As for example, when the Arhats, etc. go to the village for alms, they are harmed by the violence of elephants, horses, bulls, dogs, thorns, snakes, etc. and they are afraid of thieves, tigers, etc.

original: de'i 'di lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nas thams cad du med do //
analyzed: de'i 'di lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nas thams cad du med do //
translated: But the Tathāgatas have none of that.

original: yang gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: The King of Spells Discourse states:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sku'i las gyi tshom med pa spyod lam dang spyod lam rnam pa bzhi rnams rab tu dang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sku'i las gyi tshom med pa spyod lam dang spyod lam rnam pa bzhi rnams rab tu dang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha has no physical faults. His four types of behavior are pure.

original: grong dang grong khyer du 'jug pa dang 'byung ba na /
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer du 'jug pa dang 'byung ba na /
translated: When he enters and leaves towns and cities,

original: zhabs kyi mthil gyis sa la mi reg cing /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil gyis sa la mi reg cing /
translated: his soles do not touch the ground.

original: sa chen po la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa chen po la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Instead, a thousand-spoked wheel appears on the ground.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i dri dang ldan pa'i padma ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i dri dang ldan pa'i padma ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A lotus with a pleasant fragrance appears.

original: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs bzhag pa de ru gang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa'i sems can de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis reg par gyur pa de dag zhag bdun du mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs bzhag pa de ru gang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa'i sems can de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis reg par gyur pa de dag zhag bdun du mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever the Tathagata places his feet, the beings who are in the animal realm and are touched by the Tathagata’s light will have supreme happiness for seven days.

original: 'phos nas lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phos nas lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After they die, they will be reborn as gods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la chos gos rnams sor bzhi'i bar gyis ma reg pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la chos gos rnams sor bzhi'i bar gyis ma reg pa nyid do //
translated: The Tathāgata’s body is not touched by the robes, even by the width of four fingers.

original: bhee ra dha'i rlung gis kyang bskyod par mi nus te /
analyzed: bhee ra dha'i rlung gis kyang bskyod par mi nus te /
translated: The wind of the gods cannot move it.

original: sku'i 'od kyis mnar med pa'i mthar thug sems can rnams bde bar byed do //
analyzed: sku'i 'od kyis mnar med pa'i mthar thug sems can rnams bde bar byed do //
translated: The light of his body extends to the very edge of the hells, bringing happiness to the sentient beings there.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la gya tshom med pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la gya tshom med pa'o zhes te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata’s body is not random.

original: rtag pa nyid du yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conceived as permanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co med pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have the babbling of an old man.

original: ci ltar dgra bcom pa nags khrod du zhugs te lam du 'gro ba na /
analyzed: ci ltar dgra bcom pa nags khrod du zhugs te lam du 'gro ba na /
translated: For example, when an arhat enters the forest and goes on the path,

original: sgra chen po sgrogs par 'gyur pa dang / bag chags kyi stobs las gad mo chen po dgod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra chen po sgrogs par 'gyur pa dang / bag chags kyi stobs las gad mo chen po dgod pa'o //
translated: he babbles loudly and laughs loudly due to the power of his latent tendencies.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not like that.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas so //
translated: Because he is always in equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have forgetfulness.

original: ci ltar dgra bcom pa mnyam par ma bzhag pas dran pa bsnyel bas bya ba mi byed cing dus las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar dgra bcom pa mnyam par ma bzhag pas dran pa bsnyel bas bya ba mi byed cing dus las 'da' ba'o //
translated: How is it that an Arhat, because of forgetfulness due to non-concentration, does not do what should be done and misses the right time?

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin du ma yin te snying rje chen po can yin pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin du ma yin te snying rje chen po can yin pas so //
translated: The Buddha is not like that, because he has great compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have non-concentration of mind.

original: ci ltar dgra bcom pa zhugs pa nyid ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin gyi dus gzhan du ni @300a * //🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dgra bcom pa zhugs pa nyid ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin gyi dus gzhan du ni @300a * // ma yin no //
translated: How is it that an Arhat, when he is in concentration, is concentrated, but not at other times?

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not like that,

original: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because he is always concentrated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have a discriminatory perception.

original: ci ltar dgra bcom pa phung po la mtha' gcig tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: ci ltar dgra bcom pa phung po la mtha' gcig tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: How is it that an Arhat has a perception of the aggregates as absolutely disagreeable and a perception of nirvāṇa as peace?

original: sangs rgyas de bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not like that,

original: rang bzhin bdag med pa nyid kyi gnyi ga ru rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin bdag med pa nyid kyi gnyi ga ru rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is non-discriminative with regard to both, because of the selflessness of things by nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa yin te /
translated: The Tathagata does not have a nondiscerning equanimity,

original: ci ltar dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags par sems can don yal bar 'dor ba ste /
analyzed: ci ltar dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags par sems can don yal bar 'dor ba ste /
translated: as do the Arhats, who abandon the welfare of sentient beings without discerning them.

original: sangs rgyas de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de ltar ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not like that.

original: de ni dus la sogs par so sor rtogs pa nyid kyis dbu mar gnas pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus la sogs par so sor rtogs pa nyid kyis dbu mar gnas pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: He abides in the middle way, not elsewhere, by virtue of his discerning activity with regard to time, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med de /
translated: The Tathagata does not have a decline in aspiration.

original: de la byams pa snying rje chos ston pa sems can 'dren pa yongs su smin pa rab tu dben pa byang chub yang dag par 'jog pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa snying rje chos ston pa sems can 'dren pa yongs su smin pa rab tu dben pa byang chub yang dag par 'jog pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the aspiration for love, compassion, teaching the Dharma, leading sentient beings, and ripening them, which is the isolation of enlightenment.

original: 'di ni nyan thos la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not found in the Sravakas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not have a decline in vigor.

original: de la gdul bya rnams kyi brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan par byed pa rnams la gdams pa smra ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de la gdul bya rnams kyi brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan par byed pa rnams la gdams pa smra ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Vigor is the vigor of those to be trained, and the vigor of giving instructions to those who listen to the Dharma.

original: de yang de gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa chos nyan par byed pa gang bskal par nyan na yang skyo ba med pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin rnyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang de gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa chos nyan par byed pa gang bskal par nyan na yang skyo ba med pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin rnyed pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, he has attained the nature of the Tathāgata, such that when he teaches the Dharma for an eon, he is never wearied.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zas rnam par spangs pa'i rgyud kyis kyang sems can la ltos pas bskal par chos bshad kyang mi bzhengs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zas rnam par spangs pa'i rgyud kyis kyang sems can la ltos pas bskal par chos bshad kyang mi bzhengs so //
translated: The Tathāgata, because he is concerned for sentient beings, does not rise from his seat even when the Dharma is being taught for an eon.

original: gang du tha na sangs rgyas gdul bya sems can gcig kyang yod par gyur pa de ru /
analyzed: gang du tha na sangs rgyas gdul bya sems can gcig kyang yod par gyur pa de ru /
translated: Wherever there is even a single sentient being to be trained,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing las kyang 'das par gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing las kyang 'das par gshegs pa'o //
translated: the Tathāgata goes there, even if it is beyond buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dran pa nyams pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dran pa nyams pa med de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have lapses of memory.

original: 'di ltar / de bzhin gshegs pa dran nas sam bsams nas sam rnam par brtags nas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de bzhin gshegs pa dran nas sam bsams nas sam rnam par brtags nas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed pa ni med do //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings after remembering, thinking, or investigating.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med de 'di lta ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s absorption is flawless.

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ci lta ba bzhin mi mnyam pa ma yin pa la mnyam par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ci lta ba bzhin mi mnyam pa ma yin pa la mnyam par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It is the absorption of equality, which is the equality of all phenomena, just as they are, without being unequal.

original: gang gi mnyam pa'i mnyam pa nyid de ni mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: gang gi mnyam pa'i mnyam pa nyid de ni mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The absorption of equality is the equality of what is equal.

original: gang mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gang mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The absorption of equality is the Thus-Gone One, who is equal.

original: @300b ci srid du khams gsum gang la yang mi brten pas mi nyams shing yongs su mi nyams so //
analyzed: @300b ci srid du khams gsum gang la yang mi brten pas mi nyams shing yongs su mi nyams so //
translated: Since he does not rely on the three realms, he is flawless and irreproachable.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa med zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa med zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the Thus-Gone One is said to be flawless in absorption.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab yongs su nyams pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab yongs su nyams pa med de /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One is flawless in insight.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni shes rab ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The insight of all phenomena is the insight of equality, which is the wisdom that does not rely on others.

original: sems can gzhan la chos ston par byed pa so sor yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa dbye ba la mkhas pa ye shes so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la chos ston par byed pa so sor yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa dbye ba la mkhas pa ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the inexhaustible analytical knowledges of the bodhisattvas is their skill in teaching the Dharma to other sentient beings.

original: tshig gcig la 'jug pas bskal pa brgya stong du byin gyis brlabs te rgyas par ston pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: tshig gcig la 'jug pas bskal pa brgya stong du byin gyis brlabs te rgyas par ston pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas is the knowledge that, by engaging in a single word, they can bless and teach extensively for a hundred thousand eons.

original: ci ltar rgyas par ston pa'i don bshad pa the tshom gcod pa theg pa rnam par gzhag pa rgyas par ston pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rgyas par ston pa'i don bshad pa the tshom gcod pa theg pa rnam par gzhag pa rgyas par ston pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas is the knowledge that, in order to teach extensively the meaning of what is taught, they can eliminate doubts and set forth the vehicles.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi gnyen po //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi gnyen po //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas is the knowledge that, as antidotes to the eighty-four thousand types of sentient beings’ mental behavior,

original: chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi mkhyen pa ci ltar 'os par chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi mkhyen pa ci ltar 'os par chos ston pa'o //
translated: they teach the Dharma in eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtha' med pa mi zad pa tshad med pa ston pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtha' med pa mi zad pa tshad med pa ston pa'i shes rab po //
translated: This is the knowledge of the tathāgatas’ infinite, inexhaustible, immeasurable teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa ste /
translated: The tathāgatas’ liberation is without decline.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni kun du 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni kun du 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par grol ba nyid do //
translated: The liberation of the Tathagata is the liberation from all grasping.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang ma 'brel phyi ma'i mthar 'pho ba ma yin da lta bar gnas pa ma yin pa rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i sems te de lta bu nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang ma 'brel phyi ma'i mthar 'pho ba ma yin da lta bar gnas pa ma yin pa rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i sems te de lta bu nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The mind is luminous by nature, not connected with the past, not moving into the future, and not abiding in the present.

original: des na skad cig gcig gis yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na skad cig gcig gis yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, in a single moment, one is endowed with the wisdom that is said to be the perfect enlightenment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: The Tathagata's physical actions are preceded by and follow after wisdom.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi las gang dang ldan pas mthong bas kyang sems can 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lus kyi las gang dang ldan pas mthong bas kyang sems can 'dul bar byed do //
translated: The Tathagata has physical actions by which he disciplines sentient beings through his mere glance.🔽He disciplines them through his mere smile.🔽He disciplines them through his mere speech.

original: gsung ba na yang cang mi gsung ba yang /
analyzed: gsung ba na yang cang mi gsung ba yang /
translated: He disciplines them through his silence.

original: gsol ba na yang /
analyzed: gsol ba na yang /
translated: He disciplines them through his mere request.

original: spyod lam rnam pa bzhis kyang mtshan bzangs kyis kyang zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: spyod lam rnam pa bzhis kyang mtshan bzangs kyis kyang zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: and also by the four kinds of correct knowledge.

original: ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: All his verbal actions are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa chos bstan pa don med cing /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / de bzhin gshegs pa chos bstan pa don med cing /
translated: This is to say,🔽the Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dharma is not meaningless or wasted,

original: chud za ba ma yin pas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngag de yang yan lag drug cu dang ldan pas @301a * //
analyzed: chud za ba ma yin pas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngag de yang yan lag drug cu dang ldan pas @301a * //
translated: and the Tathāgata’s speech is endowed with sixty aspects.

original: so // yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: so // yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rjes su 'gro ba chos thams cad la nges par 'byung ba bsgrub bya thams cad gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa dmigs pa yang dag par 'das pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rjes su 'gro ba chos thams cad la nges par 'byung ba bsgrub bya thams cad gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa dmigs pa yang dag par 'das pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba
translated: the Tathāgata’s knowledge follows the minds of all sentient beings, it is the source of the deliverance from all phenomena, it is not dependent on others with regard to all that is to be accomplished, it transcends all reference points, and it is the source of the arising of dependent origination.

original: rtogs pa srid gsum gyi 'gro bas dpag tu med pa bdud kyi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ci srid du chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rtogs pa srid gsum gyi 'gro bas dpag tu med pa bdud kyi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ci srid du chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'o zhes so //
translated: The realization is immeasurable to all beings in the three worlds, and it is beyond all the paths of Māra. It is as vast as the realm of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i dus las ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i dus las ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug go //
translated: The Tathāgata’s wisdom vision extends to the past without impediment or obstruction.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ci snyed du de rnams kyi rtsva dang sdong po la sogs pa ci snyed dang de'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ci snyed dang chos ston pa'i snyed dang bdag dang gzhan gyi sems gang gis de ma thag tu sems gang skyes pa de dag
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ci snyed du de rnams kyi rtsva dang sdong po la sogs pa ci snyed dang de'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ci snyed dang chos ston pa'i snyed dang bdag dang gzhan gyi sems gang gis de ma thag tu sems gang skyes pa de dag
translated: He knows the number of buddhafields, the number of grasses and trees, etc. in them, the number of buddhas in them, the number of Dharma teachings, and the number of beings’ minds, both their own and others’.

original: thams cad kyi rtsis kyi sbyor bas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rtsis kyi sbyor bas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows all of this through the application of his calculations.

original: de yang mngon sum shes pas yin gyi rjes su shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum shes pas yin gyi rjes su shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: This is through his direct knowledge, not through his inferential knowledge.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus lam chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus lam chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug go //
translated: The Tathāgata’s wisdom vision extends to the future without impediment or obstruction.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: zhing ngam sems can gang su dag 'byung bar 'gyur pa /
analyzed: zhing ngam sems can gang su dag 'byung bar 'gyur pa /
translated: Whatever fields or sentient beings will arise,

original: sems gang gis de ma thag tu sems gang skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad rtsis kyi sbyor bas rab tu shes so zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: sems gang gis de ma thag tu sems gang skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad rtsis kyi sbyor bas rab tu shes so zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: whatever mind will immediately give rise to whatever mind, all of that is known by the application of calculation.

original: de ltar pa'i dus lam chags ma thigs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar pa'i dus lam chags ma thigs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the wisdom vision of the uninterrupted continuum of time engages.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gang de ltar phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de rnams shes so //🔽chos thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas nyan thos thams cad ci srid du rigs mdog thams cad dang sa chu la sogs pa'i khams rdul phra rab kyi cha chad pa ci srid du skra'i rtse mo bye ba'i char tshud pa ci srid du dmyal
analyzed: gang de ltar phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de rnams shes so // chos thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas nyan thos thams cad ci srid du rigs mdog thams cad dang sa chu la sogs pa'i khams rdul phra rab kyi cha chad pa ci srid du skra'i rtse mo bye ba'i char tshud pa ci srid du dmyal
translated: One knows those buddha fields in the ten directions.

original: ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar grub pa sems can gyi khams rnams shes so zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar grub pa sems can gyi khams rnams shes so zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: One knows all phenomena, all bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas, as long as all types of colors, the elements of earth, water, and so on, and the parts of subtle particles, as long as they are included in the tip of a hundred thousandth of a hair, and as long as the realms of sentient beings established in the realms of hell🔽and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i shes pa med do //
translated: The Tathagata does not have a cognition that follows the dualistic path.

original: gnyis su med pa la zhugs pa'i don du sems can rnams la dam pa'i chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la zhugs pa'i don du sems can rnams la dam pa'i chos ston par byed do //
translated: He teaches the true Dharma to sentient beings in order to introduce them to the nondualistic path.

original: de la dang po ni lus kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni lus kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The first of these is the purification of physical action.

original: gnyis pa ni ngag gi las yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngag gi las yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The second is the purification of verbal action.

original: gzhan bzhin yid kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan bzhin yid kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The third is the purification of mental action.

original: de las gzhan @301b drug ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rnams rten dang bcas pa 'bras bu bcas pa rnams mthob  pa med pas dang thob pa rnams nyams pa med pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan @301b drug ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rnams rten dang bcas pa 'bras bu bcas pa rnams mthob  pa med pas dang thob pa rnams nyams pa med pas so //
translated: The other six are the Tathagata's faculties, together with their supports and results, because they are not lost and because they are not diminished.

original: de rten ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de rten ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The support of these is will.

original: 'bras bu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The result is liberation.

original: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faculties are vigor, etc.

original: de las gzhan gsum ni lus dang ngag yid rnams kyi las rnams ye shes kyis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan gsum ni lus dang ngag yid rnams kyi las rnams ye shes kyis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid do //
translated: The other three are the actions of body, speech, and mind, which are blessed by gnosis.

original: ye shes rgyu yin pa nyid kyis dang ye shes dang lhan cig tu spyod pas so //
analyzed: ye shes rgyu yin pa nyid kyis dang ye shes dang lhan cig tu spyod pas so //
translated: Because it is the cause of pristine wisdom and because it is the companion of pristine wisdom.

original: de las gzhan gsum ni dus gsum lam chags ma thogs pa nyid kyi ye shes so zhes so //
analyzed: de las gzhan gsum ni dus gsum lam chags ma thogs pa nyid kyi ye shes so zhes so //
translated: The other three are pristine wisdoms that are not obstructed in the three times.

original: de rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dris pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: de rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dris pa bco brgyad do //
translated: These are the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs las zag pa med pa'i chos rnam par nges pa zhes byang le'u nye shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i tshul lugs las zag pa med pa'i chos rnam par nges pa zhes byang le'u nye shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /
translated: The great pandit Dasabalaśrībhadra composed the Asamskrtasiddhī, which is the twenty-eighth chapter of the Asamskrtasamskrtidharmanirnaya from the Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra.
